releasenotes.title: ReleaseNotes
body:
VERSION 2.0.1

**ADDITIONS:**

-Added the JetPack, a new jacket.
-Added the A=IdUser, A=NameUser, A=Swap, and A=Sub instructions to Computers. -Added specific OilRock formations to Earth and other planets with Oil.
-Added a new PvP mode: PowerUps.
-Added a sound effect for equipping a jacket.
-Added an Automaton order to unequip jackets.

**CHANGES:**

-Monitors can no longer display player input letters due to the ROBLOX Age Segregation update. -BaseCenter names and Sign text will disable January 7th due to the ROBLOX Age Segregation update. -Text can no longer be written on Books due to the ROBLOX Age Segregation update. -Chatbox now shows system messages again for victims of the ROBLOX Age Segregation update. -Viewing saved Computer programs is now restricted due to the ROBLOX Age Segregation update. -Changed function of Beacon of Telepathy due to the ROBLOX Age Segregation update. -Reduced blast power of small explosions.
-Reduced horizontal force of very small Rotors.
-Reduced eternal bouncing tendency of TorqueSprings.
-Computer "affix" and CMOS "affix" can now concatenate strings.
-Computer "encrypt" now prevents programs from reading the file.
-Lava chunks can no longer be inserted into Crates or Catapults for instant Stone. -Underground Sentry Key locations no longer change when the server restarts. -Hammer's Config tool now displays a list of available substations when configuring Conduits. -Restored the Propeller blur effect which was ruined by a deleted asset several updates ago. -EnergyCannons can no longer fire when blocked by an object.

**FIXES:**

-Fixed Rockets not working below Y=0 in space when an ocean is present on the planet. -Fixed Skirmish not always recovering from illegal models properly.
-Fixed script crashes caused by a ROBLOX update when parts are reloaded after an event. -Fixed Safe BaseCenters un-Securing themselves when parts are reloaded.
-Fixed templates losing attached constraints when spawned in models.
-Fixed screenshake from volcanic eruptions reaching into space.
-Fixed player thermometer briefly showing planet surface temperature when respawning in space. -Fixed Wings and CrudeWings sinking below Y=0 on planets without an ocean. -Fixed certain jackets not triggering the help popup when equipped.
-Fixed depleted surface ores taking longer to regenerate than intended.
-Fixed an exploit with Rogues.
-Fixed an exploit with captured Rogues.
releasenotes.rawBody:
<font color="rgb(0,255,0)">VERSION 2.0.1</font>

<font color="rgb(255,255,0)">ADDITIONS:</font>

-Added the JetPack, a new jacket.
-Added the A=IdUser, A=NameUser, A=Swap, and A=Sub instructions to Computers.
-Added specific OilRock formations to Earth and other planets with Oil.
-Added a new PvP mode: PowerUps.
-Added a sound effect for equipping a jacket.
-Added an Automaton order to unequip jackets.

<font color="rgb(255,255,0)">CHANGES:</font>

-Monitors can no longer display player input letters due to the ROBLOX Age Segregation update.
-BaseCenter names and Sign text will disable January 7th due to the ROBLOX Age Segregation update.
-Text can no longer be written on Books due to the ROBLOX Age Segregation update.
-Chatbox now shows system messages again for victims of the ROBLOX Age Segregation update.
-Viewing saved Computer programs is now restricted due to the ROBLOX Age Segregation update.
-Changed function of Beacon of Telepathy due to the ROBLOX Age Segregation update.
-Reduced blast power of small explosions.
-Reduced horizontal force of very small Rotors.
-Reduced eternal bouncing tendency of TorqueSprings.
-Computer "affix" and CMOS "affix" can now concatenate strings.
-Computer "encrypt" now prevents programs from reading the file.
-Lava chunks can no longer be inserted into Crates or Catapults for instant Stone.
-Underground Sentry Key locations no longer change when the server restarts.
-Hammer's Config tool now displays a list of available substations when configuring Conduits.
-Restored the Propeller blur effect which was ruined by a deleted asset several updates ago.
-EnergyCannons can no longer fire when blocked by an object.

<font color="rgb(255,255,0)">FIXES:</font>

-Fixed Rockets not working below Y=0 in space when an ocean is present on the planet.
-Fixed Skirmish not always recovering from illegal models properly.
-Fixed script crashes caused by a ROBLOX update when parts are reloaded after an event.
-Fixed Safe BaseCenters un-Securing themselves when parts are reloaded.
-Fixed templates losing attached constraints when spawned in models.
-Fixed screenshake from volcanic eruptions reaching into space.
-Fixed player thermometer briefly showing planet surface temperature when respawning in space.
-Fixed Wings and CrudeWings sinking below Y=0 on planets without an ocean.
-Fixed certain jackets not triggering the help popup when equipped.
-Fixed depleted surface ores taking longer to regenerate than intended.
-Fixed an exploit with Rogues.
-Fixed an exploit with captured Rogues.

respirator.title: Respirator
body:
Respirators create an invisible pocket of breathable, conditioned air when connected to a CompressedAir supply. Though useless on the surface of a planet, it allows players to survive at high altitudes and in space. The size of the Respirator determines the size of the breathable area (between 50 and 200 studs in radius) and air supply usage.

Respirator air does not block cosmic radiation, which kills quickly without an enclosed cabin or a SpaceSuit.
respirator.rawBody:
Respirators create an invisible pocket of breathable, conditioned air when connected to

area (between 50 and 200 studs in radius) and air supply usage.

Respirator air does not block cosmic radiation, which kills quickly without an enclosed cabin
or a SpaceSuit.

aluminium.title: Aluminium
body:
Aluminium is a lightweight, light grey metal acquired from Aluminium ore.
It is fairly weak, but is as light as Wood, and so a good material for aircraft and less-advanced spacecraft.
aluminium.rawBody:
Aluminium is a lightweight, light grey metal acquired from Aluminium ore.
It is fairly weak, but is as light as Wood, and so a good material for aircraft and
less-advanced spacecraft.

anchor.title: Anchor
body:
Anchors attempt to stop the motion of anything they are connected to. Click or signal to toggle the Anchor on or off. If connected to any kind of space engine, the Anchor will automatically activate when the engine is active and vice versa. Anchors in this mode still allow free rotation.

Anchors do not physically anchor if spawned during the Apocalypse GreatFreeze event.

Anchors do not physically anchor if spawned during the Apocalypse GreatFreeze event.

antenna.title: Antenna
body: Antennas wirelessly transfer electrical energy (with a maximum range of 120 studs) and data signals (unlimited range) to other Antennas of the same ID. Use the Hammer's Config tool to set the Antenna ID. Antennas turn green if there is a valid connection.
antenna.rawBody:
Antennas wirelessly transfer electrical energy (with a maximum range of 120 studs) and data
signals (unlimited range) to other Antennas of the same ID. Use the Hammer's Config tool to
set the Antenna ID. Antennas turn green if there is a valid connection.

ashes.title: Ashes
body: Ashes have a chance to be created when burning large parts.
ashes.rawBody: Ashes have a chance to be created when burning large parts.

asphalt.title: Asphalt
body: Asphalt is a heavy, medium-strength part with high friction and malleability. It can be used as a building material, or more commonly long roads.
asphalt.rawBody:
Asphalt is a heavy, medium-strength part with high friction and malleability. It can be used 
as a building material, or more commonly long roads.

speaker.title: Speaker
body: A Speaker produces a sound when signaled, selectable with the Hammer's Config Tool. The Speaker's volume is controlled by it's size (maximum volume: 4x5x4).
speaker.rawBody:
A Speaker produces a sound when signaled, selectable with the Hammer's Config Tool.
The Speaker's volume is controlled by it's size (maximum volume: 4x5x4).

iondrive.title: IonDrive
body:
An IonDrive is a type of spaceship engine, converting energy to force.

The IonDrive's best ability is that it has an unlimited weight capacity and can
propel any size ship. It also has a good amount of speed, though it is bulky.
iondrive.rawBody:
An IonDrive is a type of spaceship engine, converting energy to force.

The IonDrive's best ability is that it has an unlimited weight capacity and can
propel any size ship. It also has a good amount of speed, though it is bulky.

button.title: Button
body:
Buttons send signals to connected parts when clicked. When clicked directly, the data sent will be the name of the player who clicked. Mode 5 Sensors can also activate Buttons, but the Button activated will not activate connected Sensors.

Configure the Button to set a keybind. If set to a keybind, the button will not be clickable: instead, attach to a Seat or SteeringSeat, and any player who sits in the seat 
and presses the keybind will signal the button. Most alphanumeric, system, and arrow keys can be used.

When setting keybinds, you must spell out any non-letter characters in words. Any unrecognized input will show as "unknown".
Examples: 8 = eight, Enter = return, Ctrl = leftcontrol or rightcontrol, ; = semicolon.

computer.title: Computer
body:
Due to ROBLOX Age Segregation, letters from player input are now hidden.

A Computer is a machine capable of running YewScript programs to display graphics, control machines, or manipulate data. See the Programming help menu page for more information on the YewScript language.

In most cases, Computers should have a Keyboard and Monitor connected to interact with them, but these are not required. Commands are entered using the Keyboard, and programs can also be run by directly signaling them to the Computer. See the "Keyboard" help page for more info on keyboard buttons.

Programs saved on Computers cannot be viewed by other players and will become unviewable if the creator leaves the game or if the world is reloaded.

**SIGNAL CHANNELS**

-Channel 0-9: Signal/internet channels. Use Polysilicon set to mode 0-9 for signaling.
-Channel 10: Keyboard data entry input.
-Channel 11: Keyboard keystrokes.
-Channel 12: Web server queries.
-Channel 13: Secure bank transfer channel.

**CLUSTERS**

Powered, idle Computers attached directly (or through others) to one that a program is run on will cluster them and increase the processing speed of the active Computer.

camera.title: Camera
body:
Cameras wirelessly connect to Televisions to display their video feed.

Use the Hammer's Config Tool to set the channel of a Television and a Camera to the same number, and click the Television to see the Camera's view. Only the Television requires energy. Press X or walk away from the Television to stop viewing.

Attach Rubies to a Camera for space telescope mode, allowing the Camera to see much farther than normally possible. Press I and O to zoom (default is zoomed all the way in). The maximum zoom level can be increased by attaching more Rubies. This ability only works in space.

Attach a piece of Curium to the Camera for x-ray mode, allowing the Camera to see through the part it is facing. This ability overrides space telescope mode.
camera.rawBody:
Cameras wirelessly connect to Televisions to display their video feed.

Use the Hammer's Config Tool to set the channel of a Television and a Camera to the same 
number, and click the Television to see the Camera's view. Only the Television requires
energy. Press X or walk away from the Television to stop viewing.

Attach Rubies to a Camera for space telescope mode, allowing the Camera to see much farther
than normally possible. Press I and O to zoom (default is zoomed all the way in). The maximum
zoom level can be increased by attaching more Rubies. This ability only works in space.

Attach a piece of Curium to the Camera for x-ray mode, allowing the Camera to see through the
part it is facing. This ability overrides space telescope mode.

cannon.title: Cannon
body:
A Cannon is a highly customizable gunpowder weapon, the next tier from Catapults. They must be linked to an Ammo Container and have an ammunition part inserted to function, and do not fire underwater. Both the Cannon and ammo part must be unlocked to insert. Signal or click on a Cannon to fire it. If the Cannon is locked, its projectiles will not damage parts locked by the same player. Cannons are less effective when large numbers are used at once.

The performance and effects of Cannons are determined by the projectile type (set with the Hammer's Config tool), inserted ammunition type, width, and length.

Width: Slows firing rate and increases ammo usage, but fires stronger/more projectiles.
Length: Increases range.

**PROJECTILE TYPES:**

0. Round: Normal shot (Shell for Titanium/Nitroglycerin/Uranium).
1. Disc: Moves fast and glides in the air when fired upwards, but less damage.
2. Barrel: Higher damage, but inaccurate and slower reload.
3. Scatter Round: Scattering Rounds, higher ammo usage. (Shell for Titanium/Nitroglycerin/Uranium).
4. Scatter Disc: Scattering Discs, higher ammo usage.
5. Scatter Barrel: Scattering Barrels, higher ammo usage.
6. Harpoon: Long range but slower fire rate. Harpoon is fixed-size; the Cannon must be at 
least 2 studs wide. Copper Harpoon becomes a roped grapple hook that sticks into ground or weak parts.

**VICTORIAN AMMUNITIONS:**

-Iron: Standard, relatively high damage.
-Copper: Faster reload and low ammo usage, but lower damage.
-Gold: High damage, but slow reload, massive amount of ammo used, and less range.
-Glass: Shatters on impact, damaging unprotected players nearby. Lower ammo usage.
-Oil: Less impact damage, but has a small chance to set targets on fire.
-Dynamite: Medium-strength explosive, higher ammo usage.

**MODERN AMMUNITIONS:**

-Nitroglycerin: Devastating explosive, but slow reload and very high ammo usage.
-Titanium: Stronger than Iron and travels fast, but slightly higher ammo usage.
-Uranium: Armor-piercing; can cause damage underneath an armor layer. Higher ammo usage.

**POSTMODERN AMMUNITIONS:**

footerData.name: -Zaktralia
footerData.desc: Plasma splash. High damage, fast reload, and floating. Higher ammo usage.

charcoal.title: Charcoal
body:
Charcoal is a small part that is sometimes obtained from burning Wood.

Charcoal attached to Explosives will catch fire when detonated, acting as firebrands.
charcoal.rawBody:
Charcoal is a small part that is sometimes obtained from burning Wood.

Charcoal attached to Explosives will catch fire when detonated, acting as firebrands.

cloth.title: Cloth
body: Cloth is a weak and light material which has a thickness of 0.2 studs. It can absorb Mercury or Oil on contact and produces smoke when burned after absorbing Oil.
cloth.rawBody:
Cloth is a weak and light material which has a thickness of 0.2 studs. It can absorb Mercury
or Oil on contact and produces smoke when burned after absorbing Oil.

coat.title: Coat
body: Coats help regulate temperature for the player wearing them, though not as efficiently as PolyesterCoats. Touch with your character to wear it.
coat.rawBody:
Coats help regulate temperature for the player wearing them, though not as efficiently 
as PolyesterCoats. Touch with your character to wear it.

converter.title: Converter
body:
Converters are used to make copies of buildings and other structures for stacking or placement elsewhere. To use, place the Converter near an unlocked structure, and use the Hammer's Config tool to set the Save value to 1. Within 100 studs, structure parts will be saved into the Converter. Vehicles and other complex machines cannot be saved; only basic structure parts (such as Wood, Abantium, Glass, etc) and some simple electronic parts will be detected.

After saving a structure, it may be reloaded using credits. Click on the Converter to insert credits for the cost of the structure, and the copied structure will be generated relative to the Converter's position once the required amount is filled. An additional 20% fee applies to the credit price. The structure that is loaded will be stacked on top of any obstacles in the way, making it possible to create skyscrapers by stacking the same room.

Converters cannot save more than 50 parts at a time, and the structure data is not saved between servers. If locked, only the player who locked will be able to insert credits. They cannot operate if the owner owns more than 300 parts in the server.

Converted parts are unable to be used in manufacturing or other processes.

copper.title: Copper
body: Copper is an orange metal acquired from Copper mines. It has fairly low strength but high malleability.
copper.rawBody: Copper is an orange metal acquired from Copper mines. It has fairly low strength but high malleability.

footerData.name: Obtained
footerData.desc: Copper Mines (sometimes found on rocks or stony surfaces)

crudewing.title: CrudeWing
body:
CrudeWings create aerodynamic lift when moved forward (in the direction of the black decal). The lift force depends on the speed and size of the CrudeWing. Thickness beyond 4 studs does not contribute to lift. Pitch the CrudeWing up and down to control vertical speed.

CrudeWings do not function inside other wings and break if subjected to extreme horizontal speeds.
crudewing.rawBody:
CrudeWings create aerodynamic lift when moved forward (in the direction of the black decal). The lift 
force depends on the speed and size of the CrudeWing. Thickness beyond 4 studs does not contribute
to lift. Pitch the CrudeWing up and down to control vertical speed.

CrudeWings do not function inside other wings and break if subjected to extreme horizontal speeds.

diamond.title: Diamond
body: Diamonds are small, transparent gems used in several item recipes. They are among the strongest materials on Earth, but their small size limits their usefulness in construction.
diamond.rawBody:
Diamonds are small, transparent gems used in several item recipes. They are among the 
strongest materials on Earth, but their small size limits their usefulness in construction.

dynamite.title: Dynamite
body: Dynamite is a special type of explosive that gets more powerful as more are attached to each other. It is activated by signaling, or setting on fire.
dynamite.rawBody:
Dynamite is a special type of explosive that gets more powerful as more are attached to
each other. It is activated by signaling, or setting on fire.

energybomb.title: EnergyBomb
body:
EnergyBombs are bombs that release shockwaves of charged particles when signaled. The shockwaves are highly powerful and instantly incinerate most materials.

EnergyBomb shockwaves cannot travel through parts. Make sure there is a clear, open path between the bomb and the target when used.
energybomb.rawBody:
EnergyBombs are bombs that release shockwaves of charged particles when signaled. The
shockwaves are highly powerful and instantly incinerate most materials.

EnergyBomb shockwaves cannot travel through parts. Make sure there is a clear, open
path between the bomb and the target when used.

footerData.name: Recipe
footerData.desc: Aluminium, Gold, Neodymium, Ruby, Titanium, Uranium

engine.title: Engine
body:
The Engine is an internal combustion motor that converts Diesel or Gas into motion.

Parts attached to the hinge on the Engine will spin at a speed that can be set with the Hammer's Config Tool or an attached Controller. The size of the Engine increases torque and maximum speed, but also fuel usage and inertia. Speed level 1 is idle speed, and does not transmit power to the hinge. They can still run underwater if slightly below the surface.

Gas-powered Engines have a higher maximum speed than their Diesel-powered counterparts and require less fuel.

Nitroglycerin fed into an Engine, along with the normal fuel, greatly increases power output but causes damage with prolonged use.

Engines that take damage can be repaired using the Wrench tool.

Linking with a RodConstraint to a DriveBox creates a driveshaft that can turn the DriveBox's hinge.

enricheduranium.title: EnrichedUranium
body:
EnrichedUranium is a radioactive metal used to create Warheads and Plutonium. Warheads with pieces of EnrichedUranium attached create longer lasting radioactive fallout when detonated. See the "Warhead" page for details.

Connecting a Generator to EnrichedUranium generates a small amount of energy.
enricheduranium.rawBody:

of EnrichedUranium attached create longer lasting radioactive fallout when detonated. See the "Warhead"
page for details.

Connecting a Generator to EnrichedUranium generates a small amount of energy.

footerData.name: Obtained
footerData.desc: Inserting 2 pieces of Uranium into a Lab, Curium/Uranium reaction in Reactors

explosives.title: Explosives
body:
Explosives is a powerful bomb that can be resized to modify the explosion power. It is activated by signaling, or setting on fire.

Explosives explosions cannot travel through parts. Make sure there is a clear, open path between the bomb and the target when used.

Charcoal attached to Explosives will catch fire when the Explosives are detonated.
explosives.rawBody:
Explosives is a powerful bomb that can be resized to modify the explosion power.
It is activated by signaling, or setting on fire.

Explosives explosions cannot travel through parts. Make sure there is a clear, open
path between the bomb and the target when used.

Charcoal attached to Explosives will catch fire when the Explosives are detonated.

factory.title: Factory
body:
A Factory creates a constant supply of raw materials. Insert any basic material into the Factory, and it will supply that item to anyone who is manufacturing an item less than 600 studs away, as well as spawning in models. Each Factory has a 5-second delay before supplying a new part to any player; build more Factories to supply faster.

In teamed Events, Factories cannot by used by an enemy team, and must be within 600 studs of the respective team's BaseCenter to function.

**LIST OF FACTORIABLE ITEMS:**

Abantium, Cotton, Wood, Stone, Ice, Copper, Iron, Silicon, Gold, 
Flint, Diamond, Eridanium, Aluminium, Titanium, Glass, Leaves, Magnesium,
Sand, Ashes, Ruby, Quartz, Oil, Lirvanite, Charcoal, Sulfur

firewood.title: Firewood
body: Firewood is a variant of Wood that burns for longer, and is much weaker.
firewood.rawBody: Firewood is a variant of Wood that burns for longer, and is much weaker.

firework.title: Firework
body: Fireworks launch into the air and burst into colorful fragments when signaled. Size, color, and the height setting (set with the Hammer's Config tool) modify the effects.
firework.rawBody:
Fireworks launch into the air and burst into colorful fragments when signaled. Size, 
color, and the height setting (set with the Hammer's Config tool) modify the effects.

flint.title: Flint
body:
Flint has a small chance to set fire to parts that are rubbed against it. It can be
used as a crude firestarter, or a crude weapon to use against flammable objects. When mining for Stone, there is a chance to get Flint as well as the Stone.

Flint has a small chance to set fire to parts that are rubbed against it. It can be
used as a crude firestarter, or a crude weapon to use against flammable objects.
When mining for Stone, there is a chance to get Flint as well as the Stone.

forcefield.title: ForceField
body: ForceFields are extremely strong while powered, and they become noncolliding when power is turned off.
forcefield.rawBody:
ForceFields are extremely strong while powered, and they become noncolliding when power is 
turned off.

pipe.title: Pipe
body:
Pipes transfer liquid from a Container.

When two Pipes are connected with Rope, the Rope becomes a Hose and can transfer the liquid.
pipe.rawBody:
Pipes transfer liquid from a Container.

When two Pipes are connected with Rope, the Rope becomes a Hose and can transfer the
liquid.

controller.title: Controller
body:
A Controller is used to modify the speed, direction, or height settings of several items in the game. They also can transfer substances (usually a fuel) similar to a Pipe.

When connected to any type of motor or engine, the Controller can be used to control the speed and direction. Can also control the speed of spaceship drives.

Controllers are the only way to control the height of Balloons and BallastTanks. 

Polysilicon can be used to control the Controller with signals.
controller.rawBody:
A Controller is used to modify the speed, direction, or height settings of several items 
in the game. They also can transfer substances (usually a fuel) similar to a Pipe.

When connected to any type of motor or engine, the Controller can be used to control 
the speed and direction. Can also control the speed of spaceship drives.

Controllers are the only way to control the height of Balloons and BallastTanks. 

Polysilicon can be used to control the Controller with signals.

container.title: Container
body:
Containers hold powders, liquids, or gases, and prevent them from evaporating.

When connected to Pipe or Valve, it will transfer the substance through it. Faucets (which are connected directly or through Pipes) will release liquids and gases from the Container. Item and model recipes can directly use substances in nearby Containers.

Containers are also used for supplying ammunition to Cannons, Guns, and Launchers. They will auto-configure to the ammo type of the first connected weapon, and cannot be mixed.

Use the Hammer's Config tool to set the Container's substance filter, which prevents it from being filled with a substance other than the one set. Containers with a substance filter of Ammo will be automatically filled with Ammo in loaded models, increasing the model's cost accordingly.

Certain substances give the Container special properties:
-Nitroglycerin: Explodes on hard impacts if filled with at least 10 Nitroglycerin.
-ProtaliumOxide: Generates power for connected energy cells.
-Acid: Gets rid of unwelded parts that the Container touches.

Dipping an empty Container underwater for long enough will fill the Container with Water.
container.rawBody:
Containers hold powders, liquids, or gases, and prevent them from evaporating.

When connected to Pipe or Valve, it will transfer the substance through it. Faucets (which
are connected directly or through Pipes) will release liquids and gases from the Container.
Item and model recipes can directly use substances in nearby Containers.

Containers are also used for supplying ammunition to Cannons, Guns, and Launchers. They
will auto-configure to the ammo type of the first connected weapon, and cannot be mixed.

Use the Hammer's Config tool to set the Container's substance filter, which prevents it
from being filled with a substance other than the one set. Containers with a substance

Dipping an empty Container underwater for long enough will fill the Container with Water.

gear.title: Gear
body: Gears are iron wheels that gain teeth when clicked. They can mesh with other gears for mechanical uses. Once clicked, Gears cannot be dragged.
gear.rawBody:
Gears are iron wheels that gain teeth when clicked. They can mesh with other gears 
for mechanical uses. Once clicked, Gears cannot be dragged.

generator.title: Generator
body:
Generators collect energy from running Engines, SteamEngines, Turbofans, Turboshafts, PowerPlants, StirlingEngines, and pedal SteeringSeats that are attached. This will also increase consumption of Diesel/Gas/Steam at low speeds.

They can also generate power from an attached piece of Uranium. The energy output is far lower than a standard Reactor and can expose the user to radiation, but lasts indefinitely.

NOTE: Non-Uranium Generators will slowly overheat and catch fire if left running in the 
same area for too long. A ticking noise will be heard when overheating is imminent, and the temperature can be seen by the color of the part itself.
generator.rawBody:
Generators collect energy from running Engines, SteamEngines, Turbofans, Turboshafts, 
PowerPlants, StirlingEngines, and pedal SteeringSeats that are attached. This will also
increase consumption of Diesel/Gas/Steam at low speeds.

They can also generate power from an attached piece of Uranium. The energy output is far 
lower than a standard Reactor and can expose the user to radiation, but lasts indefinitely.

NOTE: Non-Uranium Generators will slowly overheat and catch fire if left running in the 
same area for too long. A ticking noise will be heard when overheating is imminent, and the
temperature can be seen by the color of the part itself.

glass.title: Glass
body:
Glass is a weak transparent material that is easily shattered but blocks BeamCannon lasers.

The front and back surfaces of Glass are smooth and will not weld to other smooth surfaces.
glass.rawBody:
Glass is a weak transparent material that is easily shattered but blocks BeamCannon lasers.

The front and back surfaces of Glass are smooth and will not weld to other smooth surfaces.

gold.title: Gold
body: Gold is a very heavy, weak, and malleable yellow metal.
gold.rawBody: Gold is a very heavy, weak, and malleable yellow metal.

footerData.name: Obtained
footerData.desc: Gold Mines (sometimes found on rocks or stony surfaces)

goo.title: Goo
body:
Goo is a sticky part which welds itself to items that touch it, similar to how arrows stick into parts. Goo must be connected to at least one part to function, and releases anything stuck to it when signaled.

Use the Hammer's Config tool to set options:
0 = Sticks to parts and terrain.
1 = Sticks to parts only (default).
2 = Sticks to terrain only.
[item] = Enter a part name for the Goo to stick only to parts of that type.

Goo cannot stick to transparent parts such as Glass or parts locked by a different player unless the locked part is also Goo.
goo.rawBody:
Goo is a sticky part which welds itself to items that touch it, similar to how arrows
stick into parts. Goo must be connected to at least one part to function, and releases
anything stuck to it when signaled.

Use the Hammer's Config tool to set options:
0 = Sticks to parts and terrain.
1 = Sticks to parts only (default).
2 = Sticks to terrain only.
[item] = Enter a part name for the Goo to stick only to parts of that type.

Goo cannot stick to transparent parts such as Glass or parts locked by a different player
unless the locked part is also Goo.

gunpowder.title: Gunpowder
body:
Gunpowder is a weak explosive that detonates from nearby heat sources.
It is not powerful enough to cause a decent amount of damage, and is more useful for manufacturing other items, such as tool weapons.
gunpowder.rawBody:
Gunpowder is a weak explosive that detonates from nearby heat sources.
It is not powerful enough to cause a decent amount of damage, and is more useful for
manufacturing other items, such as tool weapons.

gyro.title: Gyro
body: Gyros rotate to keep themselves upright when powered. They can be signaled to turn on or off.
gyro.rawBody:
Gyros rotate to keep themselves upright when powered. They can be signaled to turn on
or off.

heater.title: Heater
body:
Heaters warm nearby players depending on the ambient temperature to maintain a comfortable environment. The effective radius is made larger by resizing the Heater larger, but this increases power usage.

They can also heat Containers of Water into HeatedWater, but not into Steam.
heater.rawBody:
Heaters warm nearby players depending on the ambient temperature to maintain a comfortable
environment. The effective radius is made larger by resizing the Heater larger, but this 
increases power usage.

They can also heat Containers of Water into HeatedWater, but not into Steam.

radar.title: Radar
body:
A Radar constantly scans the surrounding area for vehicles, missiles, and other items, displaying their relative positions. Objects are displayed as the following:

-Green arrow: Radar's location and direction
-Pink diamond: Nonmoving object
-Pink arrow: Moving object
-Cyan circle: Marker
-House: BaseCenter
-Trefoil: Warhead in motion

A number is displayed on each object showing their relative altitude. Radars work in different ways depending on where they are located:

-Default: Radar. Cannot detect objects 30+ studs below ocean surface.
-Underwater: Sonar. Cannot detect objects 30+ studs above ocean surface.
-Space: Space Radar. Detects all objects and range is quadrupled.

Warheads, BaseCenters, and markers are always shown regardless of the Radar type.

Signal position data in the form of X;Y;Z to a Radar to display a marker for that position (if in range). Any signal that is not position data deletes the marker.
radar.rawBody:
A Radar constantly scans the surrounding area for vehicles, missiles, and other items,
displaying their relative positions. Objects are displayed as the following:

-Green arrow: Radar's location and direction
-Pink diamond: Nonmoving object
-Pink arrow: Moving object
-Cyan circle: Marker
-House: BaseCenter
-Trefoil: Warhead in motion

A number is displayed on each object showing their relative altitude. Radars work in
different ways depending on where they are located:

-Default: Radar. Cannot detect objects 30+ studs below ocean surface.
-Underwater: Sonar. Cannot detect objects 30+ studs above ocean surface.
-Space: Space Radar. Detects all objects and range is quadrupled.

Warheads, BaseCenters, and markers are always shown regardless of the Radar type.

Signal position data in the form of X;Y;Z to a Radar to display a marker for that

hyperdrive.title: HyperDrive
body:
HyperDrives allow extremely rapid travel through space in the direction they are facing, consuming an ever-increasing amount of power the longer they are active. Power and signal the HyperDrive to activate or deactivate.

HyperDrives cannot be activated in a planet's atmosphere and are destroyed if entering one while in operation.
hyperdrive.rawBody:
HyperDrives allow extremely rapid travel through space in the direction they are facing, consuming 
an ever-increasing amount of power the longer they are active. Power and signal the HyperDrive to
activate or deactivate.

HyperDrives cannot be activated in a planet's atmosphere and are destroyed if entering one while
in operation.

ice.title: Ice
body: Ice is frozen water. It's slippery and quickly melts if exposed to fire, becoming Water in any attached Containers.
ice.rawBody:
Ice is frozen water. It's slippery and quickly melts if exposed to fire, becoming Water in
any attached Containers.

inverter.title: Inverter
body: Inverters are meant to be connected between a set of energy cells and a load (such as a Light, Motor, or an entire power grid). They automatically select a non-empty energy cell to power the load, enabling use of multiple cells on one circuit.
inverter.rawBody:
Inverters are meant to be connected between a set of energy cells and a load (such as
a Light, Motor, or an entire power grid). They automatically select a non-empty energy
cell to power the load, enabling use of multiple cells on one circuit.

ionrocket.title: IonRocket
body:
An IonRocket is a type of spaceship engine, converting energy to force.

IonRockets, like LiquidNitrogen Rockets, are too weak to be very useful in a gravity field (such as launching from Earth) and are best used for mid-space travel in zero gravity. They are slower than other space engine types, but are compact and silent.
ionrocket.rawBody:
An IonRocket is a type of spaceship engine, converting energy to force.

IonRockets, like LiquidNitrogen Rockets, are too weak to be very useful in a gravity
field (such as launching from Earth) and are best used for mid-space travel in zero
gravity. They are slower than other space engine types, but are compact and silent.

iron.title: Iron
body: Iron is a heavy, dark gray metal with fairly high strength.
iron.rawBody: Iron is a heavy, dark gray metal with fairly high strength.

footerData.name: Obtained
footerData.desc: Iron Mines (sometimes found on rocks or stony surfaces)

lamp.title: Lamp
body:
A Lamp is a dim but infinite light source that can be clicked to light or put out.

Lamps will go out if there are no players nearby for a certain amount of time, but they can easily be re-lit when needed.
lamp.rawBody:
A Lamp is a dim but infinite light source that can be clicked to light or put out.

Lamps will go out if there are no players nearby for a certain amount of time, but
they can easily be re-lit when needed.

leaves.title: Leaves
body:
Leaves are piles of leaves left from cut-down trees. They can be burned for
short but intense heat, and are used to manufacture rubber.
leaves.rawBody:
Leaves are piles of leaves left from cut-down trees. They can be burned for
short but intense heat, and are used to manufacture rubber.

light.title: Light
body: Lights emit light when powered. Resize the Light larger to increase brightness and power usage.
light.rawBody: Lights emit light when powered. Resize the Light larger to increase brightness and power usage.

lightningrod.title: LightningRod
body:
LightningRods protect objects from lightning strikes within their radius, charging a connected energy cell in the process.

Resize the LightningRod longer to increase the radius of protection (length x 3, max 600).
lightningrod.rawBody:
LightningRods protect objects from lightning strikes within their radius, charging a 
connected energy cell in the process.

Resize the LightningRod longer to increase the radius of protection (length x 3, max 600).

magnesium.title: Magnesium
body: Magnesium is a light and very strong but flammable metal which catches fire when signaled.
magnesium.rawBody: Magnesium is a light and very strong but flammable metal which catches fire when signaled.

memorychip.title: MemoryChip
body:
MemoryChips store data from Computers, signals, or the Hammer's Config Tool.

To input signal data, signal attached Mode 1 Polysilicon. To output the data stored as a signal (except to CMOS), use Mode 0 Polysilicon.
memorychip.rawBody:
MemoryChips store data from Computers, signals, or the Hammer's Config Tool.

To input signal data, signal attached Mode 1 Polysilicon. To output the data stored as
a signal (except to CMOS), use Mode 0 Polysilicon.

monitor.title: Monitor
body:
Due to ROBLOX Age Segregation, letters from player input are now hidden.

Monitors display data and graphics from attached Computers. When directly signaled, they can also display signal data without a Computer.

Screen resolution is 300 x 225.
monitor.rawBody:
<font color="rgb(255,0,0)">Due to ROBLOX Age Segregation, letters from player input are now hidden.</font>

Monitors display data and graphics from attached Computers. When directly signaled, they can also 
display signal data without a Computer.

Screen resolution is 300 x 225.

motor.title: Motor
body:
Motors convert energy into motion, spinning parts connected to their hinges.

The Hammer's Config Tool can change the direction and speed of the motor. Motors use exponentially more power at higher speeds. Unlike the Motor's fuel-powered
counterparts, its speed can be set to decimals.

Linking any part with a Rope will reel or unreel the rope when the Motor is spun.

Linking with a RodConstraint to a DriveBox creates a driveshaft that can turn the DriveBox's hinge.
motor.rawBody:
Motors convert energy into motion, spinning parts connected to their hinges.

The Hammer's Config Tool can change the direction and speed of the motor. Motors use
exponentially more power at higher speeds. Unlike the Motor's fuel-powered
counterparts, its speed can be set to decimals.

Linking any part with a Rope will reel or unreel the rope when the Motor is spun.

Linking with a RodConstraint to a DriveBox creates a driveshaft that can turn the 
DriveBox's hinge.

eridanium.title: Eridanium
body: Eridanium is an extremely strong and heavy stonelike material.
eridanium.rawBody: Eridanium is an extremely strong and heavy stonelike material.

reactor.title: Reactor
body:
Reactors generate nuclear power from inserted Uranium or EnrichedUranium and can also be used to create other radioactive materials.

Connect a supply of coolant to the Reactor and insert Uranium to operate. The Reactor must be powered to show the core display or to perform any signal-related operations. Use the Hammer's Config tool to set the control rod level (default 50%), with higher values decreasing the reaction rate. Very uneven element temperatures or individual element temperatures above the maximum safe limit may cause damage.

**ELEMENT TYPES**

-Uranium: Reactive.
-EnrichedUranium: More reactive than Uranium. Does not convert to Plutonium.
-Neodymium: Converts adjacent Uranium to Plutonium above 75% heat, faster as heat increases.
-Plutonium: Converts to Americium above 80% heat, faster as heat increases.
-Americium: Converts to Curium above 85% heat, faster as heat increases.
-Curium: Enriches Uranium in adjacent channels above 90% heat, faster as heat increases.
-Charcoal: Increases reaction rate of adjacent channels.
-Silicon: Decreases reaction rate of adjacent channels.
-Titanium: Increases heat conductivity of the entire core.

**COOLANT TYPES**

-Water: High coolant consumption. Maximum safe element temperature is 1200.

-LiquidNitrogen: Lower power and maximum temperature (1000) than the other types, but more stable and 
safer in the event of a meltdown.

-Mercury: Higher power and maximum temperature (1600) than the other types. Consumes very little 
coolant but more destructive in the event of a meltdown. Does not produce visible exhaust.

-Ramjet: Ramjets can use the heat of an attached Reactor instead of fuel to provide propulsion at a
speed determined by the Reactor temperature. The Reactor will be cooled by airflow as long as the Ramjet is in motion. These nuclear Ramjets emit large amounts of radiation but can reach even faster speeds than fuel-powered Ramjets. Reactors powering Ramjets do not generate electrical energy.

**DISPLAY**

T = Temperature
C = Coolant Type
R = Control Rod Level

Each channel icon will be labeled with the contained element and colored green/red depending on the temperature. The brightness of each text label indicates the life remaining for the element. Channel numbers are as follows:

1 0

629

1241513

837

1 1


**SIGNAL CONTROLS**

-Direct: Outputs info for channel [signaled number] through Mode 3 Polysilicon: temperature;element;life.
-Mode 0 Polysilicon: Takes two numbers (A;B) and swaps elements of channel A and B. Ejects element if B is invalid.

Uranium and EnrichedUranium are immediately deleted upon ejection.

Reactors that take damage can be repaired using the Wrench tool.

-Ramjet: Ramjets can use the heat of an attached Reactor instead of fuel to provide propulsion at a

footerData.name: Uses
footerData.desc: Power Generation, Nuclear Materials Production, Dirty Bomb

footerData.name: Power Generation
footerData.desc: 238/second at maximum temperature with Water as coolant

plastic.title: Plastic
body: Plastic is an extremely light and malleable material. It can be used as a building material and a manufacturing ingredient.
plastic.rawBody:
Plastic is an extremely light and malleable material. It can be used as a building material
and a manufacturing ingredient.

polyestercoat.title: PolyesterCoat
body: PolyesterCoats help regulate temperature for the player wearing them. Touch with your character to wear it.
polyestercoat.rawBody:
PolyesterCoats help regulate temperature for the player wearing them. Touch with your character
to wear it.

polysilicon.title: Polysilicon
body:
Polysilicon controls certain items when powered/signaled. List of Config modes:

-Activate: Activates switches, BeamCannons, Valves, DriveBoxes, Brakes, and Mainsprings. Acts 
as the + function on Controllers. Swaps Reactor elements. Causes Lift to go up. Opens ComboLocks locked to same player. Causes Banks to dispense credits. Input A on CMOS. Dish Seek Next. Increases Servo Angle. Causes MemoryChip to send data. MechLimb relative position. Extends Derrick drill. Extracts part from Crate. Enables Teleporters. Enables Thrusters. Opens DoorTemplates.

-Deactivate: Deactivates switches, BeamCannons, Valves, DriveBoxes, Brakes, and Mainsprings. Acts 
as the - function on Controllers. Causes Lift to go down. Closes ComboLocks locked by same player. Input B on CMOS. Dish Seek Previous. Decreases Servo angle. Sets MemoryChip data. Mechlimb pointing. Creates a diode when connected to a Mode 0 Polysilicon. Retracts Derrick drill. Disables Teleporters. Disables Thrusters. Closes DoorTemplates.

-Toggle: Toggles switches, BeamCannons, Valves, DriveBoxes, Brakes, and Mainsprings. Acts as 
the Reverse function on Controllers. Causes Lift to stop. Toggles ComboLocks locked by same player. Input C on CMOS. Turns off Dish seeking. Resets Servo angle. Toggles DriveBoxes. Mechlimb relative pointing. Toggles Teleporters. Toggles Thrusters. Toggles DoorTemplates.

-Output: Takes an output signal from devices such as Sensors, Instruments, and CMOS. Stabilize mode 
for Thrusters.

These modes as well as the other 6 also act as signal channels for Computers.
polysilicon.rawBody:
Polysilicon controls certain items when powered/signaled. List of Config modes:

-Activate: Activates switches, BeamCannons, Valves, DriveBoxes, Brakes, and Mainsprings. Acts 
as the + function on Controllers. Swaps Reactor elements. Causes Lift to go up. Opens 
ComboLocks locked to same player. Causes Banks to dispense credits. Input A on CMOS. Dish Seek Next. 
Increases Servo Angle. Causes MemoryChip to send data. MechLimb relative position. Extends Derrick 
drill. Extracts part from Crate. Enables Teleporters. Enables Thrusters. Opens DoorTemplates.

-Deactivate: Deactivates switches, BeamCannons, Valves, DriveBoxes, Brakes, and Mainsprings. Acts 
as the - function on Controllers. Causes Lift to go down. Closes ComboLocks locked by same player. 
Input B on CMOS. Dish Seek Previous. Decreases Servo angle. Sets MemoryChip data. Mechlimb pointing. 
Creates a diode when connected to a Mode 0 Polysilicon. Retracts Derrick drill. Disables Teleporters.
Disables Thrusters. Closes DoorTemplates.

-Toggle: Toggles switches, BeamCannons, Valves, DriveBoxes, Brakes, and Mainsprings. Acts as 
the Reverse function on Controllers. Causes Lift to stop. Toggles ComboLocks locked by same player. 
Input C on CMOS. Turns off Dish seeking. Resets Servo angle. Toggles DriveBoxes. Mechlimb relative 
pointing. Toggles Teleporters. Toggles Thrusters. Toggles DoorTemplates.

-Output: Takes an output signal from devices such as Sensors, Instruments, and CMOS. Stabilize mode 
for Thrusters.

These modes as well as the other 6 also act as signal channels for Computers.

powercell.title: PowerCell
body:
PowerCells store generated energy for use in Lights, Motors, and various other electrically powered parts. All power circuits require use of a PowerCell or some other type of energy cell.

Resize the PowerCell larger to increase the storage capacity. PowerCells discharge rapidly when exposed to a very cold atmosphere (but not as rapidly as LithiumCells) and will slowly discharge over time in all other cases.

When a PowerCell is completely discharged, it cannot be recharged for 12 seconds.
powercell.rawBody:
PowerCells store generated energy for use in Lights, Motors, and various other electrically powered 
parts. All power circuits require use of a PowerCell or some other type of energy cell.

Resize the PowerCell larger to increase the storage capacity. PowerCells discharge rapidly when
exposed to a very cold atmosphere (but not as rapidly as LithiumCells) and will slowly discharge 
over time in all other cases.

When a PowerCell is completely discharged, it cannot be recharged for 12 seconds.

propeller.title: Propeller
body:
Propellers exert a forward force when spun directly by an engine/motor. They lose power at high altitudes and underwater. Use a SeaPropeller for underwater propulsion.

Propellers cannot be driven by DriveBoxes.
propeller.rawBody:
Propellers exert a forward force when spun directly by an engine/motor. They lose power at high
altitudes and underwater. Use a SeaPropeller for underwater propulsion.

Propellers cannot be driven by DriveBoxes.

seapropeller.title: SeaPropeller
body:
SeaPropellers exert a backward force when spun directly by an engine/motor. The force gets stronger as the SeaPropeller is resized larger, though this reduces top speed. SeaPropellers work best underwater and provide much less force if used in the air.

Unlike Propellers, SeaPropellers are reversible and will push in the opposite direction if spun clockwise instead of counterclockwise.

SeaPropellers cannot be driven by DriveBoxes.
seapropeller.rawBody:
SeaPropellers exert a backward force when spun directly by an engine/motor. The force gets stronger as
the SeaPropeller is resized larger, though this reduces top speed. SeaPropellers work best underwater
and provide much less force if used in the air.

Unlike Propellers, SeaPropellers are reversible and will push in the opposite direction if spun clockwise 
instead of counterclockwise.

SeaPropellers cannot be driven by DriveBoxes.

protalium.title: Protalium
body:
Protalium is a rare, glowing crystal found on asteroids. It can only be mined using blades made of Eridanium or stronger.

Protalium emits more light as more are connected to each other, and can be used as an infinite light source.
protalium.rawBody:
Protalium is a rare, glowing crystal found on asteroids. It can only be mined using blades made
of Eridanium or stronger.

Protalium emits more light as more are connected to each other, and can be used as an
infinite light source.

footerData.name: Obtained
footerData.desc: Protalium Ore, found on some asteroids

protoncell.title: ProtonCell
body:
ProtonCells convert inserted pieces of Protalium to large amounts of stored energy. All power circuits require use of a ProtonCell or some other type of energy cell.

ProtonCells do not self-discharge under any circumstances.
protoncell.rawBody:
ProtonCells convert inserted pieces of Protalium to large amounts of stored energy. All power 
circuits require use of a ProtonCell or some other type of energy cell.

ProtonCells do not self-discharge under any circumstances.

psibutton.title: PsiButton
body: A PsiButton sends a signal when clicked similar to the Button, but with unlimited clickable distance.
psibutton.rawBody: A PsiButton sends a signal when clicked similar to the Button, but with unlimited clickable distance.

quartz.title: Quartz
body: Quartz is a slightly translucent rock. Alone, it has few uses other than strong windows. It is obtained by Stone mining; each time Stone is mined, there is a small chance to mine Quartz as well.
quartz.rawBody:
Quartz is a slightly translucent rock. Alone, it has few uses other than strong windows.
It is obtained by Stone mining; each time Stone is mined, there is a small chance to
mine Quartz as well.

remoteseat.title: RemoteSeat
body:
RemoteSeats steer vehicles almost identically to SteeringSeats, except that they are wirelessly controlled by a SteeringSeat instead of directly controlled. Despite the name, RemoteSeats cannot be sat in.

Use the Hammer's Config tool to set the RemoteID of both the RemoteSeat and the SteeringSeat to the same number. The RemoteSeat can respond to inputs of a different mode than the SteeringSeat is currently set to, allowing a player to use both WASD and the mouse for different locations (such as the turret and steering of a tank).
remoteseat.rawBody:
RemoteSeats steer vehicles almost identically to SteeringSeats, except that they are wirelessly
controlled by a SteeringSeat instead of directly controlled. Despite the name, RemoteSeats cannot
be sat in.

Use the Hammer's Config tool to set the RemoteID of both the RemoteSeat and the SteeringSeat
to the same number. The RemoteSeat can respond to inputs of a different mode than the SteeringSeat
is currently set to, allowing a player to use both WASD and the mouse for different locations (such 
as the turret and steering of a tank).

rocket.title: Rocket
body:
Rockets produce thrust even in the absence of air. Their fuel consumption depends on their altitude, with higher altitudes requiring less fuel.

To power a Rocket, it must be connected (directly, or with Pipe/Valve) to a Container filled with fuel. Rockets can use three different fuels:

-Diesel: High fuel consumption and relatively slower, but with a decent amount of force.
-Hydrogen: Can accelerate to a very high speed, but low force.
-ProtaliumOxide: High force and extremely high speed.

Rockets do not ignite if the fuel level is 10 or less, and do not work underwater.
rocket.rawBody:
Rockets produce thrust even in the absence of air. Their fuel consumption depends on their 
altitude, with higher altitudes requiring less fuel.

To power a Rocket, it must be connected (directly, or with Pipe/Valve) to a Container
filled with fuel. Rockets can use three different fuels:

-Diesel: High fuel consumption and relatively slower, but with a decent amount of force.
-Hydrogen: Can accelerate to a very high speed, but low force.
-ProtaliumOxide: High force and extremely high speed.

Rockets do not ignite if the fuel level is 10 or less, and do not work underwater.

rubber.title: Rubber
body:
Rubber is a high-friction, bouncy part. It loses bounciness when made into wheels.

Rubber causes no fall damage when landed on, making it useful in many situations.
rubber.rawBody:
Rubber is a high-friction, bouncy part. It loses bounciness when made into wheels.

Rubber causes no fall damage when landed on, making it useful in many situations.

ruby.title: Ruby
body:
A Ruby is a very strong gem that can be obtained from stone mining. When stone is mined, there is a very small chance for a Ruby to be uncovered.

Because it is slightly malleable, it can be used to make strong windows.
ruby.rawBody:
A Ruby is a very strong gem that can be obtained from stone mining. When stone is mined,
there is a very small chance for a Ruby to be uncovered.

Because it is slightly malleable, it can be used to make strong windows.

sail.title: Sail
body:
A Sail is a part that produces a force that varies depending on the wind and how wide it is resized. Click to activate or deactivate.

Sails are used to harvest the energy from the wind, allowing creation of sailing ships or wind power plants. They lose effectiveness when damaged.
sail.rawBody:
A Sail is a part that produces a force that varies depending on the wind and how wide it
is resized. Click to activate or deactivate.

Sails are used to harvest the energy from the wind, allowing creation of sailing ships
or wind power plants. They lose effectiveness when damaged.

sand.title: Sand
body: Sand is harvested from sandy beaches and deserts. It can be burned to create Glass.
sand.rawBody: Sand is harvested from sandy beaches and deserts. It can be burned to create Glass.

seat.title: Seat
body: A Seat allows you to attach your character to an object. This is useful for chairs and vehicles.
seat.rawBody:
A Seat allows you to attach your character to an object. This is useful for chairs
and vehicles.

seeker.title: Seeker
body:
A Seeker is a motorized targeting computer. While powered, it will read data from a connected MemoryChip and rotate to face any target found and output data signals. **(Output format: posX;posY;posZ;Distance;Name)**
The MemoryChip data must consist of a list of targets and/or tags seperated by ";". Examples: Pawn;Not;Automaton, 2500;200;0;TurnSpeed20;2DRotate, Resource;Jade.

Item detection range is limited to 10000 studs on the Space server. Items more than 100 studs underwater will not be detected unless the Seeker itself is also underwater.

The first entry must always be one of the following tags:

-[num];[num];[num]: Targets an X;Y;Z position (uses the first THREE entries).
-Pawn: Targets players by name or UserId, or bots by class (Automaton, Rogue, etc.)
-EnemyPawn: Targets enemy team if teamed, otherwise targets all except owner. No target list.
-Part: Targets parts by name (Wood, Seeker, Abantium, etc.)
-Resource: Targets terrain objects (can also use "ResourceAll").
-Roam: Constantly points in random directions - does not use entries.

Resources that can be detected: Tree, Fumarole, Crystal, Cactus, Fountain, Rocks, Spring,
Geyser, Volcano, Hub, OilRock, and surface ore types (such as Copper, Jade, Coal, etc).

Other entries must be either targets (bot classes/player names) or these modifiers:

-Not: Inverses the list; targets items of the same category that are NOT listed.
-Min[num] or Max[num]: Only scans for targets more/less than [num] studs away.
-NoRotate: Disables rotation, so that the Seeker can be used for signaling only.
-2DRotate: Rotates only horizontally.
-NoAbove: Ignores targets above the seeker.
-NoBelow: Ignores targets below the seeker.
-Deflect[num]: Represents projectile speed for improved accuracy.
-MinTrig[num] or MaxTrig[num]: Only signals if distance is more/less than [num] studs.
-2DTrig: Height difference is ignored for MinTrig and MaxTrig.
-PitchLimit[num]: Does not exceed [num] degrees in pitch under any circumstances. 
-TurnSpeed[num] Sets the maximum rate of rotation between 1-200. Default is 100. -Height[num]: The Seeker will point toward [num] height regardless of target's height.
-Lock: Does not change target until powered off or target destroyed.
-Sort[num]: 1 selects closest target, -1 selects farthest target, 0 selects random.

footerData.desc: Copper, Gold, Iron, Magnesium, Quartz, Titanium

sign.title: Sign
body:
Signs display images, set by the Hammer's Config tool by entering "id:[decalid]". 

Example: id:235235235
sign.rawBody:
Signs display images, set by the Hammer's Config tool by entering "id:[decalid]". 

Example: id:235235235

silicon.title: Silicon
body:
Silicon is a green substance used mainly in making electronics.

Warheads attached to Silicon do not release the electronic-damaging EMP which would otherwise result from midair detonation.
silicon.rawBody:
Silicon is a green substance used mainly in making electronics.

Warheads attached to Silicon do not release the electronic-damaging EMP which would otherwise
result from midair detonation.

solarpanel.title: SolarPanel
body:
SolarPanels generate energy when pointed toward the Sun or another star. Power output is increased by resizing the SolarPanel (except for thickness) and reduced by indirect angles, opaque objects blocking the SolarPanel, or extreme distance from the star. When used on a planet, nighttime and heavy cloud cover can also prevent solar energy collection.

SolarPanels do not work when placed inside other SolarPanels.
solarpanel.rawBody:
SolarPanels generate energy when pointed toward the Sun or another star. Power output is
increased by resizing the SolarPanel (except for thickness) and reduced by indirect angles,
opaque objects blocking the SolarPanel, or extreme distance from the star. When used on a 
planet, nighttime and heavy cloud cover can also prevent solar energy collection.

SolarPanels do not work when placed inside other SolarPanels.

spacesuit.title: SpaceSuit
body:
SpaceSuits provide an air supply in space or underwater, as well as unlimited temperature protection, but slow down the wearer. Touch with your character to wear it. 

A SpaceSuit's air supply is slowly recharged in the presence of an active Respirator or in the atmosphere of Earth. An indicator light on the front shows the current air level, with green being the highest. Fully recharged SpaceSuits last about 8 minutes.
spacesuit.rawBody:
SpaceSuits provide an air supply in space or underwater, as well as unlimited temperature
protection, but slow down the wearer. Touch with your character to wear it. 

A SpaceSuit's air supply is slowly recharged in the presence of an active Respirator or in the
atmosphere of Earth. An indicator light on the front shows the current air level, with green
being the highest. Fully recharged SpaceSuits last about 8 minutes.

spawnpoint.title: SpawnPoint
body: A SpawnPoint will enable the player that created it to respawn at the SpawnPoint's location after death. SpawnPoints do not work during the War event or if blocked by an object.
spawnpoint.rawBody:
A SpawnPoint will enable the player that created it to respawn at the SpawnPoint's location 
after death. SpawnPoints do not work during the War event or if blocked by an object.

steeringseat.title: SteeringSeat
body:
SteeringSeats allow steering of vehicles by players sitting in them. Use the Hammer's Config tool to set the SteeringSeat mode:

-0: Rotates left/right with arrow keys or WASD.
-1: Rotates left/right/up/down with arrow keys or WASD.
-2: Rotates according to mouse position, when left mouse button is held down
**(and no tools selected).**

Mode 0 SteeringSeats can be rod-linked to DriveBoxes, or attached to Bogies/Generators for manual pedaling (use Up/Down or W/S).

Holding Shift while on Mode 1 slows the movement down 4x, allowing precision aim.

SteeringSeats can be linked with RemoteSeats to wirelessly exert control.
steeringseat.rawBody:
SteeringSeats allow steering of vehicles by players sitting in them. Use the Hammer's Config 
tool to set the SteeringSeat mode:

-0: Rotates left/right with arrow keys or WASD.
-1: Rotates left/right/up/down with arrow keys or WASD.
-2: Rotates according to mouse position, when left mouse button is held down
(and no tools selected).

Mode 0 SteeringSeats can be rod-linked to DriveBoxes, or attached to Bogies/Generators for
manual pedaling (use Up/Down or W/S).

Holding Shift while on Mode 1 slows the movement down 4x, allowing precision aim.

SteeringSeats can be linked with RemoteSeats to wirelessly exert control.

cotton.title: Cotton
body: Cotton is a very light substance found by harvesting Cotton plants.
cotton.rawBody: Cotton is a very light substance found by harvesting Cotton plants.

stone.title: Stone
body: Stone is a heavy, mid-strength material obtained from grey rock areas.
stone.rawBody: Stone is a heavy, mid-strength material obtained from grey rock areas.

switch.title: Switch
body:
A Switch controls the flow of energy. Clicking on it or activating attached Polysilicon will turn it on or off.

In models, Switches are loaded inactive if their color is set to "Really black".
switch.rawBody:
A Switch controls the flow of energy. Clicking on it or activating attached Polysilicon
will turn it on or off.

In models, Switches are loaded inactive if their color is set to "Really black".

television.title: Television
body:
Televisions link to Cameras with the same ID (set with the Hammer's Config tool), and show the Camera's view to any player that clicks it while powered. The screen turns the color of any part the Camera is pointing to, giving a small amount of feedback even without clicking.

Resize the Television larger for a larger field of view and vice versa.
television.rawBody:
Televisions link to Cameras with the same ID (set with the Hammer's Config tool), and
show the Camera's view to any player that clicks it while powered. The screen turns the
color of any part the Camera is pointing to, giving a small amount of feedback even 
without clicking.

Resize the Television larger for a larger field of view and vice versa.

footerData.name: Uses
footerData.desc: Camera Viewing, Motion Sensing, Video Screens

thruster.title: Thruster
body:
Thrusters exert a weak force while active. Unlike most forms of propulsion, they do not reset a vehicle's velocity and can smoothly create torque on a vehicle if used off-axis. Thrusters also have the unique ability to rotate their nozzles toward different directions.

Connect a supply of Hydrogen to operate the Thruster, and use the Hammer's Config tool to set the power level. Resize the Thruster larger to increase its force and fuel usage.

Signal the Thruster directly with a single number (0 to 100) to set the power level, or signal two numbers (direction;angle) to set the nozzle's direction (0 to 360) and angle (-90 to 90). Signal through Polysilicon to perform these operations:

-Mode 0 Polysilicon: Activates Thruster.
-Mode 1 Polysilicon: Deactivates Thruster.
-Mode 2 Polysilicon: Toggles Thruster.
-Mode 3 Polysilicon: "Stabilize" mode, counteracts velocity in the opposite direction of the nozzle.

The maximum speed of Thrusters is reduced if used in Earth's atmosphere, increasing with altitude.
thruster.rawBody:
Thrusters exert a weak force while active. Unlike most forms of propulsion, they do not reset a 
vehicle's velocity and can smoothly create torque on a vehicle if used off-axis. Thrusters also
have the unique ability to rotate their nozzles toward different directions.

Connect a supply of Hydrogen to operate the Thruster, and use the Hammer's Config tool to set the
power level. Resize the Thruster larger to increase its force and fuel usage.

Signal the Thruster directly with a single number (0 to 100) to set the power level, or signal two 
numbers (direction;angle) to set the nozzle's direction (0 to 360) and angle (-90 to 90). Signal
through Polysilicon to perform these operations:

-Mode 0 Polysilicon: Activates Thruster.
-Mode 1 Polysilicon: Deactivates Thruster.
-Mode 2 Polysilicon: Toggles Thruster.
-Mode 3 Polysilicon: "Stabilize" mode, counteracts velocity in the opposite direction of the nozzle.

The maximum speed of Thrusters is reduced if used in Earth's atmosphere, increasing with altitude.

timemachine.title: TimeMachine
body:
The TimeMachine is a device used to travel in time in different ways.

There is a clock on the top that shows the current time of day, as well as two numbers:
-Red Number: Current date. It shows the amount of time passed since the server began,
times 5. Example: If the number is 24, 24 x 5 = 120, meaning the server is 2 hours old.
-Orange Number: Set date to travel to.

To set the date to travel to, click the buttons on the clock face. To activate the 
TimeMachine, make sure it isn't indirectly connected to terrain, and signal to activate **(there cannot be another TimeMachine nearby).**

When activated, the TimeMachine will transport anything connected to it back in time to the set date. It has a cooldown time of 15 seconds after returning.

The TimeMachine creates a time 'bubble' to travel in, the radius of which is about 120 studs. Parts outside of the bubble will not be shown; so to view a certain area, you must move the TimeMachine to that area.

Only parts and terrain of the past is shown. They cannot be edited. Also, when a TimeMachine travels back to the present, the time bubble collapses, destroying anyone and anything left inside.

Officers can make Temporal Bombs with a TimeMachine. See the Warhead page for details.

TimeMachines only function on the Earth server.

-Red Number: Current date. It shows the amount of time passed since the server began,
times 5. Example: If the number is 24, 24 x 5 = 120, meaning the server is 2 hours old.
-Orange Number: Set date to travel to.

To set the date to travel to, click the buttons on the clock face. To activate the 
TimeMachine, make sure it isn't indirectly connected to terrain, and signal to activate 
(there cannot be another TimeMachine nearby).

When activated, the TimeMachine will transport anything connected to it back in time

The TimeMachine creates a time 'bubble' to travel in, the radius of which is about 120

must move the TimeMachine to that area.

Only parts and terrain of the past is shown. They cannot be edited. Also, when a
TimeMachine travels back to the present, the time bubble collapses, destroying 
anyone and anything left inside.

Officers can make Temporal Bombs with a TimeMachine. See the Warhead page for details.

TimeMachines only function on the Earth server.

footerData.desc: Abantium, Gold, Protalium, Ruby, Silicon, Titanium

tintedglass.title: TintedGlass
body:
TintedGlass is a transparent material similar to Glass but opaque on one side.

The front and back surfaces of TintedGlass are smooth and will not weld to other smooth surfaces.
tintedglass.rawBody:
TintedGlass is a transparent material similar to Glass but opaque on one side.

The front and back surfaces of TintedGlass are smooth and will not weld to other smooth surfaces.

titanium.title: Titanium
body: Titanium is an extremely strong metal which resists many types of weapons. However, it is expensive and has very low malleability.
titanium.rawBody:
Titanium is an extremely strong metal which resists many types of weapons. However, it is
expensive and has very low malleability.

touchtrigger.title: TouchTrigger
body: TouchTriggers signal connected parts when touched by another object. The signal data will be the name of the item touched, including players.
touchtrigger.rawBody:
TouchTriggers signal connected parts when touched by another object. The signal data will
be the name of the item touched, including players.

transformer.title: Transformer
body: Transformers convert energy to constant signals.
transformer.rawBody: Transformers convert energy to constant signals.

signalswitch.title: SignalSwitch
body:
A SignalSwitch controls the flow of signals. Clicking on it or activating Polysilicon turns it on or off.

In models, SignalSwitches are loaded inactive if their color is set to "Really black".
signalswitch.rawBody:
A SignalSwitch controls the flow of signals. Clicking on it or activating Polysilicon 
turns it on or off.

In models, SignalSwitches are loaded inactive if their color is set to "Really black".

signalwire.title: SignalWire
body:
SignalWires transmit signals. They light up as they carry a signal unless painted a different color.

SignalWires painted red will disappear after passing a signal. This can be used to launch items, such as Missiles and bombs.
signalwire.rawBody:
SignalWires transmit signals. They light up as they carry a signal unless painted a
different color.

SignalWires painted red will disappear after passing a signal. This can be used to
launch items, such as Missiles and bombs.

abantium.title: Abantium
body: Abantium is a metal that is as strong as Iron but 100 times lighter. It is a preferred material for spaceship, because it is also extremely malleable.
abantium.rawBody:
Abantium is a metal that is as strong as Iron but 100 times lighter. It is a preferred 
material for spaceship, because it is also extremely malleable.

truss.title: Truss
body: Trusses are climbable metal structures.

uranium.title: Uranium
body:
Uranium is a weakly radioactive metal which cannot be produced by a Factory.

Connecting a Generator to Uranium generates a very small amount of energy.
uranium.rawBody:
Uranium is a weakly radioactive metal which cannot be produced by a Factory.

Connecting a Generator to Uranium generates a very small amount of energy.

warhead.title: Warhead
body:
Warheads are atomic bombs capable of catastrophic damage and surviving re-entry.

To arm a Warhead, two conditions must be reached: the Warhead needs to travel at a speed
of at least 50 studs per second for the last 6 seconds, and it has to have been previously signaled with the arming code that can be changed using the Hammer's Config tool. Once armed, any signal other than the arming code will cause detonation. Warheads cannot be detonated underneath islands.

The effect of the explosion differs depending on where the Warhead was detonated:

-Airburst: Generates an EMP, damaging power systems and jamming wireless parts in a huge area.
-Surface: Fireball radius is reduced, but releases much larger amounts of radioactive fallout.
-Underwater: No flash burns or aerial fallout.

Nuclear EMP does not affect parts in space or underwater.

While the Warhead alone is effective against virtually any type of target, the explosion can be modified or enhanced even further by attachments:

-Plutonium or PhotonShard: Increases explosion power by 50% per piece.
-DeuteriumCap: When used along with at least one PhotonShard or Plutonium, the explosion 
goes thermonuclear and power is doubled (including Plutonium/PhotonShard bonus). -Americium: Increases both radius and intensity of the radioactive fallout by 50% per piece.
-EnrichedUranium: Increases duration of the radioactive fallout by 50% per piece.
-Silicon: Removes EMP effect of airbursts.

To create a temporal bomb (Earth server and Officer rank only), attach a Warhead to a TimeMachine. When the Warhead is signaled (does not require arming conditions), all parts within a 100-stud radius are replaced by parts brought back from the date selected. This regenerates destroyed buildings and items. Attach an EnergyBomb to the TimeMachine to increase the radius to 400.

Unlike most other parts, Warheads can never be unlocked by other players when unwelded. However, they are vulnerable to large explosions and Flak bursts while in motion.

Warheads defuse themselves if detonated too close to a BaseCenter outside of events.
