node.title: Node
body: Nodes act as buttons for WarpGates. Use the Hammer's Config tool to set the button number.
node.rawBody: Nodes act as buttons for WarpGates. Use the Hammer's Config tool to set the button number.

mainspring.title: Mainspring
body:
Mainsprings are clockwork motors which can store rotational power.

To wind a Mainspring manually, touch and hold it with your character. When the sound ceases, it will have reached maximum capacity. Mainsprings can store energy for 1 minute per stud of width they are resized to, but the action will be slowed as the Mainspring winds down.

Click on the Mainspring or signal it using Polysilicon to toggle unwinding.

Alternatively, an attached engine/motor can wind a Mainspring (except for StirlingEngines), one at a time. These engines must be at least 16 studs in volume to wind it.
mainspring.rawBody:
Mainsprings are clockwork motors which can store rotational power.

To wind a Mainspring manually, touch and hold it with your character. When the sound
ceases, it will have reached maximum capacity. Mainsprings can store energy for 1 
minute per stud of width they are resized to, but the action will be slowed as the 
Mainspring winds down.

Click on the Mainspring or signal it using Polysilicon to toggle unwinding.

Alternatively, an attached engine/motor can wind a Mainspring (except for StirlingEngines), 
one at a time. These engines must be at least 16 studs in volume to wind it.

scanner.title: Scanner
body: Scanners display a list of active WarpGate addresses in the opposite server while powered. The list automatically updates every two minutes as long as the opposite server is running.
scanner.rawBody:
Scanners display a list of active WarpGate addresses in the opposite server while powered. The 
list automatically updates every two minutes as long as the opposite server is running.

shuriken.title: Shuriken
body:
Shurikens are small blades that can hit multiple enemies at once. They require skill to use, as Shurikens will curve towards the direction the thrower is facing.

Shuriken Ammunitions (load an ammo by using the Ammo button in Produce GUI):

-Default: Standard shurikens.

-PowerCell: Confusion shurikens that interfere with the movement of the hit player.

-Protalium: Spectral shurikens that phase through walls and can kill a player in one hit.
shuriken.rawBody:
Shurikens are small blades that can hit multiple enemies at once. They require skill
to use, as Shurikens will curve towards the direction the thrower is facing.

Shuriken Ammunitions (load an ammo by using the Ammo button in Produce GUI):

-Default: Standard shurikens.

-PowerCell: Confusion shurikens that interfere with the movement of the hit player.

-Protalium: Spectral shurikens that phase through walls and can kill a player in one hit.

pod.title: Pod
body:
Pods are futuristic treasure chests occasionally found drifting through space. They are easily located by their bright blue beacons.

When clicked, they release one of 18 rare items which do not save across servers.
pod.rawBody:
Pods are futuristic treasure chests occasionally found drifting through space. They are easily 
located by their bright blue beacons.

When clicked, they release one of 18 rare items which do not save across servers.

searchlight.title: SearchLight
body:
SearchLights focus a large orb of light on any non-terrain object they are pointed at while powered, with a maximum range of 2500 studs. The orb will continue to track the object for a short time even if the object moves out of the beam's path.

When tracking an object, SearchLights pass data into connected Sensors (as if the Sensors themselves had scanned it), causing them to output through Mode 3 Polysilicon in accordance with their respective settings. SearchLight-activated Sensors need not be pointed at the target to work this way.
searchlight.rawBody:
SearchLights focus a large orb of light on any non-terrain object they are pointed at while powered, 
with a maximum range of 2500 studs. The orb will continue to track the object for a short time even
if the object moves out of the beam's path.

When tracking an object, SearchLights pass data into connected Sensors (as if the Sensors themselves 
had scanned it), causing them to output through Mode 3 Polysilicon in accordance with their respective
settings. SearchLight-activated Sensors need not be pointed at the target to work this way.

keyboard.title: Keyboard
body:
Keyboards are connected to Computers to interface with them, and can also send signals on their own to connected parts.

Entering data in the program editor window will create the same data in the lower window but with indents converted to slashes; the reverse happens when entering data in the lower window.

**BUTTONS**

-Run/Enter: Runs the entered program, or enters data into Channel 10. Runs program on hard
disk if left blank.
-Stop: Stops the running program.
-Open/Save: If no text was entered, opens the data on the hard disk into the window.
Otherwise, saves the text to the disk. Disk data saves across servers.
-Dial/Search: If no text was entered, displays a list of all available website servers.
Otherwise, dials the server address that was entered.
-Edit: Toggles the program editor window.
-MP: Toggles the mousepad (only used for programs that require it).
-Exit: Closes the window.

Keyboards are connected to Computers to interface with them, and can also send signals on 
their own to connected parts.

Entering data in the program editor window will create the same data in the lower window
but with indents converted to slashes; the reverse happens when entering data in the lower
window.

BUTTONS

disk if left blank.
-Stop: Stops the running program.
-Open/Save: If no text was entered, opens the data on the hard disk into the window.
Otherwise, saves the text to the disk. Disk data saves across servers.
-Dial/Search: If no text was entered, displays a list of all available website servers.
Otherwise, dials the server address that was entered.
-Edit: Toggles the program editor window.
-MP: Toggles the mousepad (only used for programs that require it).
-Exit: Closes the window.

cmos.title: CMOS
body:
A CMOS processes signal data according to instructions set by the Hammer's Config tool.

The "Operation" setting is written as a semicolon-seperated list with an operation keyword followed by its variables. Each variable can be either manually entered data or input codes represented by a letter (input source) and number (selected packet). For example, if the CMOS is signaled with data "One;Two;Three", the code E2 would result in "Two". If an operation uses inputs from more than one source, the CMOS will wait until all inputs are in before activating.

Operation examples: +;A1;D1, \\;C1;100, rand, packet;A1;B1;C1, >;A7;2, =;B2;Hello, sin;D3

Each Output setting is a two-number code with the first number determining the parts to output to and the second number being the output effect. Most operations will use the "True Output" setting, but comparative operations with a false result (as in 4<3) instead use "False Output".

":" changes to ";" in all variables.

**INPUTS**

-A: CMOS and Mode 0 Polysilicon.
-B: Mode 1 Polysilicon.
-C: Mode 2 Polysilicon.
-D: MemoryChip data. Cannot activate the CMOS on its own.
-E: Direct signal.
-F: Reads text changes on a part with a simple surface GUI, such as PowerCells.
-G: Receives data from parts which normally output to Mode 3 Polysilicon, such as Crates.

**ACTION OPERATIONS (with number of variables)**

rand: (none) Outputs a random number.
attached: (none) Outputs a list of connected parts.
abort: (none) Stops countdown of a DelayWire or Debouncer.
abs, acos, asin, atan, cos, cosh, deg, rad, round, sin, sinh, tan, tanh: (1) C math.
timeout: (2) Outputs variable 2 when the last input was [var 1] seconds ago.
+, -, \* or \`, \\, ^, %: (2) Outputs the result of the respective math operation.
], [: (2) Outputs the greater/lesser of the two number variables.
atan2: (2) Performs atan2 on the two variables.
affix: (2) Affixes a string onto another string. (Hello + 123 = Hello123)
magnitude: (3) Outputs distance of a vector.
mymagnitude: (3) Outputs distance of a vector from the CMOS's position.
unit: (3) Outputs a normed vector.
angleh: (3) Outputs the horizontal angle of a vector from the CMOS's position and rotation.
anglev: (3) Outputs the vertical angle of a vector from the CMOS's position only.
packet: (1 to 10) Outputs each variable as the respective list entry.
boot: (1 to 10) Same as "packet", but also outputs 3 seconds after spawning in model/world load.
color: (none or 3) Colors all connected Lights, SpotLights, ZapWires, LaserTargeters, GlowTubes,
LCDs, and CMOS. The color of the CMOS will be used unless RGB decimals are specified. Cannot color parts locked by a different player.

**COMPARATIVE OPERATIONS (two variables required)**

>, <: True if first variable is greater than/less than the second.
=, !: True if first variable is equal to/not equal to the second. Use keyword STRING
or NUMBER on the second variable to check the type, e.g. =;A1;STRING.
C, N: True if first variable contains/does not contain the second.

**OUTPUTS**

Outputs will not be sent to any Polysilicon modes used as input.

**FIRST NUMBER**

-0: All, outputs to all applicable connected parts.
-1: Up, outputs to connected parts at least 1 stud in the direction of the decal.
-2: Down, outputs to connected parts at least 1 stud in the opposite direction of the decal.
-3: Mode 3 Poly, outputs through Mode 3 Polysilicon.

**SECOND NUMBER**

-0: Acts as a Mode 0 Polysilicon on the output parts.
-1: Acts as a Mode 1 Polysilicon on the output parts.
-2: Acts as a Mode 2 Polysilicon on the output parts.
-3: Signals the output parts. Overwrites MemoryChips if there are no other parts to output to.

valve.title: Valve
body:
A Valve controls the flow of Container substances through it. Clicking on it or activating attached Polysilicon will turn it on or off.

In models, Valves are loaded inactive if their color is set to "Really black".
valve.rawBody:
A Valve controls the flow of Container substances through it. Clicking on it or activating 
attached Polysilicon will turn it on or off.

In models, Valves are loaded inactive if their color is set to "Really black".

stirlingengine.title: StirlingEngine
body:
A StirlingEngine is a simple type of engine that converts heat into motion.

StirlingEngines use no fuel, instead harnessing the heat of of an attached Firebox. They start instantly and are relatively quiet, but develop very little power. Resizing them larger allows for only a slight power increase.

Additionally, feeding Water into a StirlingEngine boosts the torque output by 20%, and LiquidNitrogen boosts it by 50%. Only one of these two liquids can be used at a time, and non-boosted StirlingEngines are unable to drive Rotors, Propellers, or SeaPropellers.

StirlingEngines that take damage can be repaired using the Wrench tool.

Linking with a RodConstraint to a DriveBox creates a driveshaft that can turn the DriveBox's hinge.
stirlingengine.rawBody:
A StirlingEngine is a simple type of engine that converts heat into motion.

StirlingEngines use no fuel, instead harnessing the heat of of an attached Firebox. They 
start instantly and are relatively quiet, but develop very little power. Resizing them 
larger allows for only a slight power increase.

Additionally, feeding Water into a StirlingEngine boosts the torque output by 20%, and 
LiquidNitrogen boosts it by 50%. Only one of these two liquids can be used at a time, and
non-boosted StirlingEngines are unable to drive Rotors, Propellers, or SeaPropellers.

StirlingEngines that take damage can be repaired using the Wrench tool.

Linking with a RodConstraint to a DriveBox creates a driveshaft that can turn the 
DriveBox's hinge.

pitchfork.title: Pitchfork
body:
Pitchforks are melee weapons which deal less damage than the Sword but are more effective at interrupting enemy ranged weapon reload. They can also be used to hurl small objects.

When used by multiple players in a group, Pitchforks deal much more damage and can break weaker parts.
pitchfork.rawBody:
Pitchforks are melee weapons which deal less damage than the Sword but are more effective 
at interrupting enemy ranged weapon reload. They can also be used to hurl small objects.

When used by multiple players in a group, Pitchforks deal much more damage and can break 
weaker parts.

torch.title: Torch
body:
Torches are used as a light source, a weapon, and lighting fires. Torches must be lit before use by touching it to a burning part. When put back into the inventory, they are put out and must be relit when equipped again. Lit Torches have the ability to throw fireballs a short distance by clicking. Torches are always lit in PvP events, and do not work underwater or in space.

Torch Ammunitions (load an ammo by using the Ammo button in Produce GUI):

-Default: Fast-firing fireballs that can set parts and players on fire.

-Gunpowder: Slower firing fireball that splits on impact, and thrown much further.

-ProtaliumOxide: Slow firing fireball that splits into splitting fireballs.
torch.rawBody:
Torches are used as a light source, a weapon, and lighting fires. Torches must be lit
before use by touching it to a burning part. When put back into the inventory, they are
put out and must be relit when equipped again. Lit Torches have the ability to throw
fireballs a short distance by clicking. Torches are always lit in PvP events, and do not
work underwater or in space.

Torch Ammunitions (load an ammo by using the Ammo button in Produce GUI):

-Default: Fast-firing fireballs that can set parts and players on fire.

-Gunpowder: Slower firing fireball that splits on impact, and thrown much further.

-ProtaliumOxide: Slow firing fireball that splits into splitting fireballs.

exoticmatter.title: ExoticMatter
body:
ExoticMatter is a rare artificial substance which is transparent and has very high strength and malleability.

ExoticMatter is produced by spraying ProtaliumOxide from a Faucet onto a piece of Amethyst. The Amethyst will be consumed in an extremely powerful explosion and has a chance to create a small piece of ExoticMatter.
exoticmatter.rawBody:
ExoticMatter is a rare artificial substance which is transparent and has very high strength
and malleability.

ExoticMatter is produced by spraying ProtaliumOxide from a Faucet onto a piece of Amethyst. The 
Amethyst will be consumed in an extremely powerful explosion and has a chance to create a small 
piece of ExoticMatter.

beamcannon.title: BeamCannon
body:
BeamCannons emit energy beams with different effects depending on the ammo type inserted.

After inserting the ammo type, power the BeamCannon and click or use attached Polysilicon to operate. Inserted ammo will only be accepted if both the ammo and the BeamCannon are unlocked. Resize the BeamCannon longer to increase range, and wider to increase power.

**AMMO TYPES**

--Ruby: Constant laser beam with very long range that sets fire to flammable parts and can 
eventually melt through others. Weak at small widths, and blocked by Glass and Ceramic.

--TintedGlass: Powerful laser pulse with short range and a cooldown. Weak at small widths, 
and blocked by Glass and Ceramic.

--Protalium: Tractor beam. Harmless beam that can attract objects; attraction speed 
is determined by width. Adjust Firing Mode 1 to repel instead of attract.

--Y: Tachyon beam. Concentrated energy ray, uses vast amounts of power. Space server only.

--Uranium: Short ranged embrittlement beam which rapidly weakens targeted parts, but cannot 
cause damage on its own. Larger sizes use less energy.

After inserting the ammo type, power the BeamCannon and click or use attached Polysilicon

footerData.name: Uses
footerData.desc: Weapon, Power Transmission, Flare, Tractor Beam

footerData.name: Recipe
footerData.desc: Copper, Glass, Gold, Jade, Magnesium, Titanium

dish.title: Dish
body:
A Dish performs a wide variety of information collecting or other functions from a virtually unlimited distance. Information is outputted through Mode 3 Polysilicon.

Most Dish operations are applied in an area determined by the Dish's direction, range setting (distance from Dish), and radius setting (distance from the scan point). Signal the Dish with all three settings in a list (mode;range;radius) to perform an operation, or alternatively, use any non-list signal to operate with the default settings which are set by the Hammer's Config tool.

Set the range to 0 to target areas at sea level only, which is most useful when the Dish is mounted on a satellite above Earth.

The Dish must be linked to a non-full energy cell for mode 11, and any energy cell for mode 0.

**LIST OF DISH MODES**

0: Emits a wave which jams Radars and wireless data parts. Range/radius settings not used.
1: Outputs the scan point.
2: Outputs the total number of parts in the area.
3: Outputs a list of players and bots in the area.
4: Outputs a list of held tools in the area, with the user's name preceding each.
5: Outputs a list of player part counts in the area, with the player's name preceding each.
6: Outputs a rough list of entire model positions. Each three entries is a vector.
7: Same as 6, but positions are relative to the scan point.
8: Outputs significant heat signatures in the area. Each three entries is a vector.
9: Same as 8, but positions are relative to the scan point.
10: Outputs ionizing radiation signatures in the area. Each three entries is a vector.
11: Same as 10, but positions are relative to the scan point.
12: Saps from rechargable cells. Small radius increases effect. Outputs target's charge.
13: Outputs a scaled 6x6 map of terrain colors. Y increases every 6 entries.
14: Outputs a scaled 6x6 map of terrain and part colors. Y increases every 6 entries.
15: Outputs a scaled 6x6 map of terrain altitude. Y increases every 6 entries.
Part Type: Outputs how many parts of a specific type are in the area.

Some outputs are best read using a Computer. The following is a sample YewScript program which can be used for modes 13 - 15, sent to the Computer through Mode 0 Polysilicon.

print  
A=0
B=0
A+1
boxA'0'B'30'30'  '1001
A+1
boxA'32'B'30'30'  '1001
A+1
boxA'64'B'30'30'  '1001
A+1
boxA'96'B'30'30'  '1001
A+1
boxA'128'B'30'30'  '1001
A+1
boxA'160'B'30'30'  '1001
ifA<36
B+32
goto4
end
A=Buffer'0
ifA!List
goto20
end
B=0
B+1
**C=A'B**
changeB'  '  '  '  '  'C (Use "changeB'  '  '  '  'C" for mode 15)
ifB<36
goto25
end
goto20

footerData.name: Uses
footerData.desc: Area Scanning, Wireless Jamming, Energy Transfer

rotor.title: Rotor
body:
Rotors hover in the air when spun directly by an engine/motor and also move horizontally when tilted. Tilt angle and high altitudes both reduce lift force. Rotational speed determines the altitude at which the Rotor will hover and also contributes to the horizontal speed.

Resizing the Rotor longer increases its lift and decreases its horizontal speed. Increasing the Rotor's width beyond 2 or thickness beyond 1 has no effect.

Compared to winged aircraft, Rotor helicopters have a lower maximum altitude and are slower, but are able to hover in place, more maneuverable, and moderately resistant to Flak explosions.

Rotors cannot be driven by DriveBoxes.
rotor.rawBody:
Rotors hover in the air when spun directly by an engine/motor and also move horizontally when tilted. Tilt
angle and high altitudes both reduce lift force. Rotational speed determines the altitude at which the Rotor
will hover and also contributes to the horizontal speed.

Resizing the Rotor longer increases its lift and decreases its horizontal speed. Increasing the Rotor's width
beyond 2 or thickness beyond 1 has no effect.

Compared to winged aircraft, Rotor helicopters have a lower maximum altitude and are slower, but are able to 
hover in place, more maneuverable, and moderately resistant to Flak explosions.

Rotors cannot be driven by DriveBoxes.

servo.title: Servo
body:
Servos are special electric motors that can be set to attain specific angles. They are controlled either by attached PolySilicon or direct signaling data.

Polysilicon Mode 0: Increase Angle
Polysilicon Mode 1: Decrease Angle
Polysilicon Mode 2: Reset Angle

The increment that the angle is increased or decreased is determined by the Polysilicon's total volume in studs. Each stud of volume decreases the increment, making smaller amounts of Polysilicon turn the Servo faster, and vice versa.
servo.rawBody:
Servos are special electric motors that can be set to attain specific angles. They are controlled
either by attached PolySilicon or direct signaling data.

Polysilicon Mode 0: Increase Angle
Polysilicon Mode 1: Decrease Angle
Polysilicon Mode 2: Reset Angle

The increment that the angle is increased or decreased is determined by the Polysilicon's total
volume in studs. Each stud of volume decreases the increment, making smaller amounts of
Polysilicon turn the Servo faster, and vice versa.

zaktralia.title: Zaktralia
body: Zaktralia is a transparent, difficult-to-obtain substance, spectral in appearance, that is used primarily to create some advanced items. Zaktralia's malleability and strength are low, rendering it less useful as a building material. Zaktralia also has the least friction of any material.
zaktralia.rawBody:
Zaktralia is a transparent, difficult-to-obtain substance, spectral in appearance, 
that is used primarily to create some advanced items. Zaktralia's malleability and
strength are low, rendering it less useful as a building material. Zaktralia also has the
least friction of any material.

footerData.name: Obtained
footerData.desc: Inserting a Diamond into a powered Accelerator

neodymium.title: Neodymium
body: Neodymium is a rare metal used in several item recipes which cannot be produced by a Factory.
neodymium.rawBody:
Neodymium is a rare metal used in several item recipes which cannot be produced by
a Factory.

lexan.title: Lexan
body:
Lexan is a transparent material which is flammable and more expensive than Glass, but many times stronger.

The front and back surfaces of Lexan are smooth and will not weld to other smooth surfaces.
lexan.rawBody:
Lexan is a transparent material which is flammable and more expensive than Glass, but
many times stronger.

The front and back surfaces of Lexan are smooth and will not weld to other smooth surfaces.

probabilityfield.title: ProbabilityField
body: ProbabilityFields are a special type of armor that ignore any weapon damage bonuses and take damage equally from most types of attacks. They are very light and malleable.
probabilityfield.rawBody:
ProbabilityFields are a special type of armor that ignore any weapon damage bonuses
and take damage equally from most types of attacks. They are very light and malleable.

foam.title: Foam
body: Foam is an extremely lightweight substance that breaks if hit with enough force. Larger pieces are slightly stronger.
foam.rawBody:
Foam is an extremely lightweight substance that breaks if hit with enough force. Larger
pieces are slightly stronger.

blinkdisplacer.title: BlinkDisplacer
body: A BlinkDisplacer enables the user to rapidly teleport to random places nearby, to avoid incoming attacks. It cannot teleport through walls, and will make a lower-pitched sound each time a warp fails.
blinkdisplacer.rawBody:
A BlinkDisplacer enables the user to rapidly teleport to random places nearby, to avoid
incoming attacks. It cannot teleport through walls, and will make a lower-pitched sound
each time a warp fails.

gravdevice.title: GravDevice
body:
While powered, a GravDevice generates a large field of artificial gravity in space.

Artificial gravity, in addition to making spacecraft cabin movement easier, will also prevent heating on re-entry. However, this comes at a cost of the spacecraft's hull being under full gravitational force, which may cause it to fall through the universe if inadequate force is provided to keep it floating.
gravdevice.rawBody:
While powered, a GravDevice generates a large field of artificial gravity in space.

Artificial gravity, in addition to making spacecraft cabin movement easier, will also
prevent heating on re-entry. However, this comes at a cost of the spacecraft's hull being
under full gravitational force, which may cause it to fall through the universe if inadequate
force is provided to keep it floating.

sensor.title: Sensor
body:
Sensors are able to gather information about objects in front of them using an invisible ray. When signaled, they will output data through Mode 3 Polysilicon. The range is determined by the Sensor's length, to a maximum of 5000 studs. 

The mode of Sensors can be adjusted with the Hammer's Config Tool.

Sensor Modes:

1: Outputs the name of the object.
2: Outputs the position of where the ray hit.
3: Outputs the color of the object.
4: Outputs the distance between the Sensor and detected object.
5: Signals signalable parts (except Magnesium). Outputs 1 if successful, 0 if not.
6: Outputs the player who last edited the object.
7: Outputs the speed of the object.
8: Outputs the rotational speed of the object.
9: Outputs the size of the object.
10: Deletes the object if owned by the same player. Outputs 1 if successful, 0 if not.

When attached to a SearchLight, Sensors will scan any object the SearchLight is currently tracking without having to be pointed in the same direction.

cleats.title: Cleats
body: Cleats are metallic parts with extremely high friction.
cleats.rawBody: Cleats are metallic parts with extremely high friction.

ceramic.title: Ceramic
body:
Ceramic is a very hard but brittle material. It is resistant to Acid, weathering, lasers, and most other forms of damage, but can break apart from shock similiar to Foam.

Ceramic is also used in re-entry shielding for spacecraft, as it absorbs heat and does not burn up in the atmosphere.
ceramic.rawBody:
Ceramic is a very hard but brittle material. It is resistant to Acid, weathering, lasers,
and most other forms of damage, but can break apart from shock similiar to Foam.

Ceramic is also used in re-entry shielding for spacecraft, as it absorbs heat and does not 
burn up in the atmosphere.

hydrogenerator.title: HydroGenerator
body:
HydroGenerators generate energy when placed in relatively shallow water with at least 200 studs of clear space in front and behind.

Though difficult to set up initially, HydroGenerators provide a substantial amount of power, do not require fuel, and operate 24/7 regardless of sunlight or wind.
hydrogenerator.rawBody:
HydroGenerators generate energy when placed in relatively shallow water with at least 200 
studs of clear space in front and behind.

Though difficult to set up initially, HydroGenerators provide a substantial amount of power, 
do not require fuel, and operate 24/7 regardless of sunlight or wind.

ramjet.title: Ramjet
body:
Ramjets produce thrust at the cost of Gas or Diesel, similar to Turbofans, but do not function at low speeds or altitudes and use much more fuel. However, they are significantly faster and can fly higher than any other air-breathing engine. Ramjets do not generate electricity with a Generator.

Alternatively, Ramjets can use the heat of an attached Reactor instead of fuel to provide propulsion depending on the Reactor temperature. The Reactor will be cooled by airflow as long as the Ramjet is in motion. These nuclear Ramjets emit large amounts of radiation but can reach even faster speeds than fuel-powered Ramjets.

The front of a Ramjet must be uncovered for it to function.
ramjet.rawBody:
Ramjets produce thrust at the cost of Gas or Diesel, similar to Turbofans, but do not function 
at low speeds or altitudes and use much more fuel. However, they are significantly faster and 
can fly higher than any other air-breathing engine. Ramjets do not generate electricity with 
a Generator.

Alternatively, Ramjets can use the heat of an attached Reactor instead of fuel to provide
propulsion depending on the Reactor temperature. The Reactor will be cooled by airflow as long 
as the Ramjet is in motion. These nuclear Ramjets emit large amounts of radiation but can reach
even faster speeds than fuel-powered Ramjets.

The front of a Ramjet must be uncovered for it to function.

launcher.title: Launcher
body:
Launchers are weapons that can hurl many different types of free-falling or self-propelled projectiles. Larger Launchers fire faster, and longer 
ones throw the projectile further. Launchers must be at least 4 studs long and 2 studs wide to function. Use the Hammer's Config Tool to select a type of projectile, and an ammunition type can be inserted into the Launcher to modify the projectile properties. Fire by signaling (requires attached Ammo container).

**LIST OF PROJECTILES (TYPE)**

DARTS (0)
-Normal: Small missile that seeks a position set by the signal sent to the Launcher. If 
the signal is not a valid position value, the missile is unguided. 
-Seeker: Heat-seeking missile that targets significant heat sources such as operating
engines. It costs more ammo, and does not target anything within 150 studs of the Launcher. -SeaPropeller: Powerful torpedo for underwater use which seeks vibration, locking on to
running engines/motors. Weaker if launched from above sea level.
-Explosives: Large, unguided rocket which falls in a shallow arc, with a range set by
the Launcher's length (minimum 8 studs). These fly farther than the other types.

**BOMBS (1)**
-Normal: Explosive aerial bomb.
-Magnesium: Firebomb that does less explosive damage, but spreads flaming debris.
-Stone: Concrete "bomb" which does not explode, but smashes heavily armored targets. Damage
increases with the height it is dropped from.

MINES (2)
-Normal: Very powerful explosive mine. Mines hide themselves 20 seconds after touching the
ground or floating in the water; if detonated before this time, the resulting explosion will be very weak. Once hidden, mines will detonate in the presence of any object moving nearby. They can last indefinitely, but will despawn if the Launcher that fired them is destroyed or if more than 20 are deployed from a single Launcher.
-Toxin: Releases clouds of Toxin, but with a weaker explosion.
-Missile: Flak-rocket mine effective against aircraft passing overhead.

EMBERS (3)
-Normal: Lightweight burning material that can distract heat-seeking missiles if the ember is
below the target. High damage vs. parts with health such as BaseCenters or Hulls. -Sulfur: Corrosive splash ember with a concentrated area of effect, and twice the ammo usage.
-AlkalineCell: Charged ember which can arc electricity to nearby objects.
-Oil: Smoke bomb. Creates huge smoke clouds to confuse or conceal. Smoke color is the color 
of the Launcher.

powerplant.title: PowerPlant
body:
PowerPlants are large Coal-powered engines.

PowerPlants are the most powerful motor type, turning faster with much higher amounts of torque than a regular Engine, while also being relatively quiet. However, their sheer size and weight makes them impractical for many applications. They spawn at full power by default.

Inserting Lirvanite into a PowerPlant grants a massive speed and torque increase.

Linking with a RodConstraint to a DriveBox creates a driveshaft that can turn the DriveBox's hinge.
powerplant.rawBody:
PowerPlants are large Coal-powered engines.

PowerPlants are the most powerful motor type, turning faster with much higher amounts of 
torque than a regular Engine, while also being relatively quiet. However, their sheer size 
and weight makes them impractical for many applications. They spawn at full power by default.

Inserting Lirvanite into a PowerPlant grants a massive speed and torque increase.

Linking with a RodConstraint to a DriveBox creates a driveshaft that can turn the 
DriveBox's hinge.

photonshard.title: PhotonShard
body:
PhotonShards are rare items found only inside comets, which are found drifting through space on both the Earth and Space servers but are difficult to catch because of their high speed. They have the unusual property of rapidly healing nearby players.

When attached to a Warhead, PhotonShards increase the explosive power similar to Plutonium but without the instability or radiation.
photonshard.rawBody:
PhotonShards are rare items found only inside comets, which are found drifting through space on
both the Earth and Space servers but are difficult to catch because of their high speed. They have 
the unusual property of rapidly healing nearby players.

When attached to a Warhead, PhotonShards increase the explosive power similar to Plutonium
but without the instability or radiation.

footerData.name: Obtained
footerData.desc: Capturing and breaking open a comet

singularitybomb.title: SingularityBomb
body: A SingularityBomb briefly unleashes a miniature blackhole when signaled, which attracts nearby objects and obliterates them. Unlike most other bombs, the effect is not blocked by walls or energy shields.
singularitybomb.rawBody:
A SingularityBomb briefly unleashes a miniature blackhole when signaled, which attracts
nearby objects and obliterates them. Unlike most other bombs, the effect is not blocked 
by walls or energy shields.

inertiatrigger.title: InertiaTrigger
body:
An InertiaTrigger is a sensing device that will signal connected parts if it experiences a change in velocity greater than or equal to its threshold setting. Use the Hammer's Config tool to change the threshold as well as the mode, which can be set to only signal on accelerations, only signal on decelerations, or signal on both.

The signal outputted is the acceleration in studs per second.
inertiatrigger.rawBody:
An InertiaTrigger is a sensing device that will signal connected parts if it experiences
a change in velocity greater than or equal to its threshold setting. Use the Hammer's
Config tool to change the threshold as well as the mode, which can be set to only signal
on accelerations, only signal on decelerations, or signal on both.

The signal outputted is the acceleration in studs per second.

fuelcan.title: FuelCan
body:
A FuelCan is a handheld container that can be used to transfer substances between Containers or into ICBMs. Touch the FuelCan to a Container with a substance inside of it to fill it, and then touch the Container to be filled.

Fuel Cans have unlimited capacity, but will be dropped if the player attempts to sit down with one in the inventory.
fuelcan.rawBody:
A FuelCan is a handheld container that can be used to transfer substances between
Containers or into ICBMs. Touch the FuelCan to a Container with a substance inside 
of it to fill it, and then touch the Container to be filled.

Fuel Cans have unlimited capacity, but will be dropped if the player attempts to sit 
down with one in the inventory.

gel.title: Gel
body:
Gel is a translucent, weak substance that has the property of extinguishing fires in attached parts. Extinguishing a fire has a high chance to consume the Gel each time, and it cannot protect Ice from melting or bombs from detonating.

Despite the low strength, Gel can also be useful in construction because of it's high malleability, low friction, and bounciness. Gel is also immune to Acid.

Like Rubber, Gel causes no fall damage when landed on.
gel.rawBody:
Gel is a translucent, weak substance that has the property of extinguishing fires in
attached parts. Extinguishing a fire has a high chance to consume the Gel each time,
and it cannot protect Ice from melting or bombs from detonating.

Despite the low strength, Gel can also be useful in construction because of it's high
malleability, low friction, and bounciness. Gel is also immune to Acid.

Like Rubber, Gel causes no fall damage when landed on.

firebox.title: Firebox
body:
Fireboxes burn flammable parts in a controlled manner, releasing heat to connected parts as well as in the surrounding area. Insert flammable parts into the Firebox to burn them. The heat can be used to drive StirlingEngines or heat Containers of Water into HeatedWater and then Steam.

The contents of a Firebox may burn for up to 15 minutes, depending on what and how much was inserted into it. The slats at the bottom will glow a dimmer red as the fire dies down.

If a Container of Water is placed above smoke from a Firebox, Acid will be created in an empty Container connected to the Container of Water.

Fireboxes require a certain amount of oxygen in the air to operate. Place a Respirator or other breathable air source nearby for use in space or on planets without enough oxygen.
firebox.rawBody:

well as in the surrounding area. Insert flammable parts into the Firebox to burn them. The

then Steam.

If a Container of Water is placed above smoke from a Firebox, Acid will be created in

footerData.name: Uses
footerData.desc: Boilers, Heat, Light, Garbage Disposal, Acid Production

viper.title: Viper
body:
The Viper is a continuous-beam energy weapon with a volatile power source. Though it never needs to be reloaded, firing it for too long may cause it to overheat and explode. The Viper's heat level is displayed on bars on the top of the weapon.

Viper Ammunitions (load an ammo by using the Ammo button in Produce GUI):

-Default: Normal energy beam.

-Uranium: Turbobeam which overheats faster and has a short range, but much more powerful.

-Abantium: Static field beam which overheats slower and is harmless, but instead can lock onto
a target and manipulate or even throw heavy objects.
viper.rawBody:
The Viper is a continuous-beam energy weapon with a volatile power source. Though it never 
needs to be reloaded, firing it for too long may cause it to overheat and explode. The Viper's 
heat level is displayed on bars on the top of the weapon.

Viper Ammunitions (load an ammo by using the Ammo button in Produce GUI):

-Default: Normal energy beam.

-Uranium: Turbobeam which overheats faster and has a short range, but much more powerful.

-Abantium: Static field beam which overheats slower and is harmless, but instead can lock onto
a target and manipulate or even throw heavy objects.

graphicscard.title: GraphicsCard
body: When connected to a Computer, a GraphicsCard enables drawing of onscreen 3D graphics.
graphicscard.rawBody: When connected to a Computer, a GraphicsCard enables drawing of onscreen 3D graphics.

track.title: Track
body:
Tracks are metal rails for Bogies, which will roll along the Track's path once placed on it. Turns in the track can be accomplished with Bends. Track-to-Track connections (not Track-to-Bend) can be slightly misaligned or even entirely disconnected and still function normally.

**RAILROAD TIPS**

-Do not connect Bends directly to other Bends.

-Do not build long diagonal sections of Track.

-Have at least 20 studs of Track between each Bend.

-After a 90 degree turn is built (using three Tracks and two Bends between them), re-align the outgoing Track with the terrain to avoid issues. This is done simply by placing the next Track on the ground instead of against the preceding one, creating a small gap which will not affect performance. Use a Foundation if building Tracks above water or other places where terrain is not available.
track.rawBody:
Tracks are metal rails for Bogies, which will roll along the Track's path once placed
on it. Turns in the track can be accomplished with Bends. Track-to-Track connections
(not Track-to-Bend) can be slightly misaligned or even entirely disconnected and still
function normally.

RAILROAD TIPS

-Do not connect Bends directly to other Bends.

-Do not build long diagonal sections of Track.

-Have at least 20 studs of Track between each Bend.

-After a 90 degree turn is built (using three Tracks and two Bends between them), 
re-align the outgoing Track with the terrain to avoid issues. This is done simply by 
placing the next Track on the ground instead of against the preceding one, creating a 
small gap which will not affect performance. Use a Foundation if building Tracks above 
water or other places where terrain is not available.

bend.title: Bend
body:
A Bend is a wedge-shaped Track used to create a bend or switch in the rails. To use, place between at least two tracks, aligned to the rails. If the Bend is not the last component to be placed, wait 60 seconds before use for it to attach itself to the rails.

Railroad switches can also be created using Bends by arranging the Tracks onto different sides (including straight through, which is not connected to the Bend at the front). To switch a railroad switch, it must be signaled.
bend.rawBody:
A Bend is a wedge-shaped Track used to create a bend or switch in the rails. To use,
place between at least two tracks, aligned to the rails. If the Bend is not the last
component to be placed, wait 60 seconds before use for it to attach itself to the rails.

Railroad switches can also be created using Bends by arranging the Tracks onto
different sides (including straight through, which is not connected to the Bend at
the front). To switch a railroad switch, it must be signaled.

bogie.title: Bogie
body:
Bogies are metal wheelsets for trains. When placed above Track, they will align themselves onto the rails and follow the Track. Only one Bogie should be used for each seperate locomotive or car.

Bogies will couple when a powered or coupled Bogie touches one that is not. Signal a Bogie to decouple it from the Bogie it is following.

Unlike DriveBoxes and Treads, Bogies are linked to engines/motors by direct connection. Only one engine/motor can link to the Bogie at once. SteeringSeats can also be linked, driving the Bogie if a player pedals it. Reverse the drive direction using the Hammer's Config tool.

During extreme global cooling (such as during the Apocalypse GreatFreeze Event), Bogies generate power when moving on an extremely long track system. No power will be generated on track sections already traveled recently.
bogie.rawBody:
Bogies are metal wheelsets for trains. When placed above Track, they will align themselves onto
the rails and follow the Track. Only one Bogie should be used for each seperate locomotive or car.

Bogies will couple when a powered or coupled Bogie touches one that is not. Signal a Bogie to
decouple it from the Bogie it is following.

Unlike DriveBoxes and Treads, Bogies are linked to engines/motors by direct connection. Only one
engine/motor can link to the Bogie at once. SteeringSeats can also be linked, driving the Bogie 
if a player pedals it. Reverse the drive direction using the Hammer's Config tool.

During extreme global cooling (such as during the Apocalypse GreatFreeze Event), Bogies generate 
power when moving on an extremely long track system. No power will be generated on track sections 
already traveled recently.

market.title: Market
body:
The Market is a node to a global marketplace for Trinkets, special items that are not obtained in regular ways. New Trinkets will be up for sale on the front list periodically,
and may change the amount in stock or prices. To buy a Trinket, click on one in the list to select it and click on the Market itself to buy.
Teal = Common
Yellow = Uncommon
Red = Rare
Purple = Legendary
Green = Selected

Insert unlocked Trinkets to sell them on the Market. A profit can be made if the price is higher than it was when they were bought.
market.rawBody:
The Market is a node to a global marketplace for Trinkets, special items that are not obtained
in regular ways. New Trinkets will be up for sale on the front list periodically,
and may change the amount in stock or prices. To buy a Trinket, click on one in the list
to select it and click on the Market itself to buy.
Teal = Common
Yellow = Uncommon
Red = Rare
Purple = Legendary
Green = Selected

Insert unlocked Trinkets to sell them on the Market. A profit can be made if the price is higher
than it was when they were bought.

lasersword.title: Lasersword
body: Laser Swords can instantly kill players and bots, and weakly damage parts. They can cut apart Balloons almost instantly.
lasersword.rawBody:
Laser Swords can instantly kill players and bots, and weakly damage parts. They can
cut apart Balloons almost instantly.

inductor.title: Inductor
body: Inductors transfer energy to nearby PowerCells and LithiumCells wirelessly. The range is set by length (10 studs per stud long, up to 100), and transfer rate is set by width.
inductor.rawBody:
Inductors transfer energy to nearby PowerCells and LithiumCells wirelessly. The range 
is set by length (10 studs per stud long, up to 100), and transfer rate is set by width.

flamethrower.title: FlameThrower
body:
FlameThrowers are short-ranged weapons which project streams of fire hot enough to melt some metals. They consume Diesel, Gas, or ProtaliumOxide as fuel, with ProtaliumOxide causing much greater damage than the regular fuel types. Resize the FlameThrower longer to increase both range and fuel consumption.

Click or signal the FlameThrower to toggle it on or off. A fuel supply must be connected, and the FlameThrower must not be underwater.
flamethrower.rawBody:
FlameThrowers are short-ranged weapons which project streams of fire hot enough to melt 
some metals. They consume Diesel, Gas, or ProtaliumOxide as fuel, with ProtaliumOxide
causing much greater damage than the regular fuel types. Resize the FlameThrower longer
to increase both range and fuel consumption.

Click or signal the FlameThrower to toggle it on or off. A fuel supply must be connected,
and the FlameThrower must not be underwater.

book.title: Book
body:
Due to ROBLOX Age Segregation, only images can now be placed in Books.

Books display a series of images. To edit an image, click on it, type an asset ID in the number bar that appears (the number portion only) and click the image again.

Locked Books cannot be overwritten by other players.
book.rawBody:
<font color="rgb(255,0,0)">Due to ROBLOX Age Segregation, only images can now be placed in Books.</font>

Books display a series of images. To edit an image, click on it, type an asset ID in the number bar that 
appears (the number portion only) and click the image again.

Locked Books cannot be overwritten by other players.

parachutepack.title: ParachutePack
body: A ParachutePack is a wearable jacket which deploys a parachute when signaled, slowing the fall of whatever is attached. While being worn by a player, it will instead deploy when the player falls from a harmful height. It cannot be worn while welded to a part.
parachutepack.rawBody:
A ParachutePack is a wearable jacket which deploys a parachute when signaled, slowing the
fall of whatever is attached. While being worn by a player, it will instead deploy when
the player falls from a harmful height. It cannot be worn while welded to a part.

footerData.name: Uses
footerData.desc: Skydiving, Cargo Delivery, Target Practice, Emergency Systems

mechlimb.title: MechLimb
body:
When active, MechLimbs attempt to "grab" or point towards a position received by a signal **(in the form of X;Y;Z).**

MechLimbs are automatically unpacked into their segments when spawned in a model; in all other cases, click the MechLimb to unpack. Power and signals are applied to the root segment, while the end segment functions as the wrist/ankle and will appear where the decal on the MechLimb package is. Any connected parts will remain connected to the respective segment. MechLimbs do not save when the server is reloaded, and must be resized to a length between 8 and 152 to unpack.

To use, power the root segment, and send signals to it directly or through Polysilicon. The pose will be held even if the MechLimb is moved or unpowered.

Direct signal: Moves limb toward position.
Mode 0 Polysilicon: Moves limb toward position relative to shoulder/hip joint.
Mode 1 Polysilicon: Points end segment toward position instead of following direct signal/Mode 0.
Mode 2 Polysilicon: Points end segment toward position relative to shoulder/hip joint instead of
following direct signal/Mode 0.
Mode 3 Polysilicon: Unlocks the end segment rotation so that it follows direct/Mode 0 again.

Send a single number between 0 and 20 through any input to set the movement speed, which also affects power usage. Default is 20.

footerData.name: Uses
footerData.desc: Robotic Arms, Spider Legs, Turrets, Inchworms, Tentacles, Anthro Experience

lasertargeter.title: LaserTargeter
body:
LaserTargeters output the 3D coordinates of where a player's mouse is pointing while the left mouse button is held down (with no tools selected). Connect the LaserTargeter to a Seat or SteeringSeat to use; a harmless laser dot will be cast for the player in the seat. 

The color of the laser dot is set by the color of the part (can be changed using CMOS), and the dot will be invisible if the color is low in brightness.

LaserTargeters require no external power.

Seat or SteeringSeat to use; a harmless laser dot will be cast for the player in the seat. 

The color of the laser dot is set by the color of the part (can be changed using CMOS),
and the dot will be invisible if the color is low in brightness.

LaserTargeters require no external power.

footerData.desc: Target Designation, Drones, Homing Missiles, Laser Pointer

filler.title: Filler
body:
While powered, Fillers automatically link and transfer substances flowing into them to nearby Containers, similar to electrical Inductors. The range is determined by width (up to 128, which would be a width of 8 x 8), and transfer rate is determined by depth. They can also fill ICBMs if connected to a Container holding at least 5000 Diesel.

Unlike Inductors, Fillers can only transfer to one Container at a time. Ammo Fillers will transfer to the largest Container first, and vice versa for liquid or gas Fillers. They can only transfer to Containers which are empty or containing the same substance.
filler.rawBody:
While powered, Fillers automatically link and transfer substances flowing into them to 
nearby Containers, similar to electrical Inductors. The range is determined by width (up 
to 128, which would be a width of 8 x 8), and transfer rate is determined by depth. They
can also fill ICBMs if connected to a Container holding at least 5000 Diesel.

Unlike Inductors, Fillers can only transfer to one Container at a time. Ammo Fillers will
transfer to the largest Container first, and vice versa for liquid or gas Fillers. They
can only transfer to Containers which are empty or containing the same substance.

interceptor.title: Interceptor
body:
Interceptors are extremely fast rocket weapons capable of eliminating Warhead attacks as well as striking specific positions.

When signaled with non-position data, the Interceptor will search for incoming Warheads and launch if a target is found, seeking the Warhead with great accuracy and destroying it even through armor. However, Warheads in Earth orbit or re-entering from orbit have a 60% chance to resist the explosion. Interceptors cannot be launched underwater nor can they lock on to Warheads located more than 50 studs below the ocean surface. Maximum range in this mode is 10000 studs.

Alternatively, signaling the Interceptor with position data (X;Y;Z) causes it to launch and target the specified point if within the maximum range of 4000 studs, detonating on impact.

Unlike other parts, a Camera attached to an Interceptor will neither unweld during launch nor interfere with the Interceptor's operation.

accelerator.title: Accelerator
body:
Accelerator are massive synchrotrons used for the production of Zaktralia or Funium.

To operate, insert the chosen ingredient into the Accelerator while powered. The Accelerator must remain powered throughout the process and its core must have a completely clear view of the sky.

**LIST OF ACCELERATOR PROCESSES**

Diamond -> Zaktralia
Gold -> Funium

LIST OF ACCELERATOR PROCESSES

activedefense.title: ActiveDefense
body:
ActiveDefenses are automatic gunnery modules which quickly detect and destroy most types of incoming projectiles, such as cannonballs or dart missiles. They require power and a supply of Ammo to function.

Ammo consumption depends on the projectile being intercepted. Larger projectiles consume more Ammo to shoot down, and certain types (such as bombs or torpedoes) inherently drain enormous amounts at once.

Since the ActiveDefense targets only slow-moving fired projectiles, it will have no effect on BeamCannons, Guns, or other tracefire weapons. It is also unable to defend against part weapons like Explosives.

Since the ActiveDefense targets only slow-moving fired projectiles, it will have no effect

windmill.title: Windmill
body: Windmills generate electricity as wind blows through them. If connected to an energy cell and enough wind is present, an indicator light appears at the top which shows how much power is being generated, with green being maximum and red being negligible. Power generation increases at optimum altitudes, but decreases if there are nearby objects blocking the wind.
windmill.rawBody:
Windmills generate electricity as wind blows through them. If connected to an energy cell and
enough wind is present, an indicator light appears at the top which shows how much power 
is being generated, with green being maximum and red being negligible. Power generation 
increases at optimum altitudes, but decreases if there are nearby objects blocking the wind.

bilgepump.title: BilgePump
body:
BilgePumps remove water from attached Hulls or CrudeHulls while powered, slowing or stopping their flooding when a leak exists. They turn on and off automatically.

BilgePumps do not function underwater.
bilgepump.rawBody:
BilgePumps remove water from attached Hulls or CrudeHulls while powered, slowing or stopping
their flooding when a leak exists. They turn on and off automatically.

BilgePumps do not function underwater.

crudehull.title: CrudeHull
body:
CrudeHulls float on the ocean, allowing creation of boats and ships. All hulls on the same vehicle must be connected to each other directly or through other hulls; any indirectly connected hulls may cause the vehicle to flip over.

Resize CrudeHulls larger to increase their weight capacity and damage resistance. When enough damage is taken, CrudeHulls will visibly crack and begin taking on water until they sink. 

BilgePumps can pump water out of all hulls on the vehicle at once, and the Wrench tool may be used to repair them. They take severe damage if any connected hulls are destroyed or removed.

CrudeHulls which have already been placed in water will become extremely difficult to move if lifted out of the water. Their strength is also significantly reduced while on land. They will not float if placed inside other Hulls or CrudeHulls.

In the War event, players must be near a BallastTank, CrudeHull, or Hull on the ocean surface to capture sea territories.

hull.title: Hull
body:
Hulls float on the ocean, allowing creation of boats and ships. They are stronger than CrudeHulls but have slightly less weight capacity.

All hulls on the same vehicle must be connected to each other directly or through other hulls; any indirectly connected hulls may cause the vehicle to flip over.

Resize Hulls larger to increase their weight capacity and damage resistance. When enough damage is taken, Hulls will visibly crack and begin taking on water until they sink. 

BilgePumps can pump water out of all hulls on the vehicle at once, and the Wrench tool may be used to repair them. They take severe damage if any connected hulls are destroyed or removed.

Hulls which have already been placed in water will become extremely difficult to move if lifted out of the water. Their strength is also significantly reduced while on land. They will not float if placed inside other Hulls or CrudeHulls.

In the War event, players must be near a BallastTank, CrudeHull, or Hull on the ocean surface to capture sea territories.

seaalloy.title: SeaAlloy
body:
SeaAlloy is an alloy of Aluminium resistant to acid and BallastTank corrosion, making it suitable for use in submarines.

The physical properties of SeaAlloy are close to that of Aluminium, though SeaAlloy is flammable, more expensive, and somewhat more malleable.

Like all parts, SeaAlloy will still dissolve if left in the ocean without a BallastTank.
seaalloy.rawBody:

suitable for use in submarines.

The physical properties of SeaAlloy are close to that of Aluminium, though SeaAlloy is
flammable, more expensive, and somewhat more malleable.

Like all parts, SeaAlloy will still dissolve if left in the ocean without a BallastTank.

wrench.title: Wrench
body:
A Wrench is used to repair any part besides BaseCenters that can be progressively damaged. This includes Hulls, CrudeHulls, Sails, Balloons, Engines, SteamEngines, Turbofans, Turboshafts, and StirlingEngines.

When the Wrench is selected, corrosion will be removed from all parts within 200 studs.

Load a material appropriate for the item being repaired (Cotton, Iron, or Wood) into the Wrench using the Produce GUI, stand near the part, and click to begin the repair. Both the player and the part being repaired must not move for the sequence to be completed. Each repair session restores all aspects of the part to full health.
wrench.rawBody:
A Wrench is used to repair any part besides BaseCenters that can be progressively damaged.
This includes Hulls, CrudeHulls, Sails, Balloons, Engines, SteamEngines, Turbofans, Turboshafts,
and StirlingEngines.

When the Wrench is selected, corrosion will be removed from all parts within 200 studs.

Load a material appropriate for the item being repaired (Cotton, Iron, or Wood) into the 
Wrench using the Produce GUI, stand near the part, and click to begin the repair. Both
the player and the part being repaired must not move for the sequence to be completed.
Each repair session restores all aspects of the part to full health.

catapult.title: Catapult
body:
A Catapult is a primitive weapon able to use most part types as ammo.

Insert a part into the Catapult to load it; it must be small enough to fit inside. When loaded, fire by clicking or signaling. The inserted part will be hurled out with a force based on the Catapult's length, and the projectile is able to damage parts depending on its own strength and mass. The thrown part is not destroyed and can be picked up again after a short duration. Reloading is faster with smaller projectiles.

Most parts requiring power will be temporarily powered while hurled. Oil will be set on fire when launched. If the Catapult is locked, its projectiles will not damage parts locked by the same player.
catapult.rawBody:

Insert a part into the Catapult to load it; it must be small enough to fit inside. When

based on the Catapult's length, and the projectile is able to damage parts depending on
its own strength and mass. The thrown part is not destroyed and can be picked up again 
after a short duration. Reloading is faster with smaller projectiles.

Most parts requiring power will be temporarily powered while hurled. Oil will be set on
fire when launched. If the Catapult is locked, its projectiles will not damage parts 
locked by the same player.

biowall.title: BioWall
body:
BioWall is a living plant-based substance which takes gradual damage similar to Sails or Hulls, but regenerates health over time. Though flammable, its damage-absorbing properties can make it effective used as armor against certain kinds of attacks. Plants can also grow on it like OrganicMatter.

BioWall heals at a very fast rate during storms.
biowall.rawBody:
BioWall is a living plant-based substance which takes gradual damage similar to Sails or

on it like OrganicMatter.

BioWall heals at a very fast rate during storms.

selfdestruct.title: SelfDestruct
body:
A SelfDestruct is an explosive device which destroys the entire model it is attached to, if it is owned by the same player as the model. Parts of almost any strength, including Eridanium, are affected and 90% are fried, rendering them useless. This makes the SelfDestruct useful for preventing a vehicle from falling into enemy hands. The fried debris will despawn, making cleanup easier.

Because of the short delay between signaling and detonation, SelfDestructs can also be used to create a powerful, though expensive, cluster bomb.

Signal or set on fire to activate. Activation will not occur if the SelfDestruct is indirectly or directly connected to ground.

cleanup easier.

Because of the short delay between signaling and detonation, SelfDestructs can also be used
to create a powerful, though expensive, cluster bomb.

plant.title: Plant
body:
Plants grow and replicate with different effects and uses depending on their DNA. Some may be harvested for materials, and most will have a chance to drop a seed when harvested.

Cotton-bearing Plants are always scattered throughout the map. They do not actively replicate unless seeds are harvested and replanted, but do respawn after being harvested.

Plants grow and replicate with different effects and uses depending on their DNA. Some may
be harvested for materials, and most will have a chance to drop a seed when harvested.

Cotton-bearing Plants are always scattered throughout the map. They do not actively replicate
unless seeds are harvested and replanted, but do respawn after being harvested.

seed.title: Seed
body:
Seeds grow into seedling plants when placed on an appropriate surface and clicked. If unable to be planted in a particular spot, a flash will be seen.

Insert into a BioLab to scan the Seed's DNA profile.
seed.rawBody:
Seeds grow into seedling plants when placed on an appropriate surface and clicked. If unable to

relic.title: Relic
body:
**PARTS: RELICS**

Relics are exceedingly rare parts with mysterious and powerful abilities.
relic.rawBody:
PARTS: RELICS

Relics are exceedingly rare parts with mysterious and powerful abilities.

monster.title: Monster
body:
**OBJECT: MONSTER**

In the starting age, Monsters will appear at night and attack players not near light sources. They no longer appear once a Factory is created.
monster.rawBody:
OBJECT: MONSTER

In the starting age, Monsters will appear at night and attack players not near light sources.
They no longer appear once a Factory is created.

plutonium.title: Plutonium
body:
Plutonium is a highly unstable radioactive metal.

When Plutonium is placed near neutron-reflecting materials (metallic parts, including other pieces of Plutonium), an atomic chain reaction may begin to take place, charging electrically connected energy cells and releasing a hazardous neutron burst. If the reaction energy goes too high, the Plutonium will go supercritical and blow itself apart.

Plutonium attached to a Warhead will amplify the Warhead's destructive potential.

Signaling Plutonium will output its energy level to Mode 3 Polysilicon on a scale of 0 to 100, with 100 being supercritical. Note that ionizing rays from Plutonium will randomly signal unprotected signalable parts, so any measurement device must be made to resist this effect.

Connecting a Generator to Plutonium generates a small amount of energy.
plutonium.rawBody:

When Plutonium is placed near neutron-reflecting materials (metallic parts, including other
pieces of Plutonium), an atomic chain reaction may begin to take place, charging electrically

too high, the Plutonium will go supercritical and blow itself apart.

Plutonium attached to a Warhead will amplify the Warhead's destructive potential.

Signaling Plutonium will output its energy level to Mode 3 Polysilicon on a scale of 0 to 100,
with 100 being supercritical. Note that ionizing rays from Plutonium will randomly signal

Connecting a Generator to Plutonium generates a small amount of energy.

amethyst.title: Amethyst
body: Amethyst is a valuable gem found by harvesting crystal outcroppings or occasionally from stone mining. It has uses similar to Ruby, being weaker but more malleable. ExoticMatter is created by spraying pieces of Amethyst with ProtaliumOxide through a Faucet.
amethyst.rawBody:

has uses similar to Ruby, being weaker but more malleable. ExoticMatter is created by spraying pieces 
of Amethyst with ProtaliumOxide through a Faucet.

glowtube.title: GlowTube
body:
GlowTubes are radioluminescent light sources that require no energy to operate but cannot be toggled. They do not emit a harmful level of radiation.

A GlowTube only produces usable light if more than 1 stud wide.
glowtube.rawBody:
GlowTubes are radioluminescent light sources that require no energy to operate but cannot be
toggled. They do not emit a harmful level of radiation.

A GlowTube only produces usable light if more than 1 stud wide.

deuteriumcap.title: DeuteriumCap
body:
DeuteriumCaps facilitate thermonuclear capability for an attached Warhead when used in combination with Plutonium. To create a DeuteriumCap, you must have 8 seperate Containers of Hydrogen nearby along with the other ingredients.

A more benign use for DeuteriumCaps is that any currently attached parts are rendered immune to Acid or Acid-releasing weapon. Parts already being dissolved can also be cured by attaching a DeuteriumCap.

A more benign use for DeuteriumCaps is that any currently attached parts are rendered immune

lcd.title: LCD
body:
LCDs are transparent screens capable of displaying numbers, creating images, and varying their transparency.

By default, LCDs have a crosshair decal on the front. Use the Hammer's Config tool to enable or disable this.

Signal the LCD with a number or list of numbers (seperated by semicolons) to display the result on the screen.

Signal the LCD through Mode 0 Polysilicon to change the transparency to the number signaled, between 0 and 8.

Signal the LCD through Mode 1 Polysilicon with a list of 12 numbers to create a 12x12 pixel display. Each number draws an entire line of 12 pixels at a time, represented in binary:

0 = 
1 = 
2 = 
3 = 
4 = 
5 = 
6 = 
7 = 
8 = 

This pattern continues up to 4095 (which would fill all pixels on that line).
