radio.title: Radio
body:
Radios allow chats of nearby players to be received by other players with Radios.

Click on a powered Radio to send an attention-getting ring signal to receiving Radios.
radio.rawBody:
Radios allow chats of nearby players to be received by other players with Radios.

Click on a powered Radio to send an attention-getting ring signal to receiving Radios.

horse.title: Horse
body:
**OBJECT: HORSE**

Horses toggle between forward movement and calm roaming when clicked, changing color slightly to show their status. Attach a SteeringSeat to ride the Horse, or use other kinds of attachments to make them carry cargo or pull loads.

They must be fed Leaves every so often to stay alive, and will neigh while hurt or hungry. Touch Leaves to the Horse to do this. Each meal heals the Horse to full health.

Touch a Horse with your character to calm it and make it hold still for a while. This only has an effect while roaming.
horse.rawBody:
OBJECT: HORSE

Horses toggle between forward movement and calm roaming when clicked, changing color slightly
to show their status. Attach a SteeringSeat to ride the Horse, or use other kinds of attachments 
to make them carry cargo or pull loads.

They must be fed Leaves every so often to stay alive, and will neigh while hurt or hungry. 
Touch Leaves to the Horse to do this. Each meal heals the Horse to full health.

Touch a Horse with your character to calm it and make it hold still for a while. This only
has an effect while roaming.

derrick.title: Derrick
body:
Derricks are drilling rigs used to identify and obtain resources deep underground.

Power the Derrick and click (or use Mode 0 Polysilicon) to begin drilling into terrain. This can be done straight downwards or even at an angle to access resources diagonally.

If the drilling process is completed successfully, an indicator will display what type of resource was found, if any, and the Derrick will signal non-Polysilicon parts accordingly. Click (or use Mode 0 Polysilicon) again to bring a piece of the material to the surface. Note that doing this too often may temporarily deplete the resource, preventing it from being obtained until several minutes later. The Derrick does not need to remain powered while linked to a resource spot, and will remain linked across server saves.

NOTE: Mode 0 Polysilicon may only be used to mine 10 pieces at a time. After that, the Derrick
needs to be manually clicked to reset this limit.

Water spots are only found on land, while Gas spots are only found in deep ocean.

Steam resource spots indicate geothermal activity. A Derrick will generate power while linked to underground Steam.

Attaching a Container to a Derrick linked to Coal, Oil, Gas, or Water will slowly fill it with said substance (except for Oil, which is converted to Diesel), requiring no power and never depleting the resource spot.

Use Mode 1 Polysilicon (or right-click) to retract an extended Derrick drill. Locked Derricks can only be right-clicked by the owner.
derrick.rawBody:
Derricks are drilling rigs used to identify and obtain resources deep underground.

Power the Derrick and click (or use Mode 0 Polysilicon) to begin drilling into terrain. This
can be done straight downwards or even at an angle to access resources diagonally.

If the drilling process is completed successfully, an indicator will display what type of
resource was found, if any, and the Derrick will signal non-Polysilicon parts accordingly. 
Click (or use Mode 0 Polysilicon) again to bring a piece of the material to the surface. Note 
that doing this too often may temporarily deplete the resource, preventing it from being 
obtained until several minutes later. The Derrick does not need to remain powered while
linked to a resource spot, and will remain linked across server saves.

NOTE: Mode 0 Polysilicon may only be used to mine 10 pieces at a time. After that, the Derrick
needs to be manually clicked to reset this limit.

Water spots are only found on land, while Gas spots are only found in deep ocean.

Steam resource spots indicate geothermal activity. A Derrick will generate power while
linked to underground Steam.

Attaching a Container to a Derrick linked to Coal, Oil, Gas, or Water will slowly fill it 
with said substance (except for Oil, which is converted to Diesel), requiring no power and 
never depleting the resource spot.

Use Mode 1 Polysilicon (or right-click) to retract an extended Derrick drill. Locked Derricks
can only be right-clicked by the owner.

footerData.name: Recipe
footerData.desc: Acid, Copper, Gold, Ice, Iron, Oil, Ruby, Sulfur

prospector.title: Prospector
body:
A Prospector searches for underground resources in the area when clicked or signaled and displays what is found. Prospectors require no power and can be used at any altitude as long as they aren't in space. Each square on the screen represents 300 studs.

Resources directly below (center square on display) are outputted to Mode 3 Polysilicon.
prospector.rawBody:
A Prospector searches for underground resources in the area when clicked or signaled
and displays what is found. Prospectors require no power and can be used at any altitude as
long as they aren't in space. Each square on the screen represents 300 studs.

Resources directly below (center square on display) are outputted to Mode 3 Polysilicon.

crate.title: Crate
body:
Crates store inserted parts or tools inside themselves.

When a tool or an unlocked and unwelded part touches a Crate, it will be inserted if it's small enough to fit inside. Crates may only store one type of item at a time. The total stored volume cannot exceed the Crate's actual volume, and if the parts inserted are resizable, they are stored as one cubic stud instead of their default size (but return to default size when extracted). Parts stored in a Crate save across servers. Any parts inserted will lose all data and configuration properties (except ore types).

Remove an item from a Crate by clicking or signaling with Mode 0 Polysilicon. If the Crate is locked, this only works if the owner clicked or if the Polysilicon has the same owner. The exit must be also clear of objects, and the indicator will flash red if the exit is blocked.

Use the Hammer's Config tool to set the Container's item filter, which prevents it from being filled with items other than the one set.

Signal a Crate to output both stored item and capacity through Mode 3 Polysilicon.
crate.rawBody:
Crates store inserted parts or tools inside themselves.

When a tool or an unlocked and unwelded part touches a Crate, it will be inserted if it's 
small enough to fit inside. Crates may only store one type of item at a time. The total 
stored volume cannot exceed the Crate's actual volume, and if the parts inserted are resizable, 
they are stored as one cubic stud instead of their default size (but return to default size 
when extracted). Parts stored in a Crate save across servers. Any parts inserted will lose 
all data and configuration properties (except ore types).

Remove an item from a Crate by clicking or signaling with Mode 0 Polysilicon. If the Crate is
locked, this only works if the owner clicked or if the Polysilicon has the same owner. The exit
must be also clear of objects, and the indicator will flash red if the exit is blocked.

Use the Hammer's Config tool to set the Container's item filter, which prevents it from being
filled with items other than the one set.

Signal a Crate to output both stored item and capacity through Mode 3 Polysilicon.

flubber.title: Flubber
body:
Flubber is a very bouncy substance with low friction.

Can be made into Templates.
flubber.rawBody:
Flubber is a very bouncy substance with low friction.

Can be made into Templates.

belt.title: Belt
body:
A Belt is a conveyor belt used for moving parts.

While the Belt is powered, parts that touch it are moved in the direction of the arrows. It cannot directly move players or other items that aren't standard parts. The speed and direction of the Belt can be adjusted using the Controller or the Hammer's Config tool. If the Belt itself is in motion while in use, power usage is greatly increased.
belt.rawBody:
A Belt is a conveyor belt used for moving parts.

While the Belt is powered, parts that touch it are moved in the direction of the arrows.
It cannot directly move players or other items that aren't standard parts. The speed and
direction of the Belt can be adjusted using the Controller or the Hammer's Config tool.
If the Belt itself is in motion while in use, power usage is greatly increased.

footerData.name: Power Usage
footerData.desc: 4.25/sec at full speed and not in motion

concrete.title: Concrete
body: Concrete is a tough structural material with properties between those of Brick and Iron. It is stronger and less malleable than the former, more malleable and more expensive than the latter. Concrete does not corrode in rain.
concrete.rawBody:
Concrete is a tough structural material with properties between those of Brick and Iron. It
is stronger and less malleable than the former, more malleable and more expensive than the
latter. Concrete does not corrode in rain.

footerData.name: Recipe
footerData.desc: Diamond, Flint, Quartz, Sand, Stone, Water

foundation.title: Foundation
body:
A Foundation is a form of concrete used as a stable platform to build on uneven terrain.

When the Foundation is placed and clicked, it will flatten, anchor, and align itself with the rest of the terrain. It is not recommended to rotate it along the horizontal axis or to resize the Y vector (height) since both of these will be reset.

Once placed, the Foundation cannot be moved without destroying it.

Foundations do not physically anchor if spawned during the Apocalypse GreatFreeze event.
foundation.rawBody:
A Foundation is a form of concrete used as a stable platform to build on uneven terrain.

When the Foundation is placed and clicked, it will flatten, anchor, and align itself with 
the rest of the terrain. It is not recommended to rotate it along the horizontal axis or to
resize the Y vector (height) since both of these will be reset.

Once placed, the Foundation cannot be moved without destroying it.

Foundations do not physically anchor if spawned during the Apocalypse GreatFreeze event.

scubasuit.title: ScubaSuit
body:
ScubaSuits provide an air supply underwater and provide temperature protection while under the surface. Touch with your character to wear it.

A ScubaSuit's air supply is slowly recharged in the presence of an active Respirator or in the atmosphere of Earth. An indicator light on the front shows the current air level, with green being the highest. Fully recharged ScubaSuits last about 4 minutes.
scubasuit.rawBody:
ScubaSuits provide an air supply underwater and provide temperature protection while under the
surface. Touch with your character to wear it.

A ScubaSuit's air supply is slowly recharged in the presence of an active Respirator or in the
atmosphere of Earth. An indicator light on the front shows the current air level, with green
being the highest. Fully recharged ScubaSuits last about 4 minutes.

brake.title: Brake
body:
A Brake exerts a horizontal force to slow and stop itself while active. To toggle, click on it or signal connected Polysilicon. Brake force increases with size.

Brakes connected to a Controller automatically engage when the Controller is set to 0.

In models, Brakes are loaded inactive if their color is set to "Really black".
brake.rawBody:
A Brake exerts a horizontal force to slow and stop itself while active. To toggle, click
on it or signal connected Polysilicon. Brake force increases with size.

Brakes connected to a Controller automatically engage when the Controller is set to 0.

In models, Brakes are loaded inactive if their color is set to "Really black".

paybox.title: PayBox
body:
When clicked, a PayBox transfers credits from the user's inventory to a connected Bank and emits a signal of the player's name if the operation is successful. The PayBox will not work if a Bank is not connected.

Use the Hammer's Config Tool to set the amount of credits to accept.
paybox.rawBody:
When clicked, a PayBox transfers credits from the user's inventory to a connected Bank and
emits a signal of the player's name if the operation is successful. The PayBox will not
work if a Bank is not connected.

Use the Hammer's Config Tool to set the amount of credits to accept.

pulsedrive.title: PulseDrive
body:
A PulseDrive is a type of spaceship engine, converting energy to force.

The PulseDrive offers a good balance of speed, weight capacity, and efficiency, while also emitting no particle trails and little noise but has very slow acceleration. Maximum velocity varies greatly while operating.
pulsedrive.rawBody:
A PulseDrive is a type of spaceship engine, converting energy to force.

The PulseDrive offers a good balance of speed, weight capacity, and efficiency, while also
emitting no particle trails and little noise but has very slow acceleration. Maximum velocity 
varies greatly while operating.

speedwalk.title: SpeedWalk
body: While powered, SpeedWalks increase the movement speed of any player walking upon them.
speedwalk.rawBody: While powered, SpeedWalks increase the movement speed of any player walking upon them.

y.title: Y
body: Y is an extremely valuable material which is both the lightest and most resizable in the game, becoming entirely massless when connected to other parts. It also has similar strength to Eridanium, and does not cast shadows.
y.rawBody:
Y is an extremely valuable material which is both the lightest and most resizable in the
game, becoming entirely massless when connected to other parts. It also has similar 
strength to Eridanium, and does not cast shadows.

footerData.name: Obtained
footerData.desc: Transporting ExoticMatter through hyperspace close to a star

trampoline.title: Trampoline
body:
Trampolines launch players and bots into the air when walked upon. The bounce height is increased by making the Trampoline thicker (no further effect past 6 studs). They do not work if any dimension is larger than 20.

Like Rubber, Trampolines cause no fall damage when landed on.
trampoline.rawBody:
Trampolines launch players and bots into the air when walked upon. The bounce height is
increased by making the Trampoline thicker (no further effect past 6 studs). They do not
work if any dimension is larger than 20.

Like Rubber, Trampolines cause no fall damage when landed on.

endgame.title: Endgame
body:
When clicked on by 4 different players with the Officer rank, the Endgame detonates, blowing up the Earth. Shortly afterward, the server will restart with a new world seed.

Alternatively, use the Hammer's Config tool to set the Endgame to inverse mode, which will instead set the world clock back up to 500 years when activated. The click votes will reset if the mode is changed.

It cannot be detonated in space, and clears any entries if not clicked for 60 seconds.
endgame.rawBody:
When clicked on by 4 different players with the Officer rank, the Endgame detonates, blowing 
up the Earth. Shortly afterward, the server will restart with a new world seed.

Alternatively, use the Hammer's Config tool to set the Endgame to inverse mode, which will 
instead set the world clock back up to 500 years when activated. The click votes will reset 
if the mode is changed.

It cannot be detonated in space, and clears any entries if not clicked for 60 seconds.

footerData.name: Recipe
footerData.desc: Amethyst, Ashes, DeuteriumCap, Plutonium, Titanium, Warhead, Warhead, Warhead, Warhead

botspawn.title: BotSpawn
body:
BotSpawns spawn a new Automaton when signaled or clicked (unless there are 8 or more Automatons already owned by the BotSpawn's owner). The BotSpawn is consumed in the process.

See the Bots help page for more information on Automatons.
botspawn.rawBody:
BotSpawns spawn a new Automaton when signaled or clicked (unless there are 8 or more Automatons
already owned by the BotSpawn's owner). The BotSpawn is consumed in the process.

See the Bots help page for more information on Automatons.

sportball.title: SportBall
body:
SportBalls have different characteristics based on the ammo type used. Click in any direction to throw the SportBall, which will be removed from your inventory.

Players can deflect SportBalls using a Pitchfork.

SportBall Ammunitions (load an ammo by using the Ammo button in Produce GUI):

-Default: Volleyball, gently thrown.

-Leaves: Basketball, bouncy.

-Cotton: Baseball, thrown with a shallow arc.

-Rubber: Dodgeball, damages players when caught at speed.

-Stone: Bowling ball, damages players when caught at speed, heavy and non-bouncy.

-Sand: Sandbag, resists bouncing or rolling.
sportball.rawBody:
SportBalls have different characteristics based on the ammo type used. Click in any 
direction to throw the SportBall, which will be removed from your inventory.

Players can deflect SportBalls using a Pitchfork.

SportBall Ammunitions (load an ammo by using the Ammo button in Produce GUI):

-Leaves: Basketball, bouncy.

-Cotton: Baseball, thrown with a shallow arc.

-Rubber: Dodgeball, damages players when caught at speed.

-Stone: Bowling ball, damages players when caught at speed, heavy and non-bouncy.

-Sand: Sandbag, resists bouncing or rolling.

water.title: Water
body:
Water is a liquid substance.

When a Container of Water is exposed to Firebox smoke, Acid condenses in a second, empty Container attached to the Water Container.

See the "Faucet" page to see what effects this substance has when released through a Faucet.

attached to the Water Container.

footerData.desc: Setting Containers in the ocean, springs, Derrick drilling, melting Ice, Asteroid Fumaroles

nitroglycerin.title: Nitroglycerin
body:
Nitroglycerin is a highly unstable liquid. Containers of at least 10 Nitroglycerin, as well as droplets, explode from hard impacts.

See the "Faucet" page to see what effects this substance has when released through a Faucet.

body:

See the "Faucet" page to see what effects this substance has when released through a Faucet.

oil.title: Oil
body:
Oil is crude petroleum used chiefly as an ingredient in recipes. It cannot be attached to parts, and it eventually evaporates unless in a Crate or Factory.

When launched by a Catapult, Oil is set on fire.
oil.rawBody:
Oil is crude petroleum used chiefly as an ingredient in recipes. It cannot be attached to

When launched by a Catapult, Oil is set on fire.

footerData.name: Obtained
footerData.desc: Derrick drilling, small amounts from using Harvest on OilRocks

acid.title: Acid
body:
Acid is a corrosive liquid which eats through many types of parts. Containers of Acid destroy any loose part on contact, at the cost of 1 unit each.

See the "Faucet" page to see what effects this substance has when released through a Faucet.

protaliumoxide.title: ProtaliumOxide
body:
ProtaliumOxide is a glowing liquid derived from Protalium. Containers of ProtaliumOxide provide large amounts of energy to connected energy cells.

See the "Faucet" page to see what effects this substance has when released through a Faucet.
protaliumoxide.rawBody:
ProtaliumOxide is a glowing liquid derived from Protalium. Containers of ProtaliumOxide provide

gas.title: Gas
body:
Gas is a flammable gas used as fuel for Engines, FlameThrowers, Ramjets, Turbofans, and Turboshafts. When used as Engine fuel, it is superior to Diesel in both efficiency and top speed.

See the "Faucet" page to see what effects this substance has when released through a Faucet.
gas.rawBody:

Turboshafts. When used as Engine fuel, it is superior to Diesel in both efficiency and top 
speed.

See the "Faucet" page to see what effects this substance has when released through a Faucet.

ammo.title: Ammo
body:
Ammo is a supply of ammunition for Guns, Launchers, Cannons, and ActiveDefenses. In its part form, Ammo explodes when set on fire and despawns after 5 minutes. Insert the Ammo part into a Container to preserve it indefinitely.

See the "Faucet" page to see what effects this substance has when released through a Faucet.
ammo.rawBody:
Ammo is a supply of ammunition for Guns, Launchers, Cannons, and ActiveDefenses. In its part form, Ammo
explodes when set on fire and despawns after 5 minutes. Insert the Ammo part into a Container to preserve
it indefinitely.

See the "Faucet" page to see what effects this substance has when released through a Faucet.

coal.title: Coal
body:
Coal is a solid fossil fuel which burns for a very long time. It is an excellent fuel for Fireboxes and the only fuel for PowerPlants.

See the "Faucet" page to see what effects this substance has when released through a Faucet.

Coal is a solid fossil fuel which burns for a very long time. It is an excellent fuel for Fireboxes and the

footerData.desc: Coal Mines, Derrick drilling, Feeding Diesel into a ChemicalPlant

toxin.title: Toxin
body:
Toxin is a poisonous gas which is heavier than air and poisons players who don't take shelter.

See the "Faucet" page to see what effects this substance has when released through a Faucet.
toxin.rawBody:

steam.title: Steam
body:
Steam is a gas produced when a Container of Water is boiled using a connected Firebox. It is used as the "fuel" for SteamEngines.

See the "Faucet" page to see what effects this substance has when released through a Faucet.

footerData.name: Obtained
footerData.desc: Geysers, Derrick drilling, Boiling Containers of Water

diesel.title: Diesel
body:
Diesel is a fossil fuel produced by Oil-bearing Derricks, which convert Oil into Diesel when a Container is attached. Diesel is used as fuel in Engines, Turbofans, Turboshafts, Ramjets, and Rockets.

See the "Faucet" page to see what effects this substance has when released through a Faucet.

a Container is attached. Diesel is used as fuel in Engines, Turbofans, Turboshafts, Ramjets, and 
Rockets.

See the "Faucet" page to see what effects this substance has when released through a Faucet.

footerData.name: Obtained
footerData.desc: Derrick drilling, Feeding Gas into a ChemicalPlant, Inserting Leaves into a Refinery

compressor.title: Compressor
body:
Compressors use energy to take in air from the environment and compress it into a Container, or remove air to create a vacuum when set to Mode 1 using the Hammer's Config tool. The Compressor will activate if the Container's capacity drops below 80% and shut off when it reaches 100%.

Compressors only work at low to medium altitudes in a planet's atmosphere. They will not take in air from toxic atmospheres.

See the "CompressedAir" and "Vacuum" pages for more information on these substances.
compressor.rawBody:
Compressors use energy to take in air from the environment and compress it into a Container, or 
remove air to create a vacuum when set to Mode 1 using the Hammer's Config tool. The Compressor
will activate if the Container's capacity drops below 80% and shut off when it reaches 100%.

Compressors only work at low to medium altitudes in a planet's atmosphere. They will not take in
air from toxic atmospheres.

See the "CompressedAir" and "Vacuum" pages for more information on these substances.

air.title: Air
body:
Air, in terms of Container substances, is a gas obtained by using a Compressor.

See the "Faucet" page to see what effects this substance has when released through a Faucet.
air.rawBody:
Air, in terms of Container substances, is a gas obtained by using a Compressor.

See the "Faucet" page to see what effects this substance has when released through a Faucet.

vacuum.title: Vacuum
body:
Vacuum, in terms of Container substances, is the result of using a Compressor to suck all the air out. Vacuum does nothing in space.

See the "Faucet" page to see what effects this substance has when released through a Faucet.
vacuum.rawBody:
Vacuum, in terms of Container substances, is the result of using a Compressor to suck all the
air out. Vacuum does nothing in space.

See the "Faucet" page to see what effects this substance has when released through a Faucet.

rules.title: Rules
body:
**SCARLET SKIES NO-NOS**

Any of these actions may result in a kick or permanent ban from Scarlet Skies.

1. Using any kind of hack, cheat, script or exploit for absolutely any purpose.

2. Using alternate accounts to abuse game features.

3. Purposely slowing down the server by spamming parts or creating lag machines.

4. Using a glitch or bug in the game to fly, obtain resources, or for any other advantage.

5. Breaking Event rules, cheating, or purposely hampering teammates during Events. 

6. Creating or displaying any form of inappropriate content.

7. Griefing, vandalizing, destroying property, stealing, antagonizing, or trolling
in the Safe BaseCenter area or griefing of other Secured parts. Above all, you will be judged by your kindness, honesty, and care for people besides yourself.
rules.rawBody:
SCARLET SKIES NO-NOS

<font color="rgb(255,40,40)">Any of these actions may result in a kick or permanent ban from Scarlet Skies.</font>

1. Using any kind of hack, cheat, script or exploit for absolutely any purpose.

2. Using alternate accounts to abuse game features.

3. Purposely slowing down the server by spamming parts or creating lag machines.

4. Using a glitch or bug in the game to fly, obtain resources, or for any other advantage.

5. Breaking Event rules, cheating, or purposely hampering teammates during Events. 

6. Creating or displaying any form of inappropriate content.

7. Griefing, vandalizing, destroying property, stealing, antagonizing, or trolling
in the Safe BaseCenter area or griefing of other Secured parts. Above all, you will 
be judged by your kindness, honesty, and care for people besides yourself.

configbox.title: ConfigBox
body:
ConfigBoxes apply numerical (non-text) config settings to connected parts when signaled, as if with the Hammer's Config tool.

Like Dishes, ConfigBoxes can take their instructions from signal data (property;value), and any signal not matching this format instead causes it to use the default settings (set with the Hammer's Config tool). They cannot config Converters, CMOS, ComboLocks, or parts locked by a different player.

The "property" setting refers to the property's position in the Hammer's Config menu. For example, on an Engine, use "1" for the Speed property and "2" for the Reverse property. The signal form of setting the Engine to maximum speed would be "1;5".

ConfigBoxes will flash red if the setting could not be applied.
configbox.rawBody:
ConfigBoxes apply numerical (non-text) config settings to connected parts when signaled, 
as if with the Hammer's Config tool.

Like Dishes, ConfigBoxes can take their instructions from signal data (property;value),
and any signal not matching this format instead causes it to use the default settings (set 
with the Hammer's Config tool). They cannot config Converters, CMOS, ComboLocks, or parts 
locked by a different player.

The "property" setting refers to the property's position in the Hammer's Config menu. For 
example, on an Engine, use "1" for the Speed property and "2" for the Reverse property. The
signal form of setting the Engine to maximum speed would be "1;5".

ConfigBoxes will flash red if the setting could not be applied.

hazmatsuit.title: HazmatSuit
body:
HazmatSuits provide complete protection against Acid, LiquidNitrogen, toxic Firearm bullets, and toxic plants.

HazmatSuits do not protect against Toxin gas.
hazmatsuit.rawBody:
HazmatSuits provide complete protection against Acid, LiquidNitrogen, toxic Firearm bullets,
and toxic plants.

HazmatSuits do not protect against Toxin gas.

footerData.name: Uses
footerData.desc: Liquid Chemical Protection, Toxic Bullet Protection

mapper.title: Mapper
body:
Mappers provide alternative displays on the map (located in the Help menu) when connected to a powered Radar near the player. Mappers require no additional power. Use the Hammer's Config tool to set the map mode.

Map Modes:

1: Altitude View
2: Night View
3: Infrared View
4: Player View
5: Part Density View

Mappers provide alternative displays on the map (located in the Help menu) when connected
to a powered Radar near the player. Mappers require no additional power. Use the Hammer's
Config tool to set the map mode.

Map Modes:

1: Altitude View
2: Night View
3: Infrared View
4: Player View
5: Part Density View

shovel.title: Shovel
body:
Shovels are used for locating and digging up buried treasure, which can be any tool or standard part in the game (though higher-value items are much rarer).

A light on the Shovel's handle will appear if an item is detected; this only works near the ground or ocean. Click to dig up the item from the ground or seafloor.
shovel.rawBody:
Shovels are used for locating and digging up buried treasure, which can be any tool or standard 
part in the game (though higher-value items are much rarer).

A light on the Shovel's handle will appear if an item is detected; this only works near the
ground or ocean. Click to dig up the item from the ground or seafloor.

lithiumcell.title: LithiumCell
body:
LithiumCells store generated energy for use in Lights, Motors, and various other electrically powered parts. All power circuits require use of a LithiumCell or some other type of energy cell.

Resize the LithiumCell larger to increase the storage capacity. LithiumCells discharge rapidly when exposed to a very cold atmosphere, and will slowly discharge over time in all other cases.

LithiumCells have 10x the energy density of PowerCells but can cause fires if destroyed with at least 10% charge remaining. They also self-discharge at twice the rate of PowerCells.

When a LithiumCell is completely discharged, it cannot be recharged for 12 seconds.
lithiumcell.rawBody:
LithiumCells store generated energy for use in Lights, Motors, and various other electrically powered 
parts. All power circuits require use of a LithiumCell or some other type of energy cell.

Resize the LithiumCell larger to increase the storage capacity. LithiumCells discharge rapidly when
exposed to a very cold atmosphere, and will slowly discharge over time in all other cases.

LithiumCells have 10x the energy density of PowerCells but can cause fires if destroyed with at least
10% charge remaining. They also self-discharge at twice the rate of PowerCells.

When a LithiumCell is completely discharged, it cannot be recharged for 12 seconds.

securing.title: Securing
body:
Locking parts using the Lock menu will also Secure them (making them indestructible) under the following conditions:

-Part is within 700 studs of the Safe BaseCenter, if any. (See BaseCenter Help page) -Part is anchored.
-No Events are in progress.
-Earth Server.

Parts un-Secure themselves if they are unanchored, moved outside the Safe BaseCenter range, or if an Event starts. Only Officers can Secure parts outside the range of the Safe Basecenter range.
securing.rawBody:
Locking parts using the Lock menu will also Secure them (making them indestructible) under the 
following conditions:

-Part is within 700 studs of the Safe BaseCenter, if any. (See BaseCenter Help page)
-Part is anchored.
-No Events are in progress.
-Earth Server.

Parts un-Secure themselves if they are unanchored, moved outside the Safe BaseCenter range, or if 
an Event starts. Only Officers can Secure parts outside the range of the Safe Basecenter range.

resonator.title: Resonator
body:
Resonators act as short-range Antennas, sending signals to other Resonators of the same ID. Their transmission range depends on the size of the transmitter, with 8 studs of range for each cubic stud. Unlike Antennas, Resonators do not transmit energy but have a default ID. Resonator IDs are not randomized in model loads.

Attaching a MemoryChip to a Resonator will cause the MemoryChip's data to be transmitted to any receiver that moves into range. Signal the Resonator through Mode 0 Polysilicon to output the number of receivers in range through Mode 3 Polysilicon.

Use the Hammer's Config tool to set the Resonator ID.
resonator.rawBody:
Resonators act as short-range Antennas, sending signals to other Resonators of the same ID. Their 
transmission range depends on the size of the transmitter, with 8 studs of range for each cubic

not randomized in model loads.

Attaching a MemoryChip to a Resonator will cause the MemoryChip's data to be transmitted to any
receiver that moves into range. Signal the Resonator through Mode 0 Polysilicon to output the
number of receivers in range through Mode 3 Polysilicon.

Use the Hammer's Config tool to set the Resonator ID.

footerData.name: Uses
footerData.desc: Door Openers, Short Range Signaling, Railroad Switch Control, Theft Detection

ghostalum.title: Ghostalum
body: Ghostalum is a variant of Aluminium which does not collide with other parts unless spawned with no welds. Once welded to another part, Ghostalum permanently becomes noncolliding.
ghostalum.rawBody:
Ghostalum is a variant of Aluminium which does not collide with other parts unless spawned with
no welds. Once welded to another part, Ghostalum permanently becomes noncolliding.

debouncer.title: Debouncer
body:
Debouncers transfer signals like a SignalWire but refuse to pass any more signals until the cooldown ends.

Use the Config Tool to set the cooldown in seconds.
debouncer.rawBody:
Debouncers transfer signals like a SignalWire but refuse to pass any more signals until
the cooldown ends.

Use the Config Tool to set the cooldown in seconds.

barbedwire.title: BarbedWire
body:
BarbedWire damages pawns and parts with health (such as Balloons) that touch it. Though less effective than ZapWire in some cases, it is very durable and requires no power.

Like MechLimbs, BarbedWire must be unpacked by clicking after being placed. BarbedWire will only unpack if 1 stud in width and height (otherwise flashes red), and automatically unpacks when loaded in a model.
barbedwire.rawBody:
BarbedWire damages pawns and parts with health (such as Balloons) that touch it. Though
less effective than ZapWire in some cases, it is very durable and requires no power.

Like MechLimbs, BarbedWire must be unpacked by clicking after being placed. BarbedWire will
only unpack if 1 stud in width and height (otherwise flashes red), and automatically unpacks 
when loaded in a model.

servers.title: Servers
body:
Scarlet Skies takes place on two different servers. Both servers may be entered through the game lobby, but a WarpGate is needed to send players or items between them. QuantumAntennas can be used to send and receive information. Each server saves objects and player credits if there are 10000 or fewer parts and a game year of less than 2000.

Earth Server

Includes Earth, the Sun, Moon, and surrounding space. The Earth server focuses on peaceful building and cooperation, though War and other events can be voted for. Attacking or griefing without consent is NOT allowed on the Earth server.

Space Server

Your colony ship, one of thousands sent to distant exoplanets of similar mass to Earth, has arrived at its destination. Unfortunately, during the centuries-long journey, Rogues have already reached the system using HyperDrives and deployed defenses in order to prevent human habiation. Any biological life you find on this planet was brought here by the Rogues, perhaps as part of a malfunctioning terraforming program.

Attacking or griefing without consent IS allowed on the Space server.

When started in Archive mode, the Space server loads an old Earth server world instead of the regular Space solar system. Changes will NOT save in this mode, but griefing is still allowed and loaded parts will not be Secured.

chemicalplant.title: ChemicalPlant
body:
ChemicalPlants transform certain substances into other substances, using energy in the process. To operate, power the ChemicalPlant, directly connect a Container of the feedstock, and indirectly connect (through Pipe, Valve, etc.) a second Container for the output. Processes differ in efficiency and power usage.

**LIST OF CHEMICALPLANT PROCESSES**

Gas -> Diesel
Diesel -> Coal
Coal -> Polish
Acid -> Nitroglycerin
Nitroglycerin -> Aramid
Water -> CompressedAir
HeatedWater -> Hydrogen
Steam -> Vacuum (In atmosphere only)

oxygencandle.title: OxygenCandle
body: OxygenCandles create a 150-stud radius pocket of breathable air when set on fire. Like Magnesium, signaling the OxygenCandle will cause it to ignite. They burn for roughly 10 minutes each and cannot be reused if the fire is extinguished.
oxygencandle.rawBody:
OxygenCandles create a 150-stud radius pocket of breathable air when set on fire. Like Magnesium,
signaling the OxygenCandle will cause it to ignite. They burn for roughly 10 minutes each and cannot
be reused if the fire is extinguished.

quantumantenna.title: QuantumAntenna
body:
QuantumAntennas transmit signals to other QuantumAntennas of the same ID in the opposite server, meaning a device in the Earth server can signal the Space server and vice versa. Use the Hammer's Config tool to set the QuantumAntenna ID. Unlike Antennas, QuantumAntennas cannot transfer energy.

Global bandwidth for QuantumAntennas is limited, and each QuantumAntenna has a cooldown depending on how much data is sent at once (maximum 400 characters). Failed transmission attempts will be outputted through Mode 3 Polysilicon along with the reason for the failure (reason;signal).
quantumantenna.rawBody:

meaning a device in the Earth server can signal the Space server and vice versa. Use the Hammer's 
Config tool to set the QuantumAntenna ID. Unlike Antennas, QuantumAntennas cannot transfer energy.

outputted through Mode 3 Polysilicon along with the reason for the failure (reason;signal).

fist.title: Fist
body:
Fist/Grab is a tool which every player spawns with, acting as a melee weapon against players, bots, and extremely weak parts such as Sand. Touch to the target and click to swing a punch. This interrupts enemy weapon reload and also stuns (unless the user is stunned). 

Select Fist/Grab (without clicking) over a loose part to gently pull it along.
fist.rawBody:
Fist/Grab is a tool which every player spawns with, acting as a melee weapon against players, bots,
and extremely weak parts such as Sand. Touch to the target and click to swing a punch. This interrupts
enemy weapon reload and also stuns (unless the user is stunned). 

Select Fist/Grab (without clicking) over a loose part to gently pull it along.

drag.title: Drag
body:
Drag is a tool which every player spawns with. With the Drag tool selected, click and hold an unlocked part to move it around.

**HOTKEYS**

R = Rotate Y
T = Rotate Z
Y = Rotate X
G = Teleport Last Part To Last Position
F = Insert (such as inserting Uranium into a Reactor)
drag.rawBody:
Drag is a tool which every player spawns with. With the Drag tool selected, click and hold an unlocked 
part to move it around.

HOTKEYS

R = Rotate Y
T = Rotate Z
Y = Rotate X
G = Teleport Last Part To Last Position
F = Insert (such as inserting Uranium into a Reactor)

harvest.title: Harvest
body:
Harvest is a tool which every player spawns with.

With the Harvest tool selected, click on a nearby tree, cactus, crystal, sandy terrain, stone terrain, ice terrain, resource mine, or plant to harvest it.
harvest.rawBody:
Harvest is a tool which every player spawns with.

With the Harvest tool selected, click on a nearby tree, cactus, crystal, sandy terrain, stone
terrain, ice terrain, resource mine, or plant to harvest it.

keypad.title: Keypad
body:
Keypads provide a convenient way to create control signals. Each number button clicked will output a signal of that number both directly and through the corresponding Polysilicon.

Keypad Modes:

0: Single-key operation.
1: Multi-key operation. Does not output to Polysilicon.
2: Takes input from key presses on a connected Seat or SteeringSeat, like a Button. No GUI.
3: Same as 2, but letter keys activate certain Polysilicon modes instead (as explained below).

Mode 3 Keybinds:

Q -> Mode 0 Polysilicon
E -> Mode 1 Polysilicon
R -> Mode 2 Polysilicon
T -> Mode 3 Polysilicon
F -> Mode 4 Polysilicon
G -> Mode 5 Polysilicon
Z -> Mode 6 Polysilicon
X -> Mode 7 Polysilicon
C -> Mode 8 Polysilicon
V -> Mode 9 Polysilicon

telepipe.title: TelePipe
body:
TelePipes act as "antennas" for Pipe-carried substances instead of energy or signals. Use the Hammer's Config tool to set the TelePipe ID; substances will be transferred to other TelePipes of the same ID as if physically connected. TelePipes turn green if there is a valid connection.

Unlike energy Antennas, TelePipes have an unlimited range.
telepipe.rawBody:
TelePipes act as "antennas" for Pipe-carried substances instead of energy or signals. Use the Hammer's
Config tool to set the TelePipe ID; substances will be transferred to other TelePipes of the same ID as
if physically connected. TelePipes turn green if there is a valid connection.

Unlike energy Antennas, TelePipes have an unlimited range.

footerData.name: Uses
footerData.desc: Long Distance Pipelines, Spacecraft Air Supplies

sandstone.title: Sandstone
body: Sandstone is a cheap, relatively light material with low strength and decent malleability.
sandstone.rawBody: Sandstone is a cheap, relatively light material with low strength and decent malleability.

zapcoil.title: ZapCoil
body:
ZapCoils are powerful energy coils which are powered to produce various effects. Use the Hammer's Config tool to set the mode of operation, along with the range and power of each effect. Range and power settings increase power usage. Some ZapCoil effects will not function without enough stored energy.

**AMBIENT MODES**

0: Emits damaging electric arcs toward nearby objects in all directions.
1: Emits damaging electric arcs toward nearby objects in the direction the ZapCoil is facing.
2: Temporarily disables nearby Seekers (except those less than 12 studs away).
3: Force field which has a chance to block traces (such as Guns or lasers).
4: Projects a hologram of an image decal from a connected Sign.
5: Attracts lightning during storms. 

**SIGNAL-ACTIVATED MODES**

6: Emits a slightly less powerful electric arc toward the position signaled.
7: Repulses an object the ZapCoil is facing. Repulsed object cannot be affected again for 2 minutes.
8: Attracts an object the ZapCoil is facing. Attracted object cannot be affected again for 2 minutes.
9: Charges up and detonates. Explosion power depends on both settings and available energy.

ZapCoil arcs have no effect on directly connected parts or certain highly insulating materials such as Plastic or Rubber. Indirectly connected parts are also spared as long as they are unanchored.

teflon.title: Teflon
body:
Teflon is a slippery material that resists 90% of touch detections. This means that it has a high chance of being ignored by cannonballs, blades, TouchTriggers, Foam, Crates, or any other item which is affected by physical contact.

Teflon is also immune to fire and Acid.

chance of being ignored by cannonballs, blades, TouchTriggers, Foam, Crates, or any other item 
which is affected by physical contact.

Teflon is also immune to fire and Acid.

recycler.title: Recycler
body: Recyclers consume and destroy any unwelded part while powered. The sell value of the part will be given to the nearest nearby player, if any.
recycler.rawBody:
Recyclers consume and destroy any unwelded part while powered. The sell value of the part will
be given to the nearest nearby player, if any.

heatsuit.title: HeatSuit
body:
HeatSuits provide complete protection against fire and ambient heat.

HeatSuits do not protect against focused heat-related attacks such as FlameThrowers or BeamCannons.
heatsuit.rawBody:
HeatSuits provide complete protection against fire and ambient heat.

HeatSuits do not protect against focused heat-related attacks such as FlameThrowers or BeamCannons.

events.title: Events
body:
Events are temporary minigames which all players participate in, started by a vote of at least 60% in the Voting menu on the Earth server. A Refinery must be present in the world to begin an Event.

Once an Event has been voted for, players have 60 seconds to vote for Event settings, which change the gameplay in various ways. 50% of votes are required to enable a setting.

During an Event, the world year does not advance and parts do not save; when the Event ends, the world will be restored to the way it was before the Event.

**WAR**

Objective: Destroy all enemy BaseCenters.
Rules: Only enemy team may be attacked.
Lives: Unlimited
Average length: 1 hour

-BaseCenters are highly vulnerable to attack if located adjacent to enemy territory. Destroy them to prevent enemies from respawning - territories cannot be captured if any enemy players are present. Territory capture speed increases with the amount of territory your team owns along with 50% of what other teams own. Only Warheads can destroy non-adjacent enemy BaseCenters.

-Each player receives 30 credits/minute plus 2 credits/minute for each territory controlled. When a territory is captured, all parts within are unlocked and transferred to the attacking team's control so that they may be repurposed or sold (as long as their owner isn't nearby). Resource mining can provide yet another source of income. 

-In TripleThreat mode, three teams are created. Beware of the team furthest away, as they will often grow stronger while the other two fight amongst themselves.

-Drought mode transforms all of the ocean (except for a few patches) into land, allowing long-distance conflicts with land vehicles. All territory in this mode can be captured without seacraft.

**PVP**

Objective: Destroy more players than anyone else until the time runs out.
Rules: Any player or object may be attacked.
Lives: Unlimited
Average length: 10 minutes

-Resetting your character or dying of natural causes will cost you a point.

-Take advantage of your enemy's reload time and attack while they are vulnerable.

-Mayhem mode allows any part, including strong parts such as Eridanium, to be damaged by regular weapons. Use this to eliminate hiding places or to cause chaos.

-Catch mode spawns weapons randomly in the area, causing them to be harder to obtain but also allowing you to carry several at once.

**MACGYVER**

Objective: Reach the green goal.
Rules: No attacking allowed.
Lives: Unlimited
Average length: 15 minutes

-Don't hoard parts to yourself. Collaborate with other players to gather enough materials to make a working vehicle out of. All players win or lose together; the player who reached the goal gets no recognition.

-If you can't find a particular item, see if you can manufacture it using ingredients found in the junk pile or even from natural resources.

-Wind speed is low during MacGyver, making Sails useless.

-In WrightBros mode, the goal will be too high for some types of aircraft such as helicopters.

**COLD WAR**

Objective: Protect all of your team's BaseCenters until the time runs out.
Rules: Only enemy team may be attacked after nuclear war begins.
Lives: Unlimited
Average length: 35 minutes

-A peaceful resolution to Cold War awards the participants large sums of Credits. If you desire peace, try contacting the opposing team using a Radio.

-Attacking with non-nuclear weapons is not allowed until a BaseCenter is damaged by a Warhead, but spy drones or satellites can help gather information about your opponent's capabilities and intentions. Jamming, cyberwarfare, or other forms of indirect espionage are also permitted.

-Cold War is mainly an event for advanced players with custom models. The Nuclear MRBM and Nuclear SLBM Sub prefabs are available for those who are less experienced, although these have a limited range and are fairly complicated to use. For these reasons, Cold War is more relaxed than most Events in terms of team contribution; there's no shame in not helping.

-Although nuclear weapons can be delivered by aircraft, they are easily shot down. ICBMs - rockets which cruise through Earth orbit and drop Warheads on targets from space - are much more difficult to defend against, and even carry some resistance to Interceptors. Submarines can also be used as surprise launch platforms.

-Fizzle is the chance for Warheads to fail when detonation is attempted. The Fizzle chance goes down between 20 and 30 minutes in, so you must strike a balance as to when to launch your Warheads. Too early, and most or all of them will fizzle and be wasted; too late, and the enemy might wipe out your Warheads on the ground in a surprise attack. Warheads will also fizzle if launched into space while the Fizzle chance is still above 90%.

-Nuclear explosions high in the air emit an invisible EMP pulse which damages electronics in a very large radius. A single nuclear EMP in the right place can disarm entire salvos or wreak havoc on base systems.

**CHAMPION**

Objective: Survive until all other players are dead or until time runs out.
Rules: Any player or object may be attacked.
Lives: 1-3
Average length: 25 minutes

-Champion is for fighting, not hiding. Radioactive waste will spawn and build up around sedentary players.

-Attack the strongest players first; they will be even harder to face if your vehicle is already damaged from previous fights.

-In addition to the yellow beacons, Seekers can help to locate and hunt down enemies.

-Extra fuel and supplies can be found at abandoned bases.

**PIRACY**

Objective: Cash in the most treasures until the time runs out.
Rules: Any player or object may be attacked.
Lives: Unlimited
Average length: 30 minutes

-Ship crews are more formidable than going it alone. Credits can be donated to the captain for a larger (orreplacement) vessel, and keep in mind that the winner of Piracy can share the reward with up to three crew members.

-Treasures detach and float to the surface if their carrier ship sinks. Aim for the hull of enemy ships to sink them and easily collect the loot.

-The Squirt Gun is used to fight fires which will often break out on your ship during battles.

-In Kraken mode, mechanical squids of monstrous proportions dwell in the waters. They have a taste for both you and your enemies - heed them, or lure them toward an opponent if possible.

**SKIRMISH**

Objective: Destroy all enemy players.
Rules: Only enemy team may be attacked.
Lives: 1
Average length: 10 minutes

-Ideal Skirmish models should be made for large crews and prolonged battles. Using a regular model such as a biplane will work, but won't be as satisfying. Try structures too, such as castles and forts.

-Aristocracy mode chooses the richest players first to spawn the Skirmish model, instead of choosing entirely at random. This helps improve the quality of the model, since rich players are more likely to have custom models available.

-Vehicles loaded in Skirmish will be automatically filled with energy, fuel, and Ammo according to these rules - if the model uses a fuel (the fuel type is determined by the types of engines/motors within), the smallest Container and all Containers of the same size as the smallest will be filled with this fuel. All other Containers will be filled with Ammo. Containers with a set filter config will ignore these rules and be filled with the set substance.

-Players will slowly be killed off if they stray too far from the enemy group (or vice versa). Keep up with the battle to avoid this tragic fate.

**OUTLAW**

Objective: Destroy the Outlaw before the time runs out or before all Eternity Gems are collected.
Rules: Only enemy team may be attacked.
Lives: 1 for the outlaw, unlimited for others
Average length: 15 minutes

-In regular Outlaw, the player chosen as the outlaw (Red Team) must survive for 15 minutes against attack from everyone else in the server. The outlaw's advantage is a massive Credit income, while the advantage of Blue Team is sheer numbers.

-In Eternity War Outlaw, the outlaw spawns with the Eternity Glove and must collect all 5 Eternity Gems - the nearest of which is marked by a green icon only visible to the outlaw. There is no time limit, and Blue Team also gets a significant income. Load each Gem as ammo into the Eternity Glove using the Produce menu. The Eternity Glove's ranged attack gets more powerful with each Gem obtained. Once all 5 Gems are loaded into the Eternity Glove, the outlaw may click anywhere to commit the Snap and win the event.

-As Blue Team, obtaining Credits will be your biggest challenge, especially since Fountain income is greatly reduced. Pool Credits with other players to spawn a vehicle capable of reaching and destroying the Outlaw as quickly as possible.

-As the Outlaw, staying in one place can be dangerous. Spawn a vehicle as soon as possible, either to escape impending threats or to collect Eternity Gems. Remember that your BaseCenter has little value in this Event, so don't waste time trying to defend it.

**APOCALYPSE**

Objective: Survive until the time runs out.
Rules: Attacking players is only allowed if survival is at stake.
Lives: 1-3
Average length: 10-30 minutes

-MeteorShower Apocalypse is exactly what it sounds like - destructive meteors will rain from the skies, each of which having the power to destroy entire cities. Driving a fast land or sea vehicle can help to dodge the incoming meteors, but air vehicles will quickly be struck down. The frequency of the meteors increases as the time limit approaches.

-Singularity Apocalypse unleashes self-replicating nanobots upon the world. Too small to be seen individually, these nightmarish creations drift through the air and seek out other colonies of their kind, growing into a tornado-like swarm which devours parts in its path. As the drifting nanobots accumulate in your body, they will increasingly attempt to link up with the nanobots inside other players - with fatal results for the both of you. Stay as far as possible from other players, but beware of the main swarm. Also keep in mind that the nanobots have a much greater vertical range than horizontal.

-Annihilation Apocalypse summons Pelot, the dreaded final boss of Scarlet Skies. Though it is possible to kill Pelot, the reverse will usually happen as Pelot is armed to the teeth with unique weapons, moves incredibly fast, and is very easy to anger. Your best bet is to hide and pray that the time will run out before you're next.

-GreatFreeze Apocalypse is the most in-depth of the four, but also requires the most preparation and knowledge of the game. As the planet rapidly plunges into a new Ice Age, nearly every source of heat or electricity will freeze over or shut down. Your only hope is the ability of Bogies to generate energy at very cold temperatures, allowing the construction of eternal engines - electric locomotives able to travel around a loop of Track virtually forever. This only works on Track sections the Bogie has not recently traveled upon, meaning a very long, circular railroad will be required beforehand. As a conductor, you may encounter various dangers on your journey - derailments, collisions with other locomotives, loss of power from stopping too long or traveling a recently traveled section, frostbite (from being exposed on any side to the outdoors), Track blockages, poor Track layout, and more. After the initial snowstorm ends, New Eden - a spot of warmth marked by red particles - may appear anywhere on the map, where survival is possible without a train.

-Undying adds an extra hazard to the selected Apocalypse in the form of zombies, the reanimated corpses of killed players. These aren't your typical slow, lumbering undead - they run three times as fast as a player, can leap over buildings, and kill with a single touch, instantly converting the victim into another zombie.

**GAUNTLET**

Objective: Prevent Red Team from reaching the goal until the time runs out.
Rules: Only enemy team may be attacked.
Lives: Unlimited
Average length: 20 minutes

-Blue Team members start out with 10x as many Credits as Red Team, but receive no automatic income. Capturing Fountains is vital to keeping up a long-term defense. In Intense mode, however, both teams start with the same amount.

-The terrain within the gauntlet may be flat or rough. This can pose a challenge to some kinds of vehicles which may be very fast on flat ground but are mediocre at climbing slopes.

-Any Blue Team parts in the gauntlet will quickly be destroyed.

-The gauntlet has a height limit of 1000 studs. Keep this in mind when flying aircraft on Red Team.

**ANARCHY**

Objective: Survive until half of all players are out.
Rules: None.
Lives: 1-3
Average length: 30 minutes

-Anarchy has no specific strategies or additional rules.
