<font color="rgb(255,255,0)">Objective: Destroy more players than anyone else until the time runs out.</font>
<font color="rgb(255,255,0)">Rules: Any player or object may be attacked.</font>
<font color="rgb(255,255,0)">Lives: Unlimited</font>
<font color="rgb(255,255,0)">Average length: 10 minutes</font>

-Resetting your character or dying of natural causes will cost you a point.

-Take advantage of your enemy's reload time and attack while they are vulnerable.

-Mayhem mode allows any part, including strong parts such as Eridanium, to be damaged by regular
weapons. Use this to eliminate hiding places or to cause chaos.

-Catch mode spawns weapons randomly in the area, causing them to be harder to obtain but also allowing
you to carry several at once.

MACGYVER

<font color="rgb(255,255,0)">Objective: Reach the green goal.</font>
<font color="rgb(255,255,0)">Rules: No attacking allowed.</font>
<font color="rgb(255,255,0)">Lives: Unlimited</font>
<font color="rgb(255,255,0)">Average length: 15 minutes</font>

-Don't hoard parts to yourself. Collaborate with other players to gather enough materials to make a working
vehicle out of. All players win or lose together; the player who reached the goal gets no recognition.

-If you can't find a particular item, see if you can manufacture it using ingredients found in the junk
pile or even from natural resources.

-Wind speed is low during MacGyver, making Sails useless.

-In WrightBros mode, the goal will be too high for some types of aircraft such as helicopters.

COLD WAR

<font color="rgb(255,255,0)">Objective: Protect all of your team's BaseCenters until the time runs out.</font>
<font color="rgb(255,255,0)">Rules: Only enemy team may be attacked after nuclear war begins.</font>
<font color="rgb(255,255,0)">Lives: Unlimited</font>
<font color="rgb(255,255,0)">Average length: 35 minutes</font>

-A peaceful resolution to Cold War awards the participants large sums of Credits. If you desire peace, try
contacting the opposing team using a Radio.

-Attacking with non-nuclear weapons is not allowed until a BaseCenter is damaged by a Warhead, but spy drones 
or satellites can help gather information about your opponent's capabilities and intentions. Jamming, cyberwarfare, 
or other forms of indirect espionage are also permitted.

-Cold War is mainly an event for advanced players with custom models. The Nuclear MRBM and Nuclear SLBM Sub 
prefabs are available for those who are less experienced, although these have a limited range and are fairly 
complicated to use. For these reasons, Cold War is more relaxed than most Events in terms of team contribution;
there's no shame in not helping.

-Although nuclear weapons can be delivered by aircraft, they are easily shot down. ICBMs - rockets which cruise
through Earth orbit and drop Warheads on targets from space - are much more difficult to defend against, and 
even carry some resistance to Interceptors. Submarines can also be used as surprise launch platforms.

-Fizzle is the chance for Warheads to fail when detonation is attempted. The Fizzle chance goes down between 20
and 30 minutes in, so you must strike a balance as to when to launch your Warheads. Too early, and most or all
of them will fizzle and be wasted; too late, and the enemy might wipe out your Warheads on the ground in a
surprise attack. Warheads will also fizzle if launched into space while the Fizzle chance is still above 90%.

-Nuclear explosions high in the air emit an invisible EMP pulse which damages electronics in a very large
radius. A single nuclear EMP in the right place can disarm entire salvos or wreak havoc on base systems.

CHAMPION

<font color="rgb(255,255,0)">Objective: Survive until all other players are dead or until time runs out.</font>
<font color="rgb(255,255,0)">Rules: Any player or object may be attacked.</font>
<font color="rgb(255,255,0)">Lives: 1-3</font>
<font color="rgb(255,255,0)">Average length: 25 minutes</font>

-Champion is for fighting, not hiding. Radioactive waste will spawn and build up around sedentary players.

-Attack the strongest players first; they will be even harder to face if your vehicle is already damaged
from previous fights.

-In addition to the yellow beacons, Seekers can help to locate and hunt down enemies.

-Extra fuel and supplies can be found at abandoned bases.

PIRACY

<font color="rgb(255,255,0)">Objective: Cash in the most treasures until the time runs out.</font>
<font color="rgb(255,255,0)">Rules: Any player or object may be attacked.</font>
<font color="rgb(255,255,0)">Lives: Unlimited</font>
<font color="rgb(255,255,0)">Average length: 30 minutes</font>

-Ship crews are more formidable than going it alone. Credits can be donated to the captain for a larger 
(orreplacement) vessel, and keep in mind that the winner of Piracy can share the reward with up to three 
crew members.

-Treasures detach and float to the surface if their carrier ship sinks. Aim for the hull of enemy ships
to sink them and easily collect the loot.

-The Squirt Gun is used to fight fires which will often break out on your ship during battles.

-In Kraken mode, mechanical squids of monstrous proportions dwell in the waters. They have a taste for
both you and your enemies - heed them, or lure them toward an opponent if possible.

SKIRMISH

<font color="rgb(255,255,0)">Objective: Destroy all enemy players.</font>
<font color="rgb(255,255,0)">Rules: Only enemy team may be attacked.</font>
<font color="rgb(255,255,0)">Lives: 1</font>
<font color="rgb(255,255,0)">Average length: 10 minutes</font>

-Ideal Skirmish models should be made for large crews and prolonged battles. Using a regular model such
as a biplane will work, but won't be as satisfying. Try structures too, such as castles and forts.

-Aristocracy mode chooses the richest players first to spawn the Skirmish model, instead of choosing entirely
at random. This helps improve the quality of the model, since rich players are more likely to have custom
models available.

-Vehicles loaded in Skirmish will be automatically filled with energy, fuel, and Ammo according to these
rules - if the model uses a fuel (the fuel type is determined by the types of engines/motors within), the 
smallest Container and all Containers of the same size as the smallest will be filled with this fuel. All
other Containers will be filled with Ammo. Containers with a set filter config will ignore these rules and be
filled with the set substance.

-Players will slowly be killed off if they stray too far from the enemy group (or vice versa). Keep up with
the battle to avoid this tragic fate.

OUTLAW

<font color="rgb(255,255,0)">Objective: Destroy the Outlaw before the time runs out or before all Eternity Gems are collected.</font>
<font color="rgb(255,255,0)">Rules: Only enemy team may be attacked.</font>
<font color="rgb(255,255,0)">Lives: 1 for the outlaw, unlimited for others</font>
<font color="rgb(255,255,0)">Average length: 15 minutes</font>

-In regular Outlaw, the player chosen as the outlaw (Red Team) must survive for 15 minutes against attack
from everyone else in the server. The outlaw's advantage is a massive Credit income, while the advantage
of Blue Team is sheer numbers.

-In Eternity War Outlaw, the outlaw spawns with the Eternity Glove and must collect all 5 Eternity Gems - the
nearest of which is marked by a green icon only visible to the outlaw. There is no time limit, and Blue Team
also gets a significant income. Load each Gem as ammo into the Eternity Glove using the Produce menu. The 
Eternity Glove's ranged attack gets more powerful with each Gem obtained. Once all 5 Gems are loaded into
the Eternity Glove, the outlaw may click anywhere to commit the Snap and win the event.

-As Blue Team, obtaining Credits will be your biggest challenge, especially since Fountain income is greatly
reduced. Pool Credits with other players to spawn a vehicle capable of reaching and destroying the Outlaw as
quickly as possible.

-As the Outlaw, staying in one place can be dangerous. Spawn a vehicle as soon as possible, either to escape
impending threats or to collect Eternity Gems. Remember that your BaseCenter has little value in this Event,
so don't waste time trying to defend it.

APOCALYPSE

<font color="rgb(255,255,0)">Objective: Survive until the time runs out.</font>
<font color="rgb(255,255,0)">Rules: Attacking players is only allowed if survival is at stake.</font>
<font color="rgb(255,255,0)">Lives: 1-3</font>
<font color="rgb(255,255,0)">Average length: 10-30 minutes</font>

-MeteorShower Apocalypse is exactly what it sounds like - destructive meteors will rain from the skies, each
of which having the power to destroy entire cities. Driving a fast land or sea vehicle can help to dodge the
incoming meteors, but air vehicles will quickly be struck down. The frequency of the meteors increases as the
time limit approaches.

-Singularity Apocalypse unleashes self-replicating nanobots upon the world. Too small to be seen individually,
these nightmarish creations drift through the air and seek out other colonies of their kind, growing into a 
tornado-like swarm which devours parts in its path. As the drifting nanobots accumulate in your body, they 
will increasingly attempt to link up with the nanobots inside other players - with fatal results for the both 
of you. Stay as far as possible from other players, but beware of the main swarm. Also keep in mind that the 
nanobots have a much greater vertical range than horizontal.

-Annihilation Apocalypse summons Pelot, the dreaded final boss of Scarlet Skies. Though it is possible to kill 
Pelot, the reverse will usually happen as Pelot is armed to the teeth with unique weapons, moves incredibly fast, 
and is very easy to anger. Your best bet is to hide and pray that the time will run out before you're next.

-GreatFreeze Apocalypse is the most in-depth of the four, but also requires the most preparation and knowledge of 
the game. As the planet rapidly plunges into a new Ice Age, nearly every source of heat or electricity will 
freeze over or shut down. Your only hope is the ability of Bogies to generate energy at very cold temperatures, 
allowing the construction of eternal engines - electric locomotives able to travel around a loop of Track virtually 
forever. This only works on Track sections the Bogie has not recently traveled upon, meaning a very long, circular 
railroad will be required beforehand. As a conductor, you may encounter various dangers on your journey - derailments, 
collisions with other locomotives, loss of power from stopping too long or traveling a recently traveled section, 
frostbite (from being exposed on any side to the outdoors), Track blockages, poor Track layout, and more. After the
initial snowstorm ends, New Eden - a spot of warmth marked by red particles - may appear anywhere on the map, where 
survival is possible without a train.

-Undying adds an extra hazard to the selected Apocalypse in the form of zombies, the reanimated corpses of killed
players. These aren't your typical slow, lumbering undead - they run three times as fast as a player, can leap
over buildings, and kill with a single touch, instantly converting the victim into another zombie.

GAUNTLET

<font color="rgb(255,255,0)">Objective: Prevent Red Team from reaching the goal until the time runs out.</font>
<font color="rgb(255,255,0)">Rules: Only enemy team may be attacked.</font>
<font color="rgb(255,255,0)">Lives: Unlimited</font>
<font color="rgb(255,255,0)">Average length: 20 minutes</font>

-Blue Team members start out with 10x as many Credits as Red Team, but receive no automatic income. Capturing Fountains
is vital to keeping up a long-term defense. In Intense mode, however, both teams start with the same amount.

-The terrain within the gauntlet may be flat or rough. This can pose a challenge to some kinds of vehicles which may
be very fast on flat ground but are mediocre at climbing slopes.

-Any Blue Team parts in the gauntlet will quickly be destroyed.

-The gauntlet has a height limit of 1000 studs. Keep this in mind when flying aircraft on Red Team.

ANARCHY

<font color="rgb(255,255,0)">Objective: Survive until half of all players are out.</font>
<font color="rgb(255,255,0)">Rules: None.</font>
<font color="rgb(255,255,0)">Lives: 1-3</font>
<font color="rgb(255,255,0)">Average length: 30 minutes</font>

-Anarchy has no specific strategies or additional rules.

mercury.title: Mercury
body:
Mercury is a liquid substance which is released in individual droplets from Faucets. These heavy droplets are able to store signals (from sources such as Sensors or ZapWires) and transfer them to touched objects, including other Mercury droplets.

Mercury cannot be attached to parts, and will eventually evaporate unless in a Container or Crate.
mercury.rawBody:
Mercury is a liquid substance which is released in individual droplets from Faucets. These heavy droplets are 
able to store signals (from sources such as Sensors or ZapWires) and transfer them to touched objects, including
other Mercury droplets.

Mercury cannot be attached to parts, and will eventually evaporate unless in a Container or Crate.

footerData.name: Obtained
footerData.desc: Empty Container attached to a Refinery in which freshly mined (not spawned) Sulfur is inserted

polish.title: Polish
body:
Polish is a liquid substance that, when sprayed onto parts with a Faucet, allows the part to be sold for 100% of its original value instead of the normal 75%. When sprayed on a player, that player will drop 5x as many Credits on death. 

The effect of Polish is not saved when the world is reloaded.
polish.rawBody:
Polish is a liquid substance that, when sprayed onto parts with a Faucet, allows the part to be sold for 100%
of its original value instead of the normal 75%. When sprayed on a player, that player will drop 5x as many
Credits on death. 

The effect of Polish is not saved when the world is reloaded.

aramid.title: Aramid
body:
Aramid is a liquid substance that, when sprayed onto parts with a Faucet, increases the part's strength. The strength increase is inversely proportional to the part's initial strength; weaker parts gain considerable amounts, while Titanium and stronger gains very little, if any. Aramid is also largely ineffective on parts with health (such as Engines or Hulls).

The effect of Aramid is not saved when the world is reloaded.
aramid.rawBody:
Aramid is a liquid substance that, when sprayed onto parts with a Faucet, increases the part's strength. The
strength increase is inversely proportional to the part's initial strength; weaker parts gain considerable
amounts, while Titanium and stronger gains very little, if any. Aramid is also largely ineffective on parts 
with health (such as Engines or Hulls).

The effect of Aramid is not saved when the world is reloaded.

cloudseeder.title: CloudSeeder
body:
CloudSeeders are single-use weather control devices.

Set the target weather using the Hammer's Config tool. The CloudSeeder must be brought to a very high altitude using a Rocket or any other method, where it will automatically detonate with a 50% chance to change Earth's weather to the desired setting.

**WEATHER MODES**

0: Clear
1: Partly Cloudy
2: Mostly Cloudy
3: Thunderstorm
cloudseeder.rawBody:
CloudSeeders are single-use weather control devices.

Set the target weather using the Hammer's Config tool. The CloudSeeder must be brought to a very high
altitude using a Rocket or any other method, where it will automatically detonate with a 50% chance to 
change Earth's weather to the desired setting.

WEATHER MODES

0: Clear
1: Partly Cloudy
2: Mostly Cloudy
3: Thunderstorm

airbag.title: Airbag
body:
Airbags rapidly inflate when signaled or set on fire, pushing away other parts and floating in water. Once deployed, Airbags decay after roughly 60 seconds, and are able to prevent fall damage when landed on.

The inflated size of the Airbag is affected by the initial size.
airbag.rawBody:
Airbags rapidly inflate when signaled or set on fire, pushing away other parts and floating in water. Once
deployed, Airbags decay after roughly 60 seconds, and are able to prevent fall damage when landed on.

The inflated size of the Airbag is affected by the initial size.

americium.title: Americium
body:
Americium is a radioactive metal which emits stronger radiation the larger it is resized. It constantly signals parts that are connected or touching (except Warheads) and increases the radioactive fallout of the resulting explosion when attached to a Warhead. See the "Warhead" page for details.

Connecting a Generator to Americium generates a small amount of energy. The size of the Americium also determines its power output in this application.
americium.rawBody:
Americium is a radioactive metal which emits stronger radiation the larger it is resized. It constantly 
signals parts that are connected or touching (except Warheads) and increases the radioactive fallout of 
the resulting explosion when attached to a Warhead. See the "Warhead" page for details.

Connecting a Generator to Americium generates a small amount of energy. The size of the Americium also
determines its power output in this application.

footerData.name: Uses
footerData.desc: Power Generation, Nub Repellent, Signal Source, Fallout Enhancement

footerData.name: Obtained
footerData.desc: Inserting Plutonium into a Reactor operating above 85% heat

curium.title: Curium
body:
Curium is an intensely radioactive metal. In addition to being more radioactive than any other material, Curium instantly sets fire to flammable objects on contact. When inside a Reactor, Curium is able to enrich adjacent Uranium rods above 90% power.

Connecting a Camera to Curium allows the Camera to see through the part it is facing.

Connecting a Generator to Curium generates a small amount of energy.
curium.rawBody:
Curium is an intensely radioactive metal. In addition to being more radioactive than any other
material, Curium instantly sets fire to flammable objects on contact. When inside a Reactor, Curium is 
able to enrich adjacent Uranium rods above 90% power.

Connecting a Camera to Curium allows the Camera to see through the part it is facing.

Connecting a Generator to Curium generates a small amount of energy.

footerData.name: Uses
footerData.desc: Weapon, Nub Repellent, Power Generation, Uranium Enrichment, X-Ray Vision

footerData.name: Obtained
footerData.desc: Inserting Americium into a Reactor operating above 90% heat

pulsejet.title: Pulsejet
body:
Pulsejets produce thrust when connected to a supply of Gas or Diesel. They are cheaper than Turbofans and almost as fast, but have a much lower thrust force and are sensitive to both high and low altitudes, being able to achieve top speed only at optimal heights. Unlike Ramjets, Pulsejets can still run at low altitude or low speed, are resizable, and can generate power with a Generator (though far less than other engine types).

The front of a Pulsejet must be uncovered for it to function.
pulsejet.rawBody:
Pulsejets produce thrust when connected to a supply of Gas or Diesel. They are cheaper than Turbofans
and almost as fast, but have a much lower thrust force and are sensitive to both high and low altitudes,
being able to achieve top speed only at optimal heights. Unlike Ramjets, Pulsejets can still run at low 
altitude or low speed, are resizable, and can generate power with a Generator (though far less than other 
engine types).

The front of a Pulsejet must be uncovered for it to function.

builder.title: Builder
body:
Builders take parts from attached Crates and lay railroad sections at the free end of a Track the Builder is pointing toward, with a maximum range of 100 studs and a cooldown of 3 seconds. If both ends of the target Track are free, the Builder will choose the end it is nearest to.

Signal the Builder with a number code to lay a track section. The section will only be placed if there are no objects blocking the desired area and if the targeted Track is owned by the same player. Crates containing at least one of each ingredient for each section must also be connected to the Builder. The result of each placement will be outputted through Mode 3 Polysilicon as success;reason, with "success" being 1 if successful, 0 if not.

**RAIL LAYING CODES (WITH PART REQUREMENTS)**

0: Bend Left (2 Tracks, 2 Bends)
1: Bend Right (2 Tracks, 2 Bends)
2: Siding Left (3 Tracks, 2 Bends, 1 Button)
3: Siding Right (3 Tracks, 2 Bends, 1 Button)
4: Switch Left (4 Tracks, 2 Bends, 1 Button)
5: Switch Right (4 Tracks, 2 Bends, 1 Button)
6: Reversed Siding Left (4 Tracks, 2 Bends, 1 Button)
7: Reversed Siding Right (4 Tracks, 2 Bends, 1 Button)
8: Reversed Switch Left (4 Tracks, 2 Bends, 1 Button)
9: Reversed Switch Right (4 Tracks, 2 Bends, 1 Button)
Any other signal: Straight (1 Track) up to the length of the number, if valid
builder.rawBody:
Builders take parts from attached Crates and lay railroad sections at the free end of a Track
the Builder is pointing toward, with a maximum range of 100 studs and a cooldown of 3 seconds. If
both ends of the target Track are free, the Builder will choose the end it is nearest to.

Signal the Builder with a number code to lay a track section. The section will only be placed if
there are no objects blocking the desired area and if the targeted Track is owned by the same
player. Crates containing at least one of each ingredient for each section must also be connected 
to the Builder. The result of each placement will be outputted through Mode 3 Polysilicon as 
success;reason, with "success" being 1 if successful, 0 if not.

RAIL LAYING CODES (WITH PART REQUREMENTS)

0: Bend Left (2 Tracks, 2 Bends)
1: Bend Right (2 Tracks, 2 Bends)
2: Siding Left (3 Tracks, 2 Bends, 1 Button)
3: Siding Right (3 Tracks, 2 Bends, 1 Button)
4: Switch Left (4 Tracks, 2 Bends, 1 Button)
5: Switch Right (4 Tracks, 2 Bends, 1 Button)
6: Reversed Siding Left (4 Tracks, 2 Bends, 1 Button)
7: Reversed Siding Right (4 Tracks, 2 Bends, 1 Button)
8: Reversed Switch Left (4 Tracks, 2 Bends, 1 Button)
9: Reversed Switch Right (4 Tracks, 2 Bends, 1 Button)
Any other signal: Straight (1 Track) up to the length of the number, if valid

photocamera.title: PhotoCamera
body:
PhotoCameras take low-resolution snapshots when signaled.

Each snapshot taken is applied to a connected Photograph with a delay of several seconds before the image is developed and a cooldown of 60 seconds before another snapshot can be taken. Blank Photographs will be chosen over Photographs which already have an image. PhotoCameras cannot use Photographs that are locked by a different player.

When a snapshot is taken, the PhotoCamera will output a sum value through Mode 3 Polysilicon along with a list of any players captured in the snapshot. The sum value is based on the raw image data and will be different for different images. PhotoCameras have a maximum capture range of 2000 studs.

Example output: 1029530;Player1;Player2;Player3

Use the Hammer's Config tool to set the PhotoCamera's FOV. Higher FOV settings allow the PhotoCamera to capture a wider area.
photocamera.rawBody:
PhotoCameras take low-resolution snapshots when signaled.

Each snapshot taken is applied to a connected Photograph with a delay of several seconds before the
image is developed and a cooldown of 60 seconds before another snapshot can be taken. Blank Photographs 
will be chosen over Photographs which already have an image. PhotoCameras cannot use Photographs that
are locked by a different player.

When a snapshot is taken, the PhotoCamera will output a sum value through Mode 3 Polysilicon along
with a list of any players captured in the snapshot. The sum value is based on the raw image data and
will be different for different images. PhotoCameras have a maximum capture range of 2000 studs.

Example output: 1029530;Player1;Player2;Player3

Use the Hammer's Config tool to set the PhotoCamera's FOV. Higher FOV settings allow the PhotoCamera
to capture a wider area.

photograph.title: Photograph
body: Photographs display an image from a PhotoCamera when clicked. They show an orange color when the image is still developing and not yet ready to view.
photograph.rawBody:
Photographs display an image from a PhotoCamera when clicked. They show an orange color when the image
is still developing and not yet ready to view.

thermite.title: Thermite
body: Thermite burns at a very high temperature when signaled and can melt or burn most materials on contact, including high-strength materials such as Titanium and Ruby.
thermite.rawBody:
Thermite burns at a very high temperature when signaled and can melt or burn most materials on contact, 
including high-strength materials such as Titanium and Ruby.

killfloor.title: KillFloor
body:
KillFloors create an invisible zone above themselves which blocks objects and kills players on contact (except for the owner), outputting the killed player's username as a signal. Noncolliding parts attempting to infiltrate the zone will also be destroyed. KillFloors can only be activated if a ceiling owned by the same player is 100 studs or less above it and if no players, parts owned by other players, or terrain is blocking the zone. If the zone is blocked, activation will not be attempted again for roughly 60 seconds.

They will attempt to activate (if anchored and upright on a level surface) when the owner leaves the area and will deactivate when the owner returns. KillFloors deactivate if moved.
killfloor.rawBody:
KillFloors create an invisible zone above themselves which blocks objects and kills players on 
contact (except for the owner), outputting the killed player's username as a signal. Noncolliding
parts attempting to infiltrate the zone will also be destroyed. KillFloors can only be activated 
if a ceiling owned by the same player is 100 studs or less above it and if no players, parts owned 
by other players, or terrain is blocking the zone. If the zone is blocked, activation will not be 
attempted again for roughly 60 seconds.

They will attempt to activate (if anchored and upright on a level surface) when the owner leaves
the area and will deactivate when the owner returns. KillFloors deactivate if moved.

heatedwater.title: HeatedWater
body:
HeatedWater results when Water is heated or when Steam is allowed to cool. It has similar properties to Water, and it is used chiefly to produce Hydrogen in ChemicalPlants.

See the "Faucet" page to see what effects this substance has when released through a Faucet.
heatedwater.rawBody:
HeatedWater results when Water is heated or when Steam is allowed to cool. It has similar
properties to Water, and it is used chiefly to produce Hydrogen in ChemicalPlants.

See the "Faucet" page to see what effects this substance has when released through a Faucet.

footerData.name: Obtained
footerData.desc: Heating Containers of Water using Heaters/Fireboxes, Condensing Containers of Steam

hydrogen.title: Hydrogen
body:
Hydrogen is a flammable gas used as fuel for Rockets and FuelCells.

See the "Faucet" page to see what effects this substance has when released through a Faucet.
hydrogen.rawBody:
Hydrogen is a flammable gas used as fuel for Rockets and FuelCells.

See the "Faucet" page to see what effects this substance has when released through a Faucet.

fuelcell.title: FuelCell
body: FuelCells convert a connected Hydrogen supply to energy depending on demand, meaning that no Hydrogen will be consumed if the connected energy cell is already full. They operate silently and automatically.
fuelcell.rawBody:
FuelCells convert a connected Hydrogen supply to energy depending on demand, meaning that
no Hydrogen will be consumed if the connected energy cell is already full. They operate
silently and automatically.

burstwire.title: BurstWire
body: BurstWires harmlessly explode when signaled or set on fire, pushing away all connected parts and transferring the signal to them 1 second afterward.
burstwire.rawBody:
BurstWires harmlessly explode when signaled or set on fire, pushing away all connected parts 
and transferring the signal to them 1 second afterward.

funium.title: Funium
body:
Funium is a substance with incredibly high density and excellent malleability.

It has a strength between that of Iron and Titanium.
funium.rawBody:
Funium is a substance with incredibly high density and excellent malleability.

It has a strength between that of Iron and Titanium.

footerData.name: Obtained
footerData.desc: Inserting Gold into a powered Accelerator

detector.title: Detector
body:
Detectors output a signal when certain actions occur within their range. 

Outputs are in this format: posX;posY;posZ;distance;power or name;action number

Use the Hammer's Config tool to set the Detector's maximum range and what it will detect.

**LIST OF DETECTOR MODES**

0 = Any
1 = Explosion
2 = Nuclear Explosion
3 = Part Weapon Hit
4 = EnergyBomb Explosion
5 = Flak Explosion
6 = EMPBomb Explosion
7 = SingularityBomb Explosion
8 = Player Death
detector.rawBody:
Detectors output a signal when certain actions occur within their range. 

Outputs are in this format: posX;posY;posZ;distance;power or name;action number

Use the Hammer's Config tool to set the Detector's maximum range and what it will detect.

LIST OF DETECTOR MODES

0 = Any
1 = Explosion
2 = Nuclear Explosion
3 = Part Weapon Hit
4 = EnergyBomb Explosion
5 = Flak Explosion
6 = EMPBomb Explosion
7 = SingularityBomb Explosion
8 = Player Death

icbm.title: ICBM
body:
ICBMs are self-steering rocket systems able to deliver a payload to a distant target. Maximum range is 12000 studs.

Before use, 5000 Diesel must be inserted directly into the ICBM as fuel. This can be done using either a Fuel Can or a Filler. It will only accept the 5000 Diesel all at once and can neither be partially fueled nor de-fueled. ICBMs are pre-fueled during the Cold War event.

Signal the ICBM with position data (X;Y;Z) to launch toward that position. Keep in mind that it must be unwelded from the ground to take off; a red SignalWire is ideal for this purpose. Once the ICBM nears the target it will jettison, signaling connected parts with the distance to the target.

The ICBM's flight path depends on its target position. If the target is located on Earth, it will fly in a ballistic arc reaching into space and jettison during descent. If the target is located in space, it will instead fly in a half-arc and jettison just before arrival.

Like Missiles, ICBMs cannot safely carry players. Use a Rocket for this purpose.
icbm.rawBody:
ICBMs are self-steering rocket systems able to deliver a payload to a distant target. Maximum
range is 12000 studs.

Before use, 5000 Diesel must be inserted directly into the ICBM as fuel. This can be done using
either a Fuel Can or a Filler. It will only accept the 5000 Diesel all at once and can neither 
be partially fueled nor de-fueled. ICBMs are pre-fueled during the Cold War event.

Signal the ICBM with position data (X;Y;Z) to launch toward that position. Keep in mind that it
must be unwelded from the ground to take off; a red SignalWire is ideal for this purpose. Once 
the ICBM nears the target it will jettison, signaling connected parts with the distance to the 
target.

The ICBM's flight path depends on its target position. If the target is located on Earth, it
will fly in a ballistic arc reaching into space and jettison during descent. If the target
is located in space, it will instead fly in a half-arc and jettison just before arrival.

Like Missiles, ICBMs cannot safely carry players. Use a Rocket for this purpose.

footerData.name: Uses
footerData.desc: Warhead Delivery, Conventional Weapon Delivery, Online Shopping Delivery, Orbital Launches

transmission.title: Transmission
body:
Transmissions are attachments for driven Bogies which allow them to reach extremely high speeds at the cost of reduced torque. At these speeds, Bogies can derail around Bends, so Transmissions are most useful only on straight sections of Track.

Click the Transmission or use Polysilicon to enable or disable it.

SteeringSeat-pedaled Bogies cannot engage with Transmissions.

are most useful only on straight sections of Track.

Click the Transmission or use Polysilicon to enable or disable it.

SteeringSeat-pedaled Bogies cannot engage with Transmissions.

steel.title: Steel
body: Steel is a heavy metal with fairly high strength and decent malleability.
steel.rawBody: Steel is a heavy metal with fairly high strength and decent malleability.

debris.title: Debris
body: Debris is what remains of parts destroyed by explosions, Guns, or other weapons.
debris.rawBody: Debris is what remains of parts destroyed by explosions, Guns, or other weapons.

torquespring.title: TorqueSpring
body:
TorqueSprings exert a force on their hinge against any rotation from the original position.

Use the Hammer's Config tool to set the TorqueSpring's maximum torque and speed.
torquespring.rawBody:
TorqueSprings exert a force on their hinge against any rotation from the original position.

Use the Hammer's Config tool to set the TorqueSpring's maximum torque and speed.

archives.title: Archives
body:
Archives are former Earth Server worlds accessible by starting the Space Server in Archive mode, which can be selected by any player joining an empty Space Server. Changes to the Archive worlds are not saved, and griefing is allowed. Secured parts will also be unsecured.

Due to the game's many updates over the years, older Archives will contain more flaws such as corrupted part data. Archives from before September 2023 do not include the original terrain and all loaded parts in these will be anchored to prevent collapse.

Due to the game's many updates over the years, older Archives will contain more flaws such as 
corrupted part data. Archives from before September 2023 do not include the original terrain and
all loaded parts in these will be anchored to prevent collapse.

substation.title: Substation
body:
Substations distribute energy from a connected energy cell to Conduits within 1000 studs. Both the Substation and Conduits must be directly attached to the ground. This energy can be freely given or purchased using Credits from a Bank attached to each Conduit if there is also a Bank attached to the Substation. Individual players receive the same amount of total energy even if they use multiple Conduits.

Use the Hammer's Config tool to adjust the following settings:

-Free: Each subscriber receives this much/second for free.
-Paid: Each subscriber receives this much/second when paid using a Bank.
-Price: Cost per 100000 energy for paid subscribers.
substation.rawBody:

given or purchased using Credits from a Bank attached to each Conduit if there is also a Bank 
attached to the Substation. Individual players receive the same amount of total energy even if 
they use multiple Conduits.

Use the Hammer's Config tool to adjust the following settings:

-Free: Each subscriber receives this much/second for free.
-Paid: Each subscriber receives this much/second when paid using a Bank.

conduit.title: Conduit
body:
Conduits receive power from Substations within 1000 studs while directly attached to the ground.

When first spawned, the Conduit will automatically choose a nearby Substation and subscribe to its owner, thereby receiving power only from Substations owned by that player. Use the Hammer's Config tool to choose a different player to subscribe to, and to view the settings of the Substation.

Depending on their settings, some Substations provide all energy for free, while others cost Credits for some or all of their energy supply. Attach a Bank to the Conduit and insert Credits to unlock paid service. The Bank must be owned by the same player as the Conduit.
conduit.rawBody:
Conduits receive power from Substations within 1000 studs while directly attached to the ground.

When first spawned, the Conduit will automatically choose a nearby Substation and subscribe to its 
owner, thereby receiving power only from Substations owned by that player. Use the Hammer's Config 
tool to choose a different player to subscribe to, and to view the settings of the Substation.

Depending on their settings, some Substations provide all energy for free, while others cost Credits
for some or all of their energy supply. Attach a Bank to the Conduit and insert Credits to unlock
paid service. The Bank must be owned by the same player as the Conduit.

insulatedwire.title: InsulatedWire
body: InsulatedWires transmit energy like Wires but only conduct to parts owned by the same player.
insulatedwire.rawBody: InsulatedWires transmit energy like Wires but only conduct to parts owned by the same player.

firearm.title: Firearm
body:
Firearms are a wide variety of ranged hand weapons. Each firearm is identified with a code to determine its type and abilities:

category;caliber;ammo type;magazine capacity or barrels;barrel length or fuse length

Additional list entries after "length" are optional and will apply special configurations to gun-type firearms. This excludes Grenades and Rocket Launchers.

Weight is a property of Firearms which incurs penalties at certain amounts:

20+ Weight: Requires preparation time after being equipped. This increases with further weight.
50+ Weight: Requires a stationary stand to fire. Left-click to deploy the stand, unequip to retract.
80+ Weight: Cannot be stored in inventory; unequipping the Firearm will drop it on the ground.

Press R to manually reload a Firearm if the magazine is partially empty.

**CATEGORIES**

1: Muzzleloader. (Iron, Cotton, Flint) Inaccurate, slow to reload.
2: Grenade. (Iron, Cotton, Flint) Explosive grenade. Does not use SPECIALS.
3: Breechloader. (Iron, Diamond) Quick reload, accurate.
4: Revolver. (Iron, Diamond) Inaccurate, holds up to 10 shots.
5: Megagun. (Iron, Diamond, Aramid) Fires large, powerful shots. Inaccurate and slow, holds up to 10 shots.
6: Rocket Launcher. (Aluminium, Nitroglycerin) Fires explosive rockets. Slow. Does not use SPECIALS.
7: Semi-Automatic. (Titanium) Accurate.
8: Automatic. (Titanium) Rapid-firing.
9: Minigun. (Titanium, Mercury) Extremely rapid fire, inaccurate. Slow to reload.

**CALIBERS**

Higher calibers deal more damage but reduce refire rate. Grenade and rocket range is also reduced. All categories use 0-9.

**AMMO TYPES**

Ammo type can be changed after the Firearm is created by selecting the Produce GUI's Ammo button and hovering over a part.

1: (Iron) Standard shot.
2: (Copper) +Reload, -Damage
3: (Uranium) +Damage
4: (Neodymium) Ricochet shot. -Reload
5: (Magnesium) Chance to set targets on fire based on caliber. -Damage
6: (Toxin) Interrupts ranged hand weapons and drains health over time. -Damage
7: (Silicon) Concusses nearest pawn (through walls if previously hit). -Refire, -Damage
8: (Steel) Flings light objects. Reduced damage to pawns.
9: (Zaktralia) Chance to vaporize targets based on caliber. +Damage, -Reload

**MAGAZINE/BARRELS**

Number of shots before reloading.
Muzzleloaders, Breechloaders, and Rocket Launchers use 1-4 for number of barrels. Revolvers and Megaguns use 1-10.
Grenades always use 1.
All other categories use 1-100 and incur less weight and reload penalties than those above.

**LENGTHS**

Fuse length for Grenades and Rocket Launchers.
Barrel length for all other types. Longer barrels increase range.
All categories use 1-4.

**SPECIALS**

Grenades and Rocket Launchers cannot use SPECIALS.

1: Premium Rifling. (Amethyst) +Accuracy
2: Premium Sights. (Polish) +Range
3: Premium Ammo. (Gas) +Damage
4: Premium Magazine. (Jade) +Reload
5: Scatter. Fires several pellets of smaller caliber. -Refire
6: Bayonet. Melee damage to pawns. +Weight, -Accuracy
7: Hollow Point. Allows headshot bonus damage to pawns but reduces damage to parts. -Refire
8: Overpowered. Each shot has a 1% chance to break the weapon. +Damage, +Range, +Weight
9: Stripped. Requires metal (using Produce GUI's Ammo button) every 3 reloads. -Weight

wasp.title: Wasp
body:
OBJECT: WASP

Wasps are hostile flying insects which build nests.

Signal a Wasp with a position (X;Y;Z) to force it to fly there. Sensors cannot be used to do this.

Spraying a Wasp with Toxin temporarily stuns it, allowing parts to be attached.
wasp.rawBody:
OBJECT: WASP

Wasps are hostile flying insects which build nests.

Signal a Wasp with a position (X;Y;Z) to force it to fly there. Sensors cannot be used to
do this.

Spraying a Wasp with Toxin temporarily stuns it, allowing parts to be attached.

egg.title: Egg
body:
Eggs hatch into a creature after a period of time. Attaching an Egg to an active Heater will rapidly incubate it and cause it to hatch, while an attached Cooler delays the hatching indefinitely.

Eggs cannot be stored in Crates.
egg.rawBody:
Eggs hatch into a creature after a period of time. Attaching an Egg to an active Heater will rapidly
incubate it and cause it to hatch, while an attached Cooler delays the hatching indefinitely.

Eggs cannot be stored in Crates.

sentry.title: Sentry
body:
Sentries are highly advanced Rogue devices created to prevent players from approaching a Rogue-claimed planet. Their primary form consists of a satellite with an integrated energy turret and the ability to block wireless signals being sent from space to the planet. Other forms include Sentry Probes which support the main satellite from the planet's surface and Sentry Keys hidden in the subsoil which can be extracted with a Derrick if located.

Sentry satellites possess multiple remote power sources and security interlocks to ensure that only similarly intelligent machines can deactivate them. To deactivate a Sentry satellite, all of these conditions must be met:

-All Sentry Probes (if any) eliminated from the planet.
-All hostile lifeforms (if any) eliminated from the planet.
-All Hubs (if any) have been touched by a Sentry Key.
-Sentry Key armed and brought within 200 studs of the satellite. Each planet requires a specific randomly chosen method to arm the Sentry Key, which will cause it to turn green.

Possible Arming Methods:

-Reach a horizontal speed of 200 while on the planet.
-Reach a vertical speed of 500 while on the planet.
-Reach a rotational speed of 40 while on the planet.
-Reach the lowest accessible area of the planet (excluding lava).
-Use a Faucet to apply Polish while on the planet.
-Orbit the planet vertically (across the poles).

Deactivation of a Sentry satellite will attract attention from Rogue ships and cause them to begin entering the solar system.

support the main satellite from the planet's surface and Sentry Keys hidden in the subsoil which can
be extracted with a Derrick if located.

Sentry satellites possess multiple remote power sources and security interlocks to ensure that only

conditions must be met:

-Sentry Key armed and brought within 200 studs of the satellite. Each planet requires a specific 
randomly chosen method to arm the Sentry Key, which will cause it to turn green.

Possible Arming Methods:

-Use a Faucet to apply Polish while on the planet.

Deactivation of a Sentry satellite will attract attention from Rogue ships and cause them to begin
entering the solar system.

faxradio.title: FaxRadio
body: FaxRadios wirelessly transmit images from connected Photographs to other FaxRadios of the same ID, copying them to blank Photographs connected to the receiving FaxRadio. Use the Hammer's Config tool to set the FaxRadio ID. Both FaxRadios must be powered. Non-blank Photographs will not be overwritten by the receiver.
faxradio.rawBody:
FaxRadios wirelessly transmit images from connected Photographs to other FaxRadios of the
same ID, copying them to blank Photographs connected to the receiving FaxRadio. Use the 
Hammer's Config tool to set the FaxRadio ID. Both FaxRadios must be powered. Non-blank
Photographs will not be overwritten by the receiver.

jetpack.title: JetPack
body:
JetPacks consume Gas to give the wearer a mobility boost or other advantage.

Before use, 100 Gas must be inserted directly into the JetPack as fuel. This can be done using a Fuel Can, or with a Filler if the JetPack is not currently being worn. An indicator light on the front shows the current fuel level, with green being the highest. When worn, activate the JetPack using the \` (backquote) key or with the provided GUI button. JetPacks do not work underwater.

Use the Hammer's Config tool to set the JetPack's mode of operation. This can only be done when the JetPack is not being worn.

FuelCans cannot be carried while a JetPack is worn.

JetPack modes:

1: Hover. Hovers a short distance above the ground.
2: Jump. Lifts to a high altitude before gently descending.
3: Speed Boost. Increases run speed.
4: Kamikaze. Detonates. Blast radius depends on fuel level. Cannot be used in the Safe Zone.
